story:
About Purr Cup Cafe:

 

        Attending a cat show!     Our Holiday Card with 3/4 of our cats. 

Thanks for visiting our Indiegogo page. If you are here, you are probably like us in that nothing sounds better than drinking coffee in a room full of cats. We love cats more than almost anything, and share our home with four of them. We want to bring the joy we experience in our home to everyone, while helping homeless kitties find loving forever homes.

Purr Cup Cafe will be the perfect place for people looking for a new feline friend, those who cannot currently own cats, or those that have plenty of cats of their own, but want to meet and help more awesome kitties! For less than the price of seeing a movie, you can spend an hour in our cozy cat lounge. You can also stop by for a coffee and quick kitty pick-me-up anytime!

Purr Cup Cafe will have something for everyone; Caturday morning cartoons, cats on mats yoga class, student specials for study time,  coloring with cats, birthday parties, and much more!

Bringing this unique business to Raleigh is a big project. There is lots of planning and fundraising to be done, but we are passionate and hard working people who will do anything to make this happen. The cats--and you, the cat lovers of Raleigh, deserve it!

Here is the current timeline we are working with:

          

What We Need & What You Get:

Your contribution will help us take the first steps towards getting our doors open. With this money, we can begin searching for the purrrrfect location, secure a lease, and transform our space into an awesome spot for our cats and our customers.

Our fundraising goal of $28,800  is  just a portion of our projected startup costs. The rest of the funding will be done through bank loans, credit cards, and personal savings.

Here is a basic outline of where our indiegogo funding will go:

  • Indiegogo Perks for our Supporters: $1000
  • Securing a Lease for our Purrfect Location: $7000
  • Buildout for Cafe and Cat Lounge: $20,000
  • POS system: $800

Other expenses will include deposits for insurance and utilities, cafe equipment, inventory, and cat supplies. 

We are 100% committed to making this happen, and we are prepared to seek other funding options should we fall short of our Indiegogo goal, but your contributions will be invaluable in alleviating some of the financial burden of startup costs. With your help, we can stay on track to open our doors in Spring 2018 and start saving kitties!

To express our gratitude, we have some pretty cool perks for our supporters. We hope you think they are as exciting as we do! 

 

Risks & Challenges:

Starting a business is always risky, but we are prepared to rise to the challenge!

Our main challenges will be:

  • Funding: The startup cost involved in making Purr Cup Cafe as awesome as we want it to be for our cats and our customers is no small amount, but this Indiegogo campaign will be beyond helpful. We are ready to explore all of our options and to pursue whatever sources of funding prove most beneficial to us.
  • Finding the right lenders and landlord: While our fellow cat lovers may be familiar with the cat cafe concept, many people have not heard of this idea, despite the fact that it is sweeping the nation. It may be hard to sell the concept to lenders and the owners of commercial spaces. However, we have received great support so far, and can only assume this type of support will continue. Having lived and worked downtown for many years, we are fortunate to be very well connected to the Raleigh community. Raleigh is a creative and growing city that is committed to fostering local business and we are confident we will find the right people to help us secure loans and the purrfect space.

How You Can Help:

Any contribution is greatly appreciated. Contribute whatever amount you can, and remember, contributing is not the only way you can help us meet our goal! Use the Indiegogo share tools and share our page via email and social media. 

Thanks for your support!

-Sarah, Arthur and Birdie

(And Leland, Ms. Girl, Rainbow Sherbet, and Tiny Dancer)

Learn more about us

On Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/PurrCupCafe/

On Instagram: @purrcupcafe

On the internet: http://www.purrcupcafe.com/

Via email: meow@purrcupcafe.com

Find us in the news:

http://www.newsobserver.com/news/business/artic...

http://www.wral.com/cats-and-coffee-raleigh-cou...

http://abc11.com/pets/cat-cafe-in-the-works-for-downtown-raleigh/2185346/?sf95588758=1

story:
Short Summary

Imagine a coffee house where "Cheers" meets "Friends"; a place where everybody knows your name and cares about YOUR story. That's the kind of coffee house that we want to open in the Richland area. We started with a dream, that dream became a goal, our goal is to start offering our specialty coffees and teas as well as fresh roasted coffee beans within the next 6 MONTHS! This is the next step to achieve that goal.

As an educator with Gull Lake Community Schools for over 24 years, Floy has developed strong connections with the families and businesses of the Gull Lake community.  Having grown up in the Richland area, Kim has a knowledge and pride in her community that is unsurpassed. Together they have built this dream of making Great Grounds Coffee another prestigious Richland business.  At Great Grounds we want to foster community connections and inspire kindness.  Great Grounds Coffee house  is a coffee house designed to bring a community together.

Impact

The problem right now, is when the fine people of Richland want a high quality coffee or tea, they have to travel outside of our town.  THE SOLUTION?! We will be brewing, steeping and roasting RIGHT HERE IN RICHLAND!

Please consider making a donation to help us open the doors of Great Grounds Coffee House

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this campaign is to raise $50,000! This will go toward purchasing equipment and renovating our future store front . Any money beyond our $50,000 will continue to go toward expanding our community outreach, barista education and equipment maintenance. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest obstacle at this point in time is funding. We have spend time putting together our business plan, refining it with the help of the Small Business Development Center, educating ourselves in the art of barista and applying for small business loans.  After being unable to secure enough funding due to the start up nature of our business we refocused our efforts into this crowdfunding campaign. 

We believe in our business model, our thirst to be life long learners and the natural social environment of a coffee house will lead to our businesses success. 

Supportive Rewards and Experiences

$25    Thanks A Latte: Great Grounds Coffee Magnet & 2 Free Drinks
$50    Roasted Coffee: 5 Free Drinks & 8 oz Bag of Freshly Roasted Coffee
$100    Travel Mug: Great Grounds Coffee Magnets, 10 Free Drinks, 12 oz Bag of Freshly Roasted Coffee & a Travel Mug
$150    SWAG Bag: Great Grounds Coffee Magnets, 10 Free Drinks, Travel Mug, T-Shirt ALL in a Great Grounds Tote
$200    Be Our Guest : You and a Guest are invited to join us for "Taste the Menu!" PLUS Have your name up on our Founders Wall and receive an EXCLUSIVE T-shirt with “Founder” on the back!
$250    FREE Coffee for 1 Year: Welcome to our Founders Wall, EXCLUSIVE T-shirt with "Founder" on the back PLUS 1 Free Drink a week for 52 weeks
$500    SUPER Supporter: Receive SWAG Bag, Be Our Guest Taste Menu & Free Drink for 1 Year (1 Free Drink / week for 52 weeks) Reward Packages
$1,000    Menu Item Named after You: "We will name a menu item in your honor for one full year! PLUS, Enjoy your name safe for FREE 1 time per week for an entire year! Plus Get a Free Drink 1 time / week for 52 weeks! Go up on our Founder Wall Recognition plus EXCLUSIVE T-Shirt"
$2,000    Roastmaster for the Day: You and 1 Guest get to Create your own Coffee Roast! Name it, Label it and enjoy 12 Exclusive 8 oz bags!  PLUS 1 Free Drink a week for 52 weeks & Founder Wall Recognition and EXCLUSIVE T-Shirt
$5,000    PREMIUM Patron: WOW! We are Humbled by your Support!  We will host a private event for you and up to 25 of your guests.  We will provide drinks, food, dessert and entertainment. Many other perks included:)
$10,000    HOLY CAPPUCCINO Batman: Words Can Not Begin to Describe the Gratitude we have for you!  You are making Dreams Come True. Lets Sit Down and discuss what perks we can offer you. Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

We need your help to get the word out.  We would appreciate for you to share this project with your crowd:  your office-mates, friends and families.  You can use the share tools on this page to post this to all your favorite Social Networking sites!

Thank you and Have a Blessed Day:)

story:
MEET THE TYPHOON f1 

With the Typhoon, living out your childhood dreams of flying will only be as far away as your garage.  Help us make the freedom of flying accessible to everyone. 

THE SCIENCE

Touted as a technological breakthrough, at the heart of the Typhoon is a ducted fan "hybrid" that exhibits the properties of a gyroscope where the ducted fan is magnetized, making it function as a rotor as well.  The central fan not only stabilizes the vehicle, making for easy and safe flight control, but also creates enough lift, with more than 1000 HP on tap, to take off and land vertically. 

Electromagnets located within the body of the vehicle create the oscillating magnetic fields used to interact with neodymium magnets located within the rotor itself.  These are the same proven principles used in inrunner electric motors that power everything from computer hard drives to the Tesla sports car. 

There are four corner fans that are rotatable in three dimensions and operate in a manner similar to a quadcopter drone, allowing for directional change in flight path. 

Energy will be supplied by lithium-ion batteries, and eventually fuel cells, as the technology becomes more readily available.

 PRACTICAL

Small enough to fit in your garage, the Typhoon will open a whole new world of freedom to its owner. Easily scalable-- While the Typhoon f1 is designed for a single occupant, a larger Typhoon f4, or four occupant model, would only require a one foot  increase in the radius of the main fan. 

LIFTOFF 

Unlike other offerings that require large fields or airports for take off and landing, the Typhoon can take off from your driveway.

The controls of the vehicle are similar to a modern car.  With a tug on the right steering wheel paddle, you will rise off the ground in an almost silent surge that gives you butterflies.  Push the gas pedal to go forward; push the brake pedal to stop; steer left to go left and right to go right. When you arrive at your destination, pull on the left paddle and you will descend to a smooth, computer-assisted landing. 

FLYING ROBOT 
The Typhoon is computer-controlled using a fly-by-wire system that allows for multiple flight settings: From an autonomous “Drone” mode that essentially flies itself, to a “Sport” setting that will allow for driver-inspired, multiple g-force banking turns, and everything in between.  Simply choose your preferred setting from a switch located on the steering wheel.  If you feel like you are losing control, just let go of the steering wheel and the vehicle will return to a stable hover.  Additionally, the computer will take over to ensure the safety of the occupants (i.e. proximity sensor is tripped, low batteries, unsafe maneuvers, etc…).  As a last-ditch safety measure, a rocket-launched parachute will automatically deploy. 

MANUFACTURING

Structurally similar to a Formula One race car, the Typhoon will be constructed almost entirely of carbon fiber.  

With recent advancements in the composition of specialized filaments used in 3D printing, we will now be able to employ this technology in the fabrication of the non-structural components of the vehicle. Additionally, we will use 3D printing to make molds that will be used to lay up the carbon fiber parts for the final production model.

I have been collaborating with electrical and mechanical engineers across the globe who specialize in innovative technologies, and also material engineers from MACD Engineering and Carbon Composites.




WHOM AM I?

  


I learned at an early age that if you mixed iodide crystals and ammonia, you could make a solution that, when stepped on, would go POP! 
My journey into Science began... 
While other kids in my 5th grade class were making baking soda volcanoes,  I brought in a Jacob's Ladder.  By the end of the school year, I constructed a Tesla Coil using the Jacob's Ladder and then rebuilt an old Van de Graaff generator of my teacher's so that I could impress the girls by making their hair stand up!
Soon after,  I started developing rocket fuel; singeing a few eyebrows along the way. One summer, my brother and I helped my father build an Atom Smasher in the basement.  I still remember how much those lead aprons weighed.
As the years passed, I became an avid RC modeler, where I gained the experience of working with electric motors, customizing and building my own to suit various experiments.  I guess you could say I have been an "Extreme Hobbyist" as early as I can remember. 
My college experience included studies in Aerospace Engineering with degrees in Finance and Economics.
As a published author, film producer and  designer, I have had the privilege of sharing a cup of coffee with many brilliant minds including Physicists, Astronauts Engineers and Futurists.  It is this compendium of knowledge that has guided me on a path to the doorstep of the "Typhoon".

Now, in early 2015, after decades of study and experimentation, it is time to realize this dream.

THE CAMPAIGN

The purpose of this campaign is to build a  Full scale prototype of the Typhoon   for testing.

The prototype will be manufactured almost entirely with large format 3D printers using special carbon laced filaments, allowing us to start flight testing within the year.  

Most of the sub-systems, computer hardware, servo controls etc.. will be directly transferable between the prototype and the final production model.  

The Typhoon  will represent a leap forward in our conquering of skies and the freedoms that will come along with it.  You can be a big part of that leap.

Risks & Challenges

Technologically, the Typhoon  is an extremely complex machine, but it's that same  technology that helps to simplify the actual manufacturing of the vehicle.  The scientific principles that I am using are time tested and well proven; I am simply applying the technology in a different way to make it useful for the Typhoon.

Of course there can be manufacturing delays and complications that could possibly necessitate some changes to the basic design, but none of these complications would be insurmountable.









Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out about the Typhoon and our Indiegogo campaign through your social networks, friends, and family.  All support is greatly appreciated.

story:
What is Planting the Future all about?

“In my experience, poor people are the world's greatest entrepreneurs. Every day, they must innovate in order to survive. They remain poor because they do not have the opportunities to turn their creativity into sustainable income” 

(Muhammad Yunus).

Paraguay is one of the least developed countries in South America. Half of the rural population lives in conditions of poverty caused by shortages in available funds, infrastructure and relevant education. Our project aims to support a growing trend of micro entrepreneurship by teaching young ambitious local youth the business skills they will require in their pursuit of self-empowerment. We will set-up a local social business with our students to further enhance their motivation and learning curve.

What kind of a project are you actually supporting? 

Your funding will help us build a social venture with a local partner with participation of local students. The proceeds  will be spend for basic equipment needed, marketing and distribution efforts and support for our local partner Mano-a-Mano based in Ciudad del Este. 
    With your contribution we can help Mano-a-Mano establish an alternative source of financing, while teaching its students the values and basics of entrepreneurship, which will empower the local economy.
    The basic concept of the social business is built around the fact that there is an overcapacity of fruits in the region. The venture we will form together with our students will aim to use these idle resources and turn them into a source of income.
    Impact we're trying to achieve

    We see sustainability of our project as a top priority. The teaching methods we are applying and the business model we will use for the social venture are carefully designed to allow the community leaders and Mano-a-Mano sustain the momentum of our project even when our team is not present in Ciudad del Este. 
    Our project is part of a SIMagination Challenge of the Strategy & International Management program of the University of St. Gallen, Switzerland and is being passed on from one generation to another, which means that our support in the region is on-going.
    Why are we confident to achieve the desired social impact?

    We are a team of ambitious master students with very diverse cultural backgrounds. Our core competencies are in solving complex problems, sustainability and business skills. Many of us have ample practical experience and have already lead social projects. We are passionate about the causes we support and we hope we have ignited some of your passion as well!

    Our team:
    • Matic Hudournik (Slovenia)
    • Hector Cassegrain (France)
    • Bastian Becker (Germany)
    • Max Schacker (Germany)
    • Alice Nuslova (Czech Republic)
    • Paulius Pikelis (Lithuania)
    • Naomi Higa (Argentina)
    • David Löliger (Switzerland)
    • Cem Pektas (Turkey)
    • Thodoris Karakostas (Greece)
    Can't contribute? You can still help!
    There are multiple ways to help us even if you can't contribute financially:
    • Share our project with friends and colleagues who might be willing to contribute.
    • If you have local contacts that might be interested in helping us and our cause, feel free to contact us!
    • Finally, if you have any ideas or thoughts about our project, let us know!
story_txt:
What is Planting the Future all about?

“In my experience, poor people are
the world's greatest entrepreneurs. Every day, they must innovate in order to survive.
They remain poor because they do not have the opportunities to turn their
creativity into sustainable income” 
(Muhammad Yunus).
Paraguay is one of the least developed countries in South America. Half of the rural population lives in conditions of poverty caused by shortages in available funds, infrastructure and relevant education. Our project aims to support a growing trend of micro entrepreneurship by teaching young ambitious local youth the business skills they will require in their pursuit of self-empowerment. We will set-up a local social business with our students to further enhance their motivation and learning curve.

What kind of a project are you actually supporting?  Your funding will help us build a social venture with a local partner with participation of local students. The proceeds  will be spend for basic equipment needed, marketing and distribution efforts and support for our local partner Mano-a-Mano based in Ciudad del Este. 
With your contribution we can help Mano-a-Mano establish an alternative source of financing, while teaching its students the values and basics of entrepreneurship, which will empower the local economy.
The basic concept of the social business is built around the fact that there is an overcapacity of fruits in the region. The venture we will form together with our students will aim to use these idle resources and turn
them into a source of income.
Impact we're trying to achieveWe
see sustainability of our project as a top priority. The teaching methods we are applying and the business model we will use for the social venture are carefully designed to allow the community leaders and Mano-a-Mano sustain the momentum of our project even when our team is not present in Ciudad del Este. 
Our project is part of a SIMagination Challenge of the Strategy & International Management program of the University of St. Gallen, Switzerland and is being passed on from one generation to another, which means that our support in the region is on-going.Why are we confident to achieve the desired social impact?
We are a team of ambitious master students with very diverse cultural backgrounds. Our core competencies are in solving complex problems, sustainability and business skills. Many of us have ample practical experience and have already lead social projects. We are passionate about the causes we support and we hope we have ignited some of your passion as well!
Our team:


Matic Hudournik (Slovenia)


Hector Cassegrain (France)


Bastian Becker (Germany)


Max Schacker (Germany)


Alice Nuslova (Czech Republic)

Paulius Pikelis (Lithuania)
Naomi Higa (Argentina)
David Löliger (Switzerland)
Cem Pektas (Turkey)
Thodoris Karakostas (Greece)

Can't contribute? You can still help!

There are multiple ways to help us even if you can't contribute financially:
Share our project with friends and colleagues who might be willing to contribute.
If you have local contacts that might be interested in helping us and our cause, feel free to contact us!

Finally, if you have any ideas or thoughts about our project, let us know!

story:
I’m Maxwell Moore, a combat veteran and social entrepeneur trying to make a difference. 

Backstory:

As a Navy Corpsman, my job was to keep my Marines alive and healthy in combat. That starts with hygiene.  If you can’t get clean then you become a risk to the group and community around you. This is as true at war overseas as it is on the streets here at home.

During patrols in Afghanistan, we were often weeks at a time without a shower. Not only does poor hygiene impact your physical health, but it impacts your mental health as well. 

You overlook the dignity that the simple act of washing your hands or taking a shower brings. 

Upon returning to the U.S., I moved to downtown Los Angeles near Skid Row, the epicenter of the Los Angeles homeless population. I was infuriated by the lack of access to basic hygiene among the city's homeless, especially marginalized PTSD-affected veterans.  How could it be that a war veteran lives dirtier at home than at war?

Turns out we get exactly the world we build.  So I got to work.   

I COMMITTED TO CREATING A BUSINESS USING ONLY HONORABLE, SOCIALLY RESPONSIBLE,  COMMON-SENSE PRACTICES.

I realized that soap and water could be powerful tools to fix some of the very real, yet completely unnecessary misery in my own back yard.  I decided to make a soapbox from which to speak about real solutions. And so, Maxwell's Soaps was born.

Goal:

For this campaign, I'm proud to be a supporting partner of Lava Mae—an innovative San Francisco non-profit turning old city buses into mobile shower units. These people are literally making the world a cleaner place. They're the folks we are fighting for on this mission. The $15,000 will be used to produce the 5,000 bars of soap needed to supply six months of showers for the homeless. Each person who takes a shower on a Lava Mae bus will get their own bar of Maxwell’s Soap.

Stretch Goal:

  • If we can meet the needs of the Lava Mae buses, we will upgrade our current process to include a more streamlined production facility as well as update our current packaging to a more sustainable, biodegradable solution for our soap.  


Combining a premium formula for soap with the cause we are serving is unlike anything on the market. I've perfected my flagship product: a premium goats milk glycerin soap blended with organic coconut. This creates a detergent-free soap base that naturally hydrates and softly exfoliates. My soaps are scented with essential and fragrant oils to give an incredibly refreshing scent.  

I just make better soap than you're using. 

Big deal.  

It's really not that hard to make something great in a market of garbage.

The best thing about using this soap, is knowing that someone less fortunate has access to a shower because of your support. Somebody dirty got clean.

Look at that. We just solved a problem, and you got great soap.  

Pretty ninja, right?



  • All Natural Ingredients:  Our glycerine is certified kosher and made only from vegetable sources. We use purified water, goats milk, aloe vera gel, and honey to smooth and hydrate your skin. We use organic, food-grade raw coconut shavings to exfoliate old skin cells and scrub dirt and grime away.
  • No Detergents or Dyes: We keep our ingredients list elegantly short.  Our soap formulary is one you can trust. "If it doesn't make sense, it doesn't make soap!"
  • Made in AMERICA, No overseas outsourced labor: Our soap is made in America and paying American bills.  We are a 100% veteran-owned and operated company. We don't use sweatshops and we will never outsource our labor overseas.
  • Locally Sourced: We source from local suppliers in California to lower our overall carbon footprint while stimulating local economies. 

Maxwell's Soaps in the News!




Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out about what we are doing with the "DON'T BE NASTY" mission.  We desperately need the attention of your friends, family and coworkers.  In order for this to work we need to get YOUR people talking!
  • Please share the story on social media with the links listed below!

Please share the story on social media with the links listed below!

story:
Our company is owned and operated by my father Ron Elkins  and me Nathan Elkins both from Michigan and moved down here to Dunnellon Florida back in 1998  and neither my father or i have ever heard of the red ghost pepper, until  2011 a friend asked us if we knew where to find some fresh red ghost peppers our answer was no since we've never heard of them before. So a couple weeks went by and we had to drive over too Gainesville where then we drove by a horticulture shop so we stopped in where we seen red ghost pepper pods for sale on there front counter so we purchased 3 pods, we took the seeds out of the pods then planted them and all the plants except 1 was given to the friend that loved hot peppers, but we wanted to keep that 1 just to grow and see how hot they was, So once we harvested the fresh peppers of the plant we searched for ghost peppers in the united states and came across many growers, but none that grew just the red ghost pepper.

Photo of my Father digging holes to plant the first plants in the ground for the 2013 season.

(Beautiful red ghost peppers ready for harvest)
 Even though the home we rent only has around 1 acre of property to grow on that still gave us the determination to plant the seeds for the 2012 year and market our fresh peppers as a base ingredient to other companies that make spicy food products, restaurant's, and many other types of companies . We ended up with 200 plants for 2012 and had a the demand was huge, but we was not able to fill all orders especially the large orders because of only having 200 plants producing, so that's when we realized this was a great business idea to start and begin offering a pure strained red ghost pepper to the market for companies to purchase at an affordable price. 
For our 2013 season we ended up with around 1,000 plants and we were still selling out of fresh peppers, so in 2014 we planted all the seeds we had and got around 2,500 plants, we have grown steady each year and still not having enough fresh peppers to fill all the company orders we have, Since the 2015 season has began we will have growing around 8,000 plants to produce our fresh peppers this year, to help toward the down payment to move on a larger piece of land.

Your contribution

With your help we can reach our goal of $50,000 and 100% of the funds raised are going towards our biggest goal of putting a down payment on a 3-5 acre piece of property with home for us to live in and grow our red ghost pepper's, but also much more below is a complete breakdown of what we will be able to get purchased based on prices we have already researched and found to buy.

  • 3-5 acre property with home: $20,000 down payment
  • Small tractor: $7,500
  • Raised bed with mulch layer: $1,950
  • Drip line up to 5 acres: $895.00
  • 2 person planting machine: $1,500 new
  • Cold air storage container: $5,000
  • (3) 12' x 50' seedling Greenhouse: $3,000
  • Addition water well: $3,500
  • Fertilizer: $1,050
  • Produce boxes: $450
  • Gs1 Barcodes: $300
  • Clamshell packages: $550
  • Label Printer: $2,000
  • Self made Rain water catching unit: $250
  • 500 gallon water tank: $360
  • Shade screen: $1,500
  • wood posts: $450
  • plastic field totes for our harvesters: $100
  • Fresh pepper wash tanks: $300
  • Up to 30 Good paying jobs or more will be provided from the income made on the 3-5 acres
  • Help us get started on our community growing project to donate all vegetables grown, through programs like farmers feeding Florida.
  • Primus labs certificate 
  • You will be helping us get our fresh peppers into grocery stores across the nation here in the united states and into Canada.                                                                               

~New property relocation plan~

November of this 2015 year is when we will be wanting to make the move to another property after our fresh pepper season has come towards in end and providing we reach at least $20,000 of our goal for the down payment.  Once we get into the new property the first thing we will be doing is putting up the greenhouses to house our seedlings and young plants for the 2016 season and if we are able to reach the goal and get 3-5 acres we will be planting 3 acres of Our red ghost pepper plants and take the 2 remaining acres to start our community farming program. 

~Community Farming program~ 

This program is about growing as many fruits & vegetables as we can through out the growing season and donate all food harvested to food banks though farmers feeding Florida program and low income families and individuals locally. We are wanting to start this when we make our move to a larger piece of property where we can grow on a couple acres, with just a couple acres we can harvest a few thousand pounds of food through out the year & donate all to helping the cause with fighting hunger. Please help us reach our goal to be able to provide thousands of meals for many years to come.
Spread the word.Share with your friends Donating is not the only way to help. Thank you for your support and belief in our passion.
 To view our product's and to learn more about us please check us out at our website www.ghostpepperfarms.com and/or facebook.

story:
Who & What

My name is Lucy and I am creator of Rootflage, a revolutionary temporary quick-fix Root Touch Up powder designed to save you time and money between salon visits. Rootflage temporarily yet effectively camouflages dark or gray root regrowth in seconds without damaging your hair. I built this brand from the ground up specifically for blondes who want to cover dark or gray root regrowth,


but now I want to expand my line to brunettes and beyond! If you contribute you will help me raise money to pay for my new packaging for these new colors...


(Dark Brown/Black applied to the left)

(Copper Penny Red applied to the left)

What We Need & What You Get

I need $15,000 to help pay for my new packaging so I can bring you our wider line of new colors that are ready for the world. By supporting this campaign, you can buy Rootflage at a discount, have custom colors made or have a color named after you! If I don’t reach my goal the money I raise will still go towards my new packaging. I promise I won't spend it on having a pity party for myself. 

The Impact

I originally created Rootflage for myself and for a few of my blonde friends. There was nothing on the market that worked for blondes to cover dark or gray roots until I developed it!  I realized that this was a real need for blonde women who wanted to save time and money.  I wanted to help working moms, stay at home moms, career women, college students, world travelers, clients who can't get in to see their colorist and basically anyone concerned about their roots and interested in saving time and money.  The brand has grown over 500% in the last year because of word of mouth and because the product works! I decided it was time to stop leaving out all my brunette friends and future customers and that it was time to expand my color line.

Risks & Challenges

I started this company almost 3 years ago and have experienced sweet successes as well as setbacks. I have learned from every mistake and always listen closely to my customers who help me to grow and understand their needs in hair color and covering their root re-growth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for taking time to check out my Indiegogo campaign. I appreciate it so much! If you can't contribute, pretty please help out by telling your family and friends about this campaign. #hashtag me on Instagram #Rootflage, tweet it out and/or post this link on your Facebook page to help get the word out to others who might direly need this product. Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your support.

story:
THANK YOU FOR VISITING OUR PAGE!  My name is Richard French and I'd like to welcome you to the NYC Baseball Club.  Not only is baseball America's pastime, but it's my passion and we'd love for you to be a part of building a state-of-the-art center of excellence for kids and adults to learn, play and grow, on the field and off.  

What we're building is so much more than just indoor batting cages.  While baseball and softball are the sports that are practiced, we challenge our players to the next level in all areas of their lives and teach fundamentals of baseball and life...teamwork, dedication, integrity, trust, respect, accountability and responsibility.

The NYC Baseball Club will provide an environment of learning and training for every level of athlete, from the first-time youngster to seasoned MLB pros and every level in between.  Your financial support will have a direct impact on the youth of New York.  

My background in business has been diverse in that I've enjoyed being able to work in multiple industries and have gleaned something from everyone I've had the pleasure to work with over the years.  While primarily in mortgage finance, my real function and capacity has been sales and most recently was blessed to be the Director of Camp Operations for the ELEV|8 Sports Institute, formerly the Bucky Dent Baseball School.  My time there was very special as it allowed me to be around the game I love, to make a difference for kids (and adults) and gain the experience and knowledge of operating a successful sports-based business. It also afforded me the opportunity to meet, and work with, many current and former MLB pros. 

                                                           
                    "Pudge" Rodriguez                Jarrod "Salty"  Saltalamacchia

                               

                                                      
                          Omar Infante                                    Kurt Abbott
                                        

The vision for the NYC Baseball Club developed while facilitating summer camps in New York City and spending time with the coaches, players and their families.  Baseball is the primary sport for youth in the city and the one that embodies NYC.  There is a significant market that continues to go under-served.  We're looking to change all that.

Community service has always been important to me and my own volunteer work has been almost exclusively for children including Big Brothers Big Sisters of Broward, Youth Leadership Broward, Hugh O'Brian Youth Foundation (HOBY), FuturePoint and Junior Achievement.  Following in that tradition, we'll be working with organizations like Harlem RBI, Big Brothers Big Sisters and Boys and Girls Clubs and others to offer programs and services to their kids because we believe in giving back to the community that supports us.  


Some photos to give you an idea of the facility: (these are conceptual, not actual) 

     


We currently have two locations identified as possible options:


The Market:

Our research shows there are approximately 94,000 organized youth and adult baseball and softball players* in New York City (all five boroughs) based on data compiled from NYC Department of Parks and Recreation and other sources**. There are 24 private schools with baseball and/or softball programs and more than 10 colleges with baseball and/or softball programs, all of which are constantly looking for training and practice space and facilities.  This doesn't include the hundreds of thousands of men and women, boys and girls, just looking for a fun time and taking their swings in the cage.  

We've already been in discussions with a major NY university about a long-term agreement to use our club as the training facility for their varsity baseball and softball teams as well as some off-hour intramural sports.  We have non-binding Letters of Intent from Hunter College High School and Trevor Day School for usage as well and have been in discussions with several other schools and baseball organizations about regular and ongoing usage as well.

Our facility will also be a destination for corporate off-site meetings, sales and team trainings and other fun, social and entertainment focused programming like Wine, Whisky & WhiffleBall leagues and simulated games utilizing HitTraxx(R) technology. 

With limited options to  train and practice and inclement weather, there is an overwhelming need for quality, fully-equipped indoor training space.  More than just a few cages, but the ability to run defensive drills, pitching off real mounds, base-running and base-stealing, pick off moves and bunting drills, and things like pitch recognition, swing drills and hitting.  We'll also have weight training equipment and personal strength and speed training designed specifically for baseball and softball players.  

NYC is just the first stop.  The branding we've designed was created specifically to be able to expand into other cities.  We're targeting other northeast and upper Midwest cities that are baseball-centric and experience inclement weather including Boston, Philadelphia and Chicago.  

* "Players" is defined as the projected number of people age 6 and older who play the sport once a year or more
**Data provided by Sports Marketing Surveys USA, provider of research for SFIA (Sports & Fitness Industry Association), formerly the Sporting Goods Manufacturing Association.

Zero To One

In the book, "Zero to One" by Peter Thiel, the author writes about the distinction between copying a business model and creating something brand new and how the latter is going from zero to one.  That's what we're doing. What we're building doesn't exist in the NYC area.  Yes, there are several places where one can rent a batting cage and even catch a lesson but the NYC Baseball Club will be "first to market" for an all-inclusive diamond sports experience including rentals, field space, lessons, camps, clinics, food & beverage, pro shop and apparel. As shared in the video above, we're committed to the health and well-being of young athletes and to demonstrate that commitment, we've formed an alliance with Dr. Christopher Ahmad, Head Team Physician for the New York Yankees.  Together, we will be the "go-to" center of excellence for baseball and softball performance in the Eastern United States.


What We Need 

As you can imagine, launching something this big requires a lot of capital. And while we've already launched a capital raise, we're utilizing IndieGoGo in an effort to fund some expenses before we can break escrow on the capital raise. The money will go towards everyday operating expenses and things like architectural renderings and projected floor plan drawings, developing and building our permanent website, legal fees for lease agreements, engineering designs and plans  and some travel expenses.  

The Impact

Baseball is hard.  It's the hardest of all youth sports and there's no place to hide on the field or in the batter's box.  I've written several articles on how success and failure in youth sports can be a great source of learning and growth for our kids today.  Please take a minute to read the articles:

Baseball: The Best Leadership Trainer Ever.

Is a Touch of Reverence Too Much To Ask?

It's not easy being a kid today.  As adults, we lament about how it was when we were young, walking to school, uphill, both ways, in the snow with holes in our shoes and our kids roll their eyes...rightfully so.  The truth is, most of us couldn't hack it being a kid today if we tried.  When our kids find something they love and want to pursue, as their parents it's in our DNA to support them in that endeavor.  Baseball is hard, especially for kids...I want to give them the tools to make the most of their passion and feel good about it too. 

Being a part of launching the NYC Baseball Club will be something may not make you rich (maybe!) but you'll be part of something fun and exciting in the Big Apple!

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE,..if you're not able to contribute financially, please help spread the word about NYC Baseball Club!  There are share tools here (Facebook, Instagram & Twitter, etc) that are easy to use.  THANK YOU for taking the time to learn about our project!
story_txt:
THANK YOU FOR VISITING OUR PAGE!  My name is Richard French and I'd like to welcome you to the NYC Baseball Club.  Not only is baseball America's pastime, but it's my passion and we'd love for you to be a part of building a state-of-the-art center of excellence for kids and adults to learn, play and grow, on the field and off.  
What we're building is so much more than just indoor batting cages.  While baseball and softball are the sports that are practiced, we challenge our players to the next level in all areas of their lives and teach fundamentals of baseball and life...teamwork, dedication, integrity, trust, respect, accountability and responsibility.The NYC Baseball Club will provide an environment of learning and training for every level of athlete, from the first-time youngster to seasoned MLB pros and every level in between.  Your financial support will have a direct impact on the youth of New York.  My background in business has been diverse in that I've enjoyed being able to work in multiple industries and have gleaned something from everyone I've had the pleasure to work with over the years.  While primarily in mortgage finance, my real function and capacity has been sales and most recently was blessed to be the Director of Camp Operations for the ELEV|8 Sports Institute, formerly the Bucky Dent Baseball School.  My time there was very special as it allowed me to be around the game I love, to make a difference for kids (and adults) and gain the experience and knowledge of operating a successful sports-based business. It also afforded me the opportunity to meet, and work with, many current and former MLB pros.                                                                                "Pudge" Rodriguez                Jarrod "Salty"  Saltalamacchia                                                                                                               Omar Infante                                    Kurt Abbott                                        The vision for the NYC Baseball Club developed while facilitating summer camps in New York City and spending time with the coaches, players and their families.  Baseball is the primary sport for youth in the city and the one that embodies NYC.  There is a significant market that continues to go under-served.  We're looking to change all that.Community service has always been important to me and my own volunteer work has been almost exclusively for children including Big Brothers Big Sisters of Broward, Youth Leadership Broward, Hugh O'Brian Youth Foundation (HOBY), FuturePoint and Junior Achievement.  Following in that tradition, we'll be working with organizations like Harlem RBI, Big Brothers Big Sisters and Boys and Girls Clubs and others to offer programs and services to their kids because we believe in giving back to the community that supports us.  Some photos to give you an idea of the facility: (these are conceptual, not actual)      We currently have two locations identified as possible options:The Market:Our research shows there are approximately 94,000 organized youth and adult baseball and softball players* in New York City (all five boroughs) based on data compiled from NYC Department of Parks and Recreation and other sources**. There are 24 private schools with baseball and/or softball programs and more than 10 colleges with baseball and/or softball programs, all of which are constantly looking for training and practice space and facilities.  This doesn't include the hundreds of thousands of men and women, boys and girls, just looking for a fun time and taking their swings in the cage.  We've already been in discussions with a major NY university about a long-term agreement to use our club as the training facility for their varsity baseball and softball teams as well as some off-hour intramural sports.  We have non-binding Letters of Intent from Hunter College High School and Trevor Day School for usage as well and have been in discussions with several other schools and baseball organizations about regular and ongoing usage as well.Our facility will also be a destination for corporate off-site meetings, sales and team trainings and other fun, social and entertainment focused programming like Wine, Whisky & WhiffleBall leagues and simulated games utilizing HitTraxx(R) technology. With limited options to  train and practice and inclement weather, there is an overwhelming need for quality, fully-equipped indoor training space.  More than just a few cages, but the ability to run defensive drills, pitching off real mounds, base-running and base-stealing, pick off moves and bunting drills, and things like pitch recognition, swing drills and hitting.  We'll also have weight training equipment and personal strength and speed training designed specifically for baseball and softball players.  NYC is just the first stop.  The branding we've designed was created specifically to be able to expand into other cities.  We're targeting other northeast and upper Midwest cities that are baseball-centric and experience inclement weather including Boston, Philadelphia and Chicago.  * "Players" is defined as the projected number of people age 6 and older who play the sport once a year or more**Data provided by Sports Marketing Surveys USA, provider of research for SFIA (Sports & Fitness Industry Association), formerly the Sporting Goods Manufacturing Association.Zero To OneIn the book, "Zero to One" by Peter Thiel, the author writes about the distinction between copying a business model and creating something brand new and how the latter is going from zero to one.  That's what we're doing. What we're building doesn't exist in the NYC area.  Yes, there are several places where one can rent a batting cage and even catch a lesson but the NYC Baseball Club will be "first to market" for an all-inclusive diamond sports experience including rentals, field space, lessons, camps, clinics, food & beverage, pro shop and apparel. As shared in the video above, we're committed to the health and well-being of young athletes and to demonstrate that commitment, we've formed an alliance with Dr. Christopher Ahmad, Head Team Physician for the New York Yankees.  Together, we will be the "go-to" center of excellence for baseball and softball performance in the Eastern United States.
What We Need As you can imagine, launching something this big requires a lot of capital. And while we've already launched a capital raise, we're utilizing IndieGoGo in an effort to fund some expenses before we can break escrow on the capital raise. The money will go towards everyday operating expenses and things like architectural renderings and projected floor plan drawings, developing and building our permanent website, legal fees for lease agreements, engineering designs and plans  and some travel expenses.  The ImpactBaseball is hard.  It's the hardest of all youth sports and there's no place to hide on the field or in the batter's box.  I've written several articles on how success and failure in youth sports can be a great source of learning and growth for our kids today.  Please take a minute to read the articles:Baseball: The Best Leadership Trainer Ever.Is a Touch of Reverence Too Much To Ask?It's not easy being a kid today.  As adults, we lament about how it was when we were young, walking to school, uphill, both ways, in the snow with holes in our shoes and our kids roll their eyes...rightfully so.  The truth is, most of us couldn't hack it being a kid today if we tried.  When our kids find something they love and want to pursue, as their parents it's in our DNA to support them in that endeavor.  Baseball is hard, especially for kids...I want to give them the tools to make the most of their passion and feel good about it too. Being a part of launching the NYC Baseball Club will be something may not make you rich (maybe!) but you'll be part of something fun and exciting in the Big Apple!Other Ways You Can HelpPLEASE,..if you're not able to contribute financially, please help spread the word about NYC Baseball Club!  There are share tools here (Facebook, Instagram & Twitter, etc) that are easy to use.  THANK YOU for taking the time to learn about our project!

story:
Al Wakalat Virtual Showroom

Al Wakalat is the first online showroom to host automobile dealerships in Qatar and soon, the region.

Vision :

To be Qatar's and the region's leader website to host automobile dealerships online and offline.

Mission :

We aim to provide our visitors with the most accurate and necessary information about Qatar's automobile showrooms applying the concept of having everything at home and at your ease to enhance your shopping experience for your next brand new car. We aim to connect automobile buyers to dealers in an ultra-modernized way through launch of the region's first online showroom for automobiles and their accessories. Designed to assist you with our innovative comparison tool and ourconsultant's experience; it will help you choose your next car according to your needs. Al Wakalat is here to save your time of travelling between different showroom and dealerships. it allows you to browse the content in the comfort of your home, avoiding the traffic and wasting your energy and the time wandering between showroom floors to find your next new car. We bring you everything you need to know about your next car to screen, shortening your number of visits to just ONE visit... which we hope to be the purchase visit.

Al Wakalat is a pioneering, service-driven website that will enhance and strengthen the bridge between dealerships and buys to ensure better buying and selling decisions.

We are a team of 5 undergraduate students who are looking to launch our startup and we need support to make this dream a reality.

We are from different backgrounds and countries, these are Qatar, Jordan, India and Palestine. We are all Carnegie Mellon University Graduate.

We are looking to change the concept of car shopping online by creating the world's first online 3D virtual showroom.

Money ... Cars ... Technology

  • We need $15,000 for phase one of establishing  the 2D virtual showroom in order to be a strong foundation for the one-of-a-kind 3D showroom.
  • We are aiming to share the fun driving experience with the public and offering opportunities for those who love cars and driving them. 
  • The money will be invested in the startup technology and marketing.
  • 5% of our revenues is going to Charity Work. 

Change the online car market

  • Creating a new perspective on online car market by introducing 3D showrooms.
  • Generating $5,000 on instagram.com/alwakalat show the potiential there is.
  • We signed contracts with BMW and Mercedes in Qatar to Establish the project customer base.
  • We have created our own professional car driver who does reviews, named Al Molatham, means the masked one. Photo is attached

Check us out: 

Snapchat: Alwakalat

Whatsapp: +974 55448915

 Website: www.alwakalat.com 

Instagram: www.instagram.com/alwakalat

Facebook: www.facebook.com/Alwakalatsite

Twitter: www.twitter.com/Al_Wakalat

.
.

ليوم بكون ان شاء الله بداية نقطة التحول للمشروع اللي نطمح نطوره لكم
.
.
اليوم بنبتدي حملة دعم مشروع الوكالات عن طريق الدعم المالي للمشروع. عن طريق التحويل الالكتروني على موقع indiegogo
.
.
بما انه احنا مشروع قطري 100% و يهدف لخدمة المجتمع و تسهيل الاختيار و العناء بالاضافة الى المساعدة على التواصل مع الوكالات الرسمية في قطر للناس، حبينا نطلب الدعم و العون من اهلنا و ناسنا في قطر و الخليج، لأنكم اهلنا و ناسنا انتو اول ناس نشاركم هالفكرة
.
.
المبالغ اللي بنجمعها بنستخدمها للامور التالية:
- فتح قناة يوتيوب ( طلب كبير عليها )
- معدات تصوير عالية الجودة، شرينا وحدة على حسابنا بس يلزمنا 2.
- محررين صور و فيديو
- تنظيم و دعم تجمعات السيارات بكل أنواعها
- تنظيم المسابقات لكم سواء على الانستجرام او الواقع 
- تعيين part time لبعض المطوريين و مَصممين الجرافيكس
- تطوير الموقع عشان نقدر نوفر اكبر كمية من المعلومات و الاستخدام السلس لكم
- تطوير برنامج للايفون و الأندرويد لسهولة التصفح و أتفاعل
- التوسع في دول الخليج بحيث انا نغطي اسعار و سيارات الوكالات في الدول المحيطة
- التبرع بمبلغ 5% من الأموال الى جمعية قطر الخيرية
- دعم المشاريع الريادة المرتبطة بالسيارات 
.
.
هدفنا 15,000$ للمرحلة الاولى و ان شاء الله نقدر نوصل لها بدعمكم و تشجيعكم، رابط الدعم المالي موجود في البايو في الحساب @alwakalat
.
.


موقع indiegogo موقع رسمي و معتمد من كل بطاقات الائتمان، ما تخفون لان عليها تعويض 1,500,000 اذا صار خلل لا سمح الله

#دعم_مشروع_الوكالات
#الوكالات
#دعم #مشروع #ما_تقصرون #ريال_واحد
#قطر #السعودية #الكويت #الامارات #عمان #البحرين

story:
Hello and thank you for contacting POWERPOiNT INTERNATIONAL CHURCH BUILDING FUNDING PROJECT.

ARISE AND LET US BUILD FOR GOD ...

The Words of the Master in the Scriptures say "Go ye therefore, and teach all nations." This is our commission and we are committed to reaching the world with the message of hope and life in Christ Jesus, preaching, teaching & healing.

We are Kingdom Builders, Building Kingdom People for Kingdom Living. We are committed to helping people live a life full of Power, driven by God-given Purpose and the Pursuit of Excellence. PowerPoint International has been around for some time affecting lives all around the world from our base in Mableton, an Atlanta suburb, Georgia, USA. We want to expand our reach so as to be able to reach even more people from North America and Canada to Europe, Asia and Africa and to the ends of the earth with the Gospel of Hope and Life.

We invite you to join us in this great commission and support this project campaign with your time, treasure, and talent. The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds for the building of a befitting house of glory for God’s work. We are looking at building a ministry operational base that will house the type of modern infrastructures that will enhance our services and enable us to carry out this God-given commission with more zeal and in a more organized and focused approach.

The building will have a family worship center that will directly minister to and cater for our immediate community; this will also include a youth center that will take care of the children and our upcoming adults, bringing them up in the way of the Lord so that they can become responsible adults in time.

At PowerPoint, we offer prayer support to all. Prayer is key to fulfilling the commission we have been given, hence the need to establish a 24/7 Prayer Power House (also called the Prayer Tower) where prayers will constantly and consistently be offered for people from all around the world. Prayer is power and there are many nations, organizations and people all around the world that are in urgent need of prayer support which we offer at PowerPoint International. People will be able to connect physically by receiving prayers at the physical location through one-on-one prayers, congregational prayers, prayer conferences, healing and deliverance prayers. They can also connect virtually through telephone prayers, radio broadcasts, television broadcasts, Internet broadcasts, social networking and so on.


A full-fledged media office/production studio will also be cited in this building where life-changing and life-impacting broadcasts will be transmitted to the world 24/7 through various platforms especially the Internet broadcast (Radio/TV) platforms thereby making it accessible and affordable to all, anytime and anywhere. The building will also service others arms of the ministry such as Missions and World Outreach, Conferences and Meetings, Community Support Services, Food Pantry, Cloth Drives, Toy Drives for Children, etc.

Already, many are being blessed and positively impacted by our current, though very limited, services and facilities.  Lives are being affected and changed positively, the sick and the afflicted are healed, the troubled and tormented are delivered, many more are coming to the saving knowledge of God and being set free from ignorance and bondage and are living a new life in God. People are being taught the undiluted Word of God thereby opening their eyes to the truth that the scriptures hold for them. They are getting to know the truth and the truth is not only setting them free but also making them free. The jobless are getting employed. The barren are having children. Employees are starting businesses, becoming self-employed and employing others. The haunted, oppressed, depressed, afflicted, addicted, tormented, and bound are being set free and living a life of freedom and liberty.

We will like to share with you just a few of the recorded miracles brought about by the impact of the work the Lord is doing through this ministry in the lives of the few that we have been able to reach with our services.

TESTIMONIES:

1.   At the time I got connected with PowerPoint International Ministries, I have been married for about 5 years with no children. I was told by my medical specialists that I have just 1% chance of getting pregnant. My husband was also diagnosed with low-sperm count. We joined the PowerPoint International Church and we started being taught the Word of God, learning how to pray and do spiritual warfare. After intensive prayers at PowerPoint and within a year, I got pregnant with my first child, a boy. Just about 2 years later I got pregnant again and gave birth to a baby girl. Now we are proud parents of a boy and a girl, all thanks and glory to the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. The God that answer by fire has answered us, He is a miracle worker. Praise be His holy name.

2.  I became totally and completely bankrupt. I could not pay my bills because I lost my job due to injury at the workplace. I was denied all benefits accrued to me. My employer and their insurance company will not pay me my entitlements. I lost my home and was thrown into the streets. I had to put up in a shelter for several months. Even my lawyers was compelled to hands off my case. Everything just went against me and my family. A friend introduced me to PowerPoint International Ministries in Boston. I met the man of God for prayers and deliverance several times. I also joined and regularly attend the daily prayer conferences on the PowerPoint International Prophetic Prayer Line. Gradually, I began to recover from the depression that came upon me and finally I was delivered from the bondage of financial troubles. I continued to pray with this power prayer ministry. Then suddenly the settlement case with my former employer which had already been closed was reopened miraculously (I had already given up on it) and everything, I mean everything that I was entitled to was fully restored back unto me. I was delivered from the shelter. I started a business and God turned my story around for the better. From then on, it was miracle galore in my life. Jesus Christ delivered me and I recovered from all the afflictions of evil and wicked men. To God be the glory.

3. I got introduced to Bishop Henry Adekogbe and his ministry in the summer of 2006 at a time I was going through serious health crises. I became a member of the ministry and started praying with the pastors in the church. I went through series of special prayers and deliverances after which I finally got my total deliverance. What the Lord did in my life was permanent and since then I have never had any crises again. Thank God for the prayer support I got from the prayer warriors at the PowerPoint International Church. Since I and my family got connected with the PowerPoint family, our lives have gotten better, we enjoyed great health, my dental profession took a new turn, I became a provider and an employer of labor, and my husband’s business improved. Thanks to the God of Heaven Who did not give me as prey to the enemy but delivered me from death and disaster. Help me praise God.

At PowerPoint International Ministries, God is helping us to positively impact many lives and we want you to be a part of it. By supporting this campaign, you will help us to give more to our community, our nation, the people and the world as a whole. Would you consider supporting this campaign today? We will greatly appreciate it. God bless you and increase you more and more.

Help spread the word about this campaign to all your social networking contacts, friends, family and colleagues. Thank you.

are in urgent need of prayer support which we offer at PowerPoint International.
People will be able to connect physically by receiving prayers at the physical
location through one-on-one prayers, congregational prayers, prayer conferences,
healing and deliverance prayers. They can also connect virtually through telephone
prayers, radio broadcasts, television broadcasts, Internet broadcasts, social
networking and so on.

A
full-fledged media office/production studio will also be cited in this building
where life-changing and life-impacting broadcasts will be transmitted to the
world 24/7 through various platforms especially the Internet broadcast (Radio/TV)
platforms thereby making it accessible and affordable to all, anytime and
anywhere. The building will also service others arms of the ministry such
as Missions and World Outreach, Conferences and
Meetings, Community Support Services, Food Pantry, Cloth Drives, Toy Drives for
Children, etc.
Already,
many are being blessed and positively impacted by our current, though very
limited, services and facilities.  Lives are being affected and changed
positively, the sick and the afflicted are healed, the troubled and tormented
are delivered, many more are coming to the saving knowledge of God and being
set free from ignorance and bondage and are living a new life in God. People
are being taught the undiluted Word of God thereby opening their eyes to the
truth that the scriptures hold for them. They are getting to know the truth and
the truth is not only setting them free but also making them free. The jobless
are getting employed. The barren are having children. Employees are starting
businesses, becoming self-employed and employing others. The haunted,
oppressed, depressed, afflicted, addicted, tormented, and bound are being set
free and living a life of freedom and liberty.
We will
like to share with you just a few of the recorded miracles brought about by the
impact of the work the Lord is doing through this ministry in the lives of the
few that we have been able to reach with our services.
TESTIMONIES:




1.   At the time I got
connected with PowerPoint International Ministries, I have been married for
about 5 years with no children. I was told by my medical specialists that I
have just 1% chance of getting pregnant. My husband was also diagnosed with
low-sperm count. We joined the PowerPoint International Church and we started
being taught the Word of God, learning how to pray and do spiritual warfare.
After intensive prayers at PowerPoint and within a year, I got pregnant with my
first child, a boy. Just about 2 years later I
got pregnant again and gave birth to a baby girl. Now we are proud
parents of a boy and a girl, all thanks and glory to the God of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. The God that answer by fire has answered
us, He is a miracle worker. Praise be His holy name.
2.  I became totally and
completely bankrupt. I could not pay my bills because I lost my job due to
injury at the workplace. I was denied all benefits accrued to me. My employer
and their insurance company will not pay me my entitlements. I lost my home and
was thrown into the streets. I had to put up in a shelter for several months.
Even my lawyers was compelled to hands off my case. Everything just went
against me and my family. A friend introduced me to PowerPoint International
Ministries in Boston. I met the man of God for prayers and deliverance several
times. I also joined and regularly attend the daily prayer conferences on the
PowerPoint International Prophetic Prayer Line. Gradually, I began to recover
from the depression that came upon me and finally I was delivered from the
bondage of financial troubles. I continued to pray with this power prayer
ministry. Then suddenly the settlement case with my former employer which had
already been closed was reopened miraculously (I had already given up on it)
and everything, I mean everything that I was entitled to was fully restored
back unto me. I was delivered from the shelter. I started a business and God
turned my story around for the better. From then on, it was miracle galore in
my life. Jesus Christ delivered me and I recovered from all the afflictions of
evil and wicked men. To God be the glory.
3. I got
introduced to Bishop Henry Adekogbe and his ministry in the summer of 2006 at a
time I was going through serious health crises. I became a member of the ministry
and started praying with the pastors in the church. I went through series of
special prayers and deliverances after which I finally got my total
deliverance. What the Lord did in my life was permanent and since then I have
never had any crises again. Thank God for the prayer support I got from the prayer warriors at
the PowerPoint International Church. Since I and my
family got connected with the PowerPoint family, our lives have gotten better, we enjoyed great health, my dental profession took a new
turn, I became a provider and an employer of labor, and my husband’s business
improved. Thanks to the God of
Heaven Who did not give me as prey to the enemy but delivered me from death and disaster. Help me praise God.
At
PowerPoint International Ministries, God is helping us to positively impact many
lives and we want you to be a part of it. By supporting this campaign, you will
help us to give more to our community, our nation, the people and the world as
a whole. Would you consider supporting this campaign today? We will greatly
appreciate it. God bless you and increase you more and more.
Help
spread the word about this campaign to all your social networking contacts, friends, family and colleagues.
Thank you.

story:
Beadkreative is a beading supplies and handmade gift store in Union Sq, Somerville, MA. The store offers a unique selection of beads from around the world as well as beautiful handmade gifts and accessories designed by local craft artists. Beadkreative is a makerspace as well as a marketplace for local craft artists and enthusiasts, building an artistic environment where people can share their ideas, designs, and creativity in Somerville, MA!


We need your help!

With great effort and the help of a handful of friends, Beadkreative opened in July 2014. We've had seven great first months so far, meeting and learning new things everyday. Through our doors we've seen everything from seasoned pros to budding artists. We don't want to stop! We need your help!

Your contribution will help Beadkreative to:

1. Finish the development of our “Craft School"  a classroom-like space that brings crafting enrichment programs to the community
2. Bring in some key inventory, few items that community has asked for.
3. Conducting an advertising and outreach campaign, which we need. 
Our impact

Beadkreative is a store created by craft artists who understand the challenges that they face when starting out. When we first moved to Boston it was very difficult for us to find a space to consign work with fair fares for consignors.  At the same time it was not easy to access affordable AND quality supplies. 

Beadkreative is built to tackle some of these problems. We've hand picked our materials making sure they are of great quality and affordable.  Our classroom space is designed to host workshops as well as other fun learning events. Lastly, our store is a gallery space where craft artists can sell their amazing work. The gallery offers a great opportunity to display local talent to an appreciative community. Our consignment percentage is low and even lower for eco-designed or up-cycled pieces. Consignors also obtain discount in supplies, reduced fares in classroom use, and promotions through our website and special events.  

Risks & Challenges

There are great many challenges of running a small business, but we trust we'll hit a sustainable future!  We love the people we meet and we want to help other artists who share our passion. We are learning something new all the time and feel really good about the community we're building.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you live in Boston Area, come over the store and help us spread the word. If you live far, find those friends that live out here and have them come over!

story:
Say Hello to The Art of Yoga! 

We are a yoga studio located in in a renovated loft warehouse in the heart of downtown Columbus. 

At the Art of Yoga, students discover themselves and the beauty of art, with work displayed by a different Central Ohio artist each month.

What We Need & What You Get:

We've worked hard to create a beautiful, unique space that is the perfect place for you to take a break from your everyday life. But we could use some help finishing our space! The moment we saw this space, we were immediately struck by the amount of potential it held. It has been a long (and expensive) journey to get to this point and now we're eager to put the finishing touches on the studio.

By contributing to this campaign, you will help us:

•  Expand the matted area, doubling the space dedicated to yoga.

•  Finish the changing room. Here's what we need to do this: paint the room, install laminate flooring, hang coat hooks, mirror and a place a chinese screen in the corner to cover the heating pipe. By an ottoman or two for seating. Install new lighting. 

•  A vinyl baseboard throughout the studio. 

•  Additional shoe cubbies and more entry way seating (desperately needed!)

•  Upgrade the shower. Yes, we have a shower, but currently no one uses it. While it's functional, it certainly needs a more appealing upgrade.

•  Expand the retail section. Here's what we need to do this: A rug and side table (we already have the cabinetry display). 

Additional Donations:

We plan to keep this campaign going even after we've raised our requested funds so that more of the offered perks may be claimed. If the campaign raises more funds than we need, then all extra funds will be used for various items inside the studio such as: yoga rental mats, blocks, blankets, straps, mat-cleaning cloths, paper towels, toilet paper, hair ties, Wi-Fi (requested almost daily), printed schedules, etc. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We know that everyone can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean that you can't help! Contribute by getting Columbus folk involved in this campaign and letting people know about The Art of Yoga by sharing this campaign online on your social media profiles! 

Thank you! :)

story:
Who We Are

Howdy! Our names are Kenna Moreland and Stoney Gabel and we are the founders of Four Pints. Here is a little about us: 

                                

Kenna grew up in far west Texas in the little town of Fort Davis, but Austin has always been a second home. Her family is from Manchaca (in fact her grandfather brewed his own beer during prohibition there). In her travels throughout Europe and the US, Kenna developed a keen taste for good beer. She is a Cicerone Certified Beer Server and is working on the next level to become a Certified Cicerone. 

Stoney Gabel hails from Salina, Kansas. He wandered down to Texas after college and decided to stay. He has over 10 years of experience in the role of General Manager in Austin bars and nightclubs.  And he is also a talented musician. 

Stoney swore he would never be behind a bar again, but the idea of a growler station intrigued him and Kenna both.  They make a great team and are able to combine their strengths to put this business together.  

What We Sell

Four Pints will sell beer - good beer. The way we sell that beer is a fairly new concept for this part of the country. We will have beer on tap and customers will be able to come in a purchase a growler (typically a glass jug around 64oz), or bring in one of their own and have it filled with one of the many draft beers we will have available. It is essentially an environmentally friendly way to deliver fresh draft beer to the consumers. 

                                                     

Why beer? Because the craft beer market is booming!

Our inspiration came from the growler filling stations of the Pacific northwest. After doing extensive research on the growler stores in that region and around the country, we developed what we think will be Austin's premiere location for tasting and purchasing finely crafted beer.

  • We will be starting out with 30 taps of beer along with local cider and kombucha.
  • We'll also have selection of bombers and gluten free beer in our refrigerators.
  • And we'll have an impressive inventory of growlers, including glass, stainless steel and ceramic along with other accessories.
  • We would also like to hold beer tasting classes as well as food pairing and other special events

Why Crowd Fund

Crowd funding allows people like us to actually pursue the American Dream of owning our own business. It is impossible to get a small business loan or grant until we have already been operating for at least 6 months.  With crowdfunding, we can raise funds from friends, family, and the community to begin our business.

We also think pre-selling growlers and t-shirts is a great way to spread the word about Four Pints, and it gives our customers a chance to:

  • Be the first to get a Four Pints growler, t-shirt, pint glass, etc.
  • Attend our exclusive grand opening party!
  • Support a great, local, small business.

Where the money will go:

·  Construction/Remodeling of our location- floors, walls, plumbing, electrical,  etc...

·  Walk-in Cooler & tap system- the most important part of our business

·  Bar, Tables, Shelves- We will need a place to serve the beer and a place to display all our awesome growlers

The Impact

We are not a nameless corporation. We are two people with a dream to serve the best beer possible to the people of central Texas. Your contribution will help us to get up and going. We want to be a place where everyone is comfortable whether you're a beer nerd or just getting started with craft beer. We want to help the environment by cutting down on the amount of packaging used, and we want to provide personal service and be part of the community. Before we can do any of that, we need the community's help. 

What You Get

Besides our undying gratitude, we've come up with a few perks for the different donation levels. All financial donors will be listed on our website as well. Growlers and Swag Bags will be available for in-store pick up once we open. 

·  Any amount....our eternal gratitude!

·  $25- A t-shirt with the Four Pints logo

·  $75- A Growler with the Four Pints logo and vouchers for 2 fills

·  $150- Four Pints Swag Bag with a logo bag, t-shirt, and a growler with the Four Pints logo and a voucher for 4 free fills. 

·  $500- Four Pints Swag Bag with a logo bag, t-shirt, pint glass & sticker, FP Founder's Club growler and monthly growler fills for the first 3 months.

·  $1000-Founder's Club. Name on our Founder's Wall, FP Founder's club t-shirt, FP Founder's club growler and monthly growler fills for the first 6 months.

·  $5000- Founder's Club. Name on our Founder's Wall, FP Founder's club t-shirt, FP Founder's club growler and monthly growler fills for the first year. A one-of-a-kind Doug Moreland carving!

Other ways you can help

If you can't donate at this time, there are still ways to help:

  • Tell your friends about our campaign. Spread the word far and wide!
  • Join our mailing list. You can find the link on our Facebook page.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
