story:
The Story of Afrokristian.com

With big dreams and a small budget, often times a collaborative effort is necessary.  An environment where everyone pulls together their resources to make one fully functioning machine of talent is the best way to make your dreams come true.  It just so happens “Afro Kristian” has all the components to be the perfect place for this concept.  

Do you ever think about dating but don’t want to sort through all the sites that aren’t in line with your beliefs?

Do you want to know if the person behind the picture is who they say they are?

Are you interested in meeting someone but don’t have the time?

If you answered, “Yes” to any of these questions, you may want to keep reading…

Overview

"Our popular culture reinforces the idea that online dating can be sleazy and deceiving. We're out to change that fallacious idea one “Afro Kristian” subscriber at a time! Help us establish a program to serve people in need of a dating network with good values and morals. Offering “Afro Kristian” to an individual can change their ideas about what they can accomplish for the rest of his or her life when they find the right companion.  Finding out your love life can be beautiful and fulfilling with ease will be life changing. Empower us to make this vision a reality with a donation to this project today!"

More about the Project

Our fairy-tale view of romance — 88 percent of adults believe in soul mates — has contributed to the fact that although 90 percent of people will marry in their lifetimes, only three in 10 will find enduring love, Tashiro says. (He gets this statistic by adding unhappy marriages and separations to the 50 percent divorce rate).– This fact prompted us to dig deeper into a solution.  This is where we started to envision “Afro Kristian” and all the possible benefits we could bring to people:

>Bring people partners with good values

>Create a network of individuals who are like minded

>Give people the opportunity to meet their soul mate

When reviewing these benefits and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is a business that needs to be created. We feel these features will make us incredibly qualified to succeed.  This paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us the leader in the industry. Our mission is to take care of every customer and staff member with the upmost respect and care.  We feel this will be the key to our customer AND staff retention.

About Us

Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched service that’s for Christians and Africans alike. Unfortunately we have noticed when companies design new concepts they contain preliminary flaws but our goal is to stay dedicated to quality because we know your love is at stake! We have engineered a unique method and user-friendly results that is second to none. Not only that, but they are more affordable so do not have to worry about it being price prohibitive. Help us make this a reality and let’s find love for less!  I am an African (Kenyan) professional (35yrs old) working in Australia and I’ve seen this kind of website work really well here in Australia with similar sites and that is why I believe it can work in Africa. I am also from a solid Christian background and believe in good Christian values.  The Internet use in Africa is growing at a very fast rate and this idea would be able to grow and develop with this rise of Internet use.  So not only is Africa ready for this change they are yearning for it and I am honored to be able to bring this solution to people.

How You Can Help

For us to bring the “Afro Kristian” to life, we need your support!

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost of further development, manufacturing and production.  We will also use our funding to test our concept to make it better.  We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions.

We will also be using the funding to expand the possibilities for the usage for consumers as well as enterprise solutions of the “Afro Kristian”, to further customize the first version of the “Afro Kristian” and create additional products and services that will compliment “Afro Kristian”.

The “Afro Kristian” needs pledging but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread the word and get things started!

How We'll Use the Funds

We need about 30,000 USD  in order to break “Afro Kristian” onto the market. That will includes marketing, materials, labor and related expenses for start-up.

Final Thank You and Links

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute thanks to all our generous supporters.  Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve.  You are part of our “Afro Kristian” family.

If you cannot donate but you are interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!

If you wish to contact us:

Website:http://www.afrokristian.com

Our Social Media Connections:

>Twitter:https://twitter.com/afrokristian

> Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/afrokristian

Contact Information

Name:Tony Kirui

Phone Number:+61403648078

E Mail:admin@afrokristian.com

If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel free to contact us at admin@afrokristian.com

unhappy marriages and separations to the 50 percent divorce rate).– This fact prompted us to dig deeper
into a solution.  This is where we
started to envision “Afro Kristian” and all the possible benefits we could
bring to people:
>Bring people partners with
good values
>Create a network of
individuals who are like minded
>Give people the opportunity
to meet their soul mate
When
reviewing these benefits and much more, it inspired and assured us that this is
a business that needs to be created. We feel these features will make us
incredibly qualified to succeed.  This
paired with attention to detail and quality service will make us the leader in
the industry. Our mission is to take care of every customer and staff member
with the upmost respect and care.  We
feel this will be the key to our customer AND staff retention.
About Us
Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched
service that’s
for Christians and Africans alike. Unfortunately we have noticed when companies
design new concepts they contain preliminary flaws but our goal is to stay
dedicated to quality because we know your love is at stake! We have engineered
a unique method and user-friendly results that is second to none. Not only
that, but they are more affordable so do not have to worry about it being price
prohibitive. Help us make this a reality and let’s find love for less!  I am an African (Kenyan) professional (35yrs
old) working in Australia and I’ve seen this kind of website work really well
here in Australia with similar sites and that is why I believe it can work in
Africa. I am also from a solid Christian background and believe in good
Christian values.  The Internet use in
Africa is growing at a very fast rate and this idea would be able to grow and
develop with this rise of Internet use. 
So not only is Africa ready for this change they are yearning for it and
I am honored to be able to bring this solution to people.
How You Can Help
For us to bring the “Afro Kristian” to
life, we need your support!
Your generous funding will help us get
things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost
of further development, manufacturing and production.  We will also use our funding to test our
concept to make it better.  We are
committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best
possible solutions.
We will also be using the funding to
expand the possibilities for the usage for consumers as well as enterprise
solutions of the “Afro Kristian”, to further customize the first version of the
“Afro Kristian” and create additional products and services that will
compliment “Afro Kristian”.
The “Afro Kristian” needs pledging but
above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as
much as we do then please take a moment to click on one of our social media
buttons (Facebook, Twitter and YouTube at the bottom of the page). Help us spread
the word and get things started!
How We'll Use the Funds
We need about 30,000 USD  in
order to break “Afro Kristian” onto the market. That will includes marketing,
materials, labor and related expenses for start-up. 
Final Thank You and Links
We feel so grateful to everyone who has
taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they
could to make a difference and helping us spread the word.  We have spent the last few months working
hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute
thanks to all our generous supporters. 
Please know your efforts, even the smallest, don’t go unnoticed.  We will continue to keep you posted on what
your donation helped us achieve.  You are
part of our “Afro Kristian” family.
If you cannot donate but you are
interested in helping, please contact us so we can set you up with a referral
program! You might even be able to earn perks, just by spreading the word!
If you wish to contact us:
Website:http://www.afrokristian.com
Our Social Media Connections:
>Twitter:https://twitter.com/afrokristian
> Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/afrokristian
Contact
Information
Name:Tony Kirui
Phone Number:+61403648078
E Mail:admin@afrokristian.com
If you have thoughts or would like to discuss
a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you, please feel
free to contact us at admin@afrokristian.com

story:
Supporting community leaders who make a difference.

THE INSTITUTE FOR VITAL MINISTRY
Companions for your journey.

Working in community nonprofits, churches, 
and social entrepreneurship ventures.

Hi, I’m Ken Crawford. I want to take this opportunity to share some of my story and to invite you along on this journey. I am establishing a US based organization to support leaders of community nonprofits, both faith-based and secular. And I need your help.

The Institute for Vital Ministry will be a platform to provide leadership and life coaching, spiritual direction and pastoral counseling to clergy and lay leaders of churches and community based nonprofits. We will also be a center for researching best practices for the changing landscapes of ministry - what I like to call the New Pastoral Economy.

Please, contribute today
so that community leaders
will get the support they need.

What is IVM?

Institute for Vital Ministry (IVM) will become a community of diverse individuals, groups, and stake holders who collaborate as they develop vital faith and ministry.  The purpose is to create, collect and share resources to develop, support and renew vital ministry. This work is accomplished through a combination of peer learning communities, training events, immersion experiences, consulting, and individual coaching, counseling and spiritual direction.  By design the program will seek to address and integrate the full range of needs of participants in a holistic model. I've been doing this work for over 15 years, and I want to make these tools available to anyone who wants them. Visit the gallery to see video testimonials from some of my clients and colleagues. Here's one example:

How else can you get involved?

  • Pray for this ministry and the people we will serve that they would be strengthened for the important work to which they are called.
  • Leave a testimonial. Tell your story of how you have seen or experienced the positive impact of coaching and spiritual direction.
  • Join a coaching cohort and sign up as a resource person to contribute your expertise so that others can benefit.
  • Share the link with your friends and associates through email or social media. Spread the word to others who would be interested in supporting our efforts.

Why are we raising funds through a nonprofit?

  • We would like to lighten the financial burden of coaching fees for those who need and want the services we will offer.
  • We need to develop the strategic relationships that will enhance the work of our partner nonprofits.
  • We will conduct research, interviews, speaking and writing, some of which will not receive any other financial support

Why is it needed?

Changes in church and culture place increasing pressure on ministry leaders to reach people in nontraditional ways, and fund their ministries through a combination of bivocational and entrepreneurial efforts. Along the way, we encounter numerous individuals and families who need pastoral and spiritual support but lack connection to a traditional faith community. Clergy who were trained exclusively for parish ministry need to find new models. Laity who want to answer a call to ministry recognize that fulltime employment in a local parish is less practical or financially sustainable. My work helps clergy, laity and congregations faithfully and effectively respond to these pressures.

IVM will offer programming to laity and clergy at varying stages of their personal and ministry formation, and will provide opportunities for these participants to interact with and learn from individuals in other groups. While there are distinctions and differences between us, far more similarities unite us, and when we come together, we can better learn from and support one another.

Traditional faith communities still have the potential to be agents of social good and human flourishing. At the same time, we need new models of organizing and collaborating to help one another move toward wholeness. We believe in a Yes / And approach, rather than either / or. Entrepreneurial and innovative energy and creativity will help us to recognize and respond to challenges today and into the future. The opportunity for organizations to make a meaningful difference cannot be overstated.

There is a lot to do to get iVM up and running to support leaders of churches and other community nonprofits in their missions to affect positive change - and I couldn’t be more excited to lead the charge. Together we can make iVM a reality - and ultimately change the world. Contribute today!

Remember:
       Wherever your road leads…
                …you don’t have to travel alone.

Give today. Change a life.

* I am fortunate to be launching this non-profit under the fiscal sponsorhip of the Missional Wisdom Foundation, a 501c3, so your contributions are tax deductible. To learn more about MWF, visit www.MissionalWisdom.com.

story:
Qui sommes nous ?


Technicien en informatique, âgé de 40ans, passionné par les nouvelles technologies ,en me penchant sur le coût actuel du matériel informatique , je me suis dis et  demander pourquoi ne pas créer ma propre structure.

Adinformatik , jeune entreprise créée en octobre 2014, domicilié aux Antilles et installée à Paris, a la volonté de vouloir proposer   des prix raisonnablement corrects pour ne pas dire attractifs. 

Tous nos produits seront exclusivement commercialisés sur  Internet.

M’accompagnent dans ce projet des partenaires reconnus et qui n’attendent que le

lancement.

Ce dont nous avons besoin

Notre démarche est la suivante : tout d’abord constituer une trésorerie de 8000€ pour pouvoir par la suite garantir à nos clients un service de qualité et commercialiser nos produits sur les sites  http://www.adinformatik.com et www.ad-ebook.com.

Le  projet ne se limitera pas seulement  à la  vente de matériel informatique. Il comprendra aussi la vente de  livres numériques car je crois à la survie des écrits et de la littérature.

Garantir nos fournisseurs, payer les  charges qui nous incombent et développer nos catalogues respectifs.

Pour se faire, dans un premier temps nous commercialiserons  pour ADK (Adinformatik) aux Antilles et en France  Métropolitaine et au fil de l'eau nous continuerons notre progression .

En ce qui concerne les livres numériques, la  commercialisation se fera exclusivement sur le Net. 

Je suis capable de vous en proposer un large choix si vous m’en donnez la possibilité.

Comment ?  En prenant déja  le temps nécessaire  à  lire notre article et surtout en nous apportant votre  contribution, si minime soit-elle.

 Nous vous en  remercions par avance.


Je vous invite   tous simplement à  ne pas nous  oublier  et si vous en  avez l’opportunité n’hésitez pas à partager avec vos amis, collègues et familles nos liens,nos adresses ou  en prononçant juste un mot « Adinformatik ».

Nous croyons en l’avenir et surtout nous souhaitons que les  prix du matériel informatique soient à la portée de tous et surtout qu’ « Adinformatik » se positionne  dans cette  dynamique et cela grace a vous.

Nous remercions d'emblée toutes les personnes qui prendront le temps et le plaisir nécessaire à lire notre article et pour ceux qui ne pourraient contribuer . 


Les remerciements sont de mise et je vous invite tous à ne pas nous oublier  encore une fois  pensez juste un mot   « adinformatik ». 
 

Je vous souhaite à tous  une bonne lecture et au plaisir de vous revoir. Sur nos sites ..



Qui sommes nous ?

Adinformatik le hight Tec Numérique.


About us
I’ m a 40 years  old computer technician and I have a passion for new technologies. The high prices of hardware are behind  my business idea.
Adinformatik , a  young company created in 2014, and set up in the Caribbean, wishes to enable its prospective customer to enjoy reasonable, we can even say attractive prices. All our items will be sold exclusively on the Internet.
Recognized partners accompany me in the project and are waiting impatiently

for me to launch the business.

What do we need?

Here is my plan: first of all I need to build up a cash reserve of 8000€ in order to be able to provide our customers with a good quality of service and market our items on the 2 websites: http://www.adinformatik.com  and www.ad-ebook.com

My business will also include the sale of e-books because I am a firm believer
  in written papers and literature.
Purpose. To be able to sell the items, to provide guarantees to our suppliers, pay the different charges and develop ourrespective catalogues.

In order to do that, we’ll start with selling for ADK (Adinformatik) in the Caribbean Islands  and  in France .And secondly  we will of course continue
to increase.With regard to e-books, they will be sold exclusively on the Internet.
I will be able to offer you a big choice if you give me this possibility.

So, please, take time to read this page and don’t hesitate  to make your contribution even if it’s à small contribution!
Don’t hesitate either to share with your friends, colleagues and members of your family.
We have faith in the future and above all, we want the prices of hardware to be within everyone’s means.
“Adinformatik”  wishes to be prominent on this market with your support.

story:
Who are we?

We are Wayfarerr [wey-fair-err], travelers, especially on foot.

Wayfarerr is an initiative born out of passion to provide unparalleled support and income generation capabilities to the technology crippled, down trodden, low income groups, rural communities, unemployed, powerless individuals and families of the world via an eCommerce platform.

We are concentrating on Leisure industry to help people provide their offerings/services that are part of their daily life and are mostly in the categories that include but not limited to art, culture, farming, festivals, food, hospitality, music, nature,  rural living, sports, spiritual, theatre etc., without they ever worrying about their lack of access to - markets, information and finances. 


In the process we are not only eliminating the financial, technological and societal barriers that impede the growth and the standard of living of vast swathes of the populations, but also presenting the consumers with a whole new world to "discover their inner explorer" thru the offerings/services on this eCommerce platform that are mainly crowd sourced, unique and hard to find!

So far....

We have implemented pilot project in the remote regions of India to perfect the processes, identification of weaknesses and most importantly to evaluate the feasibility of the idea.

Currently, we are concentrating on development of the eCommerce platform.

Why are we fund raising?

Just like the people whom we are trying to help, we are facing hurdles when it comes to our costs, which inturn is restricting our creative capabilities.
Some of our costs include
  • Hosting Server, Payment Gateway, Domains, Internet
  • Salaries
  • Travel, Communications, Marketing
  • Enrolment drives

What does your contribution do?

"Little drops of water makes a mighty ocean"
Your every penny counts and you will be the reason for those smiles on the faces of the people who make a decent living using this platform.

Our major challenge is...

to bring all these disparate populations and their offerings/services on to a single platform and help them overcome technology barriers and we are earnestly working towards eliminating this hurdle.

Progress Report

Our latest engagements

Link: Niranthara's national Theatre festival



Link: Northeast Food & cultural festival


You can't help us financially?

Not a problem!
There are many ways you can be a part of Wayfarerr's journey by
  • Spreading the word across your network
  • Offering your services
  • Contributing with your resources
  • Last but not least - Praying for us to reach our goal to make this world a happier place for all, one at a time!

story:
The Backstory

I love sweets! I love making them, I love eating them, and I love sharing them with others. Cookies, candies, pound cakes…For years, I would buy the box, follow the recipe and pat myself on the back for ‘making them myself’ instead of buying them ready-made and full of preservatives.

Yeah, I know. I laugh at myself now, too.

I quit smoking one day. Later that day, I took up eating. After a few months (and a couple dozen pounds), I started actually reading the labels on what I was putting in my mouth. I didn’t like what I saw, so I started gathering recipes and learned how to bake. A few years after that, the Farmer Assurance Provision became a thing (commonly referred to as the Monsanto Protection Act). Horrified, I threw out everything in my pantry and started over.

Petty’s Petits is the end result. Oh, they’re not the most figure-friendly snacks on the market, but they are absolutely organic, preservative-free and as GMO-free as I can get them. They are also the most delicious thing you’ll put in your mouth today. I have refined my favorite recipes into works of art, applied for and received my business license, and I’m ready to share my creations with the world!

I just need your help.

The cottage food industry is rapidly-growing, producing ever-increasing quantities of honey, breads and cakes, cookies, jams and fruit pies in uninspected home kitchens across America. Farmers’ markets, craft shows and roadside stands are all places cottage foods call home. We are small businesses (under $15,000 annual gross revenue), but we create big tastes and we have big dreams!

I have brought Petty’s Petits as far as I can by myself. Will you make a contribution, try some of my cookies and help me take it further?

The Numbers

Although my primary job for the last 25 years has been ‘single mom’, I have dabbled in other things (such as Compliance and Risk Management), and I do have a degree in Business Management. After running the numbers, I have determined that I will need approximately $5,000 in donations to cover the following start-up expenses (and any funds received will be spent in this order):

  • 30% self-employment tax on any donations received (wow!)

  • Indiegogo’s facilitation fees

  • perk ingredient and packaging inventories

  • Kitchenaid professional mixer (not the tilt-up model)

  • company phone

  • website

  • banking fees

  • business cards and labels

Any funds received in excess of my goal will be put towards Phase Two (a food truck – see below)!

The Deal

So what do you, the philanthropist, get out of helping me reach my goal (besides a warm, fuzzy feeling)?

Well, you get to see what all the fuss is about. For a $20 donation (plus shipping), I will send you one dozen Key Lime White Chocolate Chip cookies. (Except for my Key Lime Cheesecake, these cookies are my most-requested item!) For $50 (plus shipping), you get two dozen cookies and a half dozen Butterballs. A $100 donation (plus shipping) will score you three dozen cookies and two dozen Butterballs. For $200, I will immortalize you as a custom petit recipe and put you on the menu!

***All products contain gluten and dairy! Butterballs contain nuts!***

*shipping charges will be invoiced via PayPal after campaign ends*

The Vision

Cottage industry operations are, by law, very small, but Petty’s Petits has bigger dreams! Once we get too big for the home kitchen, we have our sights set on a food truck – traveling the country, meeting new people and sharing the love. Our ultimate goal? To open an Earth Ship bed & breakfast with an in-house bakery: a permanent, eco-friendly, self-sustainable home for Petty’s Petits for generations to come. But…..first things first!

By supporting Petty’s Petits, you’ll be helping a single mom chase the American dream: to give up her two jobs and have the liberty to pursue a life that brings happiness. Cookies, clusters, cakes – everybody loves these things! And I love making them! It’s a win-win, no matter how you look at it, and the fact that GMO-users will be losing business is the best bonus I can think of. Help send them a message (since our politicians won’t) by giving Petty’s Petits the chance to compete!

The Problem

It’s hard to keep a small business alive. Half of them die within their first year. That’s why I’m asking for a full year’s worth of funding up front. I don’t have to lease commercial space (cottage kitchens are, by law, required to be in your own home), but I do need a hosted website, a business phone, a business bank account…as well as everything else I haven’t even thought of, yet. With your help, Petty’s Petits will be able to weather that critical first year (and the inevitable learning curve).

The Assist

We need all the help we can get to get our name out there! Money is always nice, but there are things that youcan do to help that won’t cost you a dime:

  • Got friends? Share the link to my campaign on your Facebook – tag your friends who love sweets! Remember, Petty’s Petits are organic AND preservative-free (some varieties are even totally GMO-free)!

  • Got followers? Are you a blogger, foodie or otherwise connected to the GMO-free movement? Send me an email and I might just send you a free sample!

  • Do you live in the central Florida area and need something for a gathering (PTA, Tupperware party, etc)? Send me an email! Depending on what you need, Petty’s Petits may be able to donate some love.
story_txt:
The
Backstory
I love sweets! I love making them, I
love eating them, and I love sharing them with others. Cookies, candies, pound cakes…For
years, I would buy the box, follow the recipe and pat myself on the back for
‘making them myself’ instead of buying them ready-made and full of
preservatives.
Yeah, I know. I laugh at myself now,
too.
I quit smoking one day. Later that
day, I took up eating. After a few months (and a couple dozen pounds), I
started actually reading the labels on what I was putting in my mouth. I didn’t
like what I saw, so I started gathering recipes and learned how to bake. A few years
after that, the Farmer Assurance
Provision became a thing (commonly referred to as the Monsanto Protection Act).
Horrified, I threw out everything in my pantry and started over.
Petty’s Petits is the end result.
Oh, they’re not the most figure-friendly snacks on the market, but they are absolutely organic,
preservative-free and as GMO-free as I can get them. They are also the most
delicious thing you’ll put in your mouth today. I have refined my favorite
recipes into works of art, applied for and received my business license, and
I’m ready to share my creations with the world! 
I just need your help.
The cottage food industry is
rapidly-growing, producing ever-increasing quantities of honey, breads and
cakes, cookies, jams and fruit pies in uninspected home kitchens across
America. Farmers’ markets, craft shows and roadside stands are all places
cottage foods call home. We are small businesses (under $15,000 annual gross
revenue), but we create big tastes and we have big dreams! 
I have brought Petty’s Petits as far
as I can by myself. Will you make a contribution, try some of my cookies and
help me take it further?
The Numbers
Although my primary job for the last
25 years has been ‘single mom’, I have
dabbled in other things (such as Compliance and Risk Management), and I do have a degree in Business Management.
After running the numbers, I have determined that I will need approximately $5,000
in donations to cover the following start-up expenses (and any funds received
will be spent in this order):

30% self-employment tax on any
donations received (wow!)
Indiegogo’s facilitation fees
perk ingredient and packaging
inventories
Kitchenaid professional mixer (not
the tilt-up model)
company phone
website
banking fees
business cards and labels

Any funds received in excess of my
goal will be put towards Phase Two (a food truck – see below)!
The Deal
So what do you, the philanthropist,
get out of helping me reach my goal (besides a warm, fuzzy feeling)? 
Well, you get to see what all the
fuss is about. For a $20 donation (plus shipping), I will send you one dozen Key
Lime White Chocolate Chip cookies. (Except
for my Key Lime Cheesecake, these cookies are my most-requested item!) For
$50 (plus shipping), you get two dozen cookies and a half dozen Butterballs. A
$100 donation (plus shipping) will score you three dozen cookies and two dozen
Butterballs. For $200, I will immortalize you as a custom petit recipe and put
you on the menu! 
***All products
contain gluten and dairy! Butterballs contain nuts!***
*shipping charges will be invoiced via PayPal after campaign
ends*
The
Vision
Cottage industry operations are, by
law, very small, but Petty’s Petits has bigger dreams! Once we get too big for
the home kitchen, we have our sights set on a food truck – traveling the
country, meeting new people and sharing the love. Our ultimate goal? To open an
Earth Ship bed & breakfast with an in-house bakery: a permanent,
eco-friendly, self-sustainable home for Petty’s Petits for generations to come.
But…..first things first!
By supporting Petty’s Petits, you’ll
be helping a single mom chase the American dream: to give up her two jobs and
have the liberty to pursue a life that brings happiness.
Cookies, clusters, cakes – everybody loves these things! And I love making
them! It’s a win-win, no matter how you look at it, and the fact that GMO-users
will be losing business is the best bonus I can think of. Help send them a
message (since our politicians won’t)
by giving Petty’s Petits the chance to compete! 
The
Problem
It’s hard to keep a small business alive.
Half of them die within their first year. That’s why I’m asking for a full
year’s worth of funding up front. I don’t have to lease commercial space
(cottage kitchens are, by law, required to be in your own home), but I do need a hosted website, a business
phone, a business bank account…as well as everything else I haven’t even
thought of, yet. With your help, Petty’s Petits will be able to weather that
critical first year (and the inevitable learning curve).
The
Assist
We need all the help we can get to
get our name out there! Money is always nice, but there are things that youcan
do to help that won’t cost you a dime:

Got friends? Share the link to my
campaign on your Facebook – tag your friends who love sweets! Remember, Petty’s
Petits are organic AND preservative-free (some varieties are even totally
GMO-free)!
Got followers? Are you a blogger,
foodie or otherwise connected to the GMO-free movement? Send me an email and I
might just send you a free sample!
Do you live in the central Florida
area and need something for a gathering (PTA, Tupperware party, etc)? Send me
an email! Depending on what you need, Petty’s Petits may be able to donate some
love.

story:
Kite Digital Publishing is the World's First Media Company Powered by Companies, and Controlled by the People.

The current media is broken. Journalists' stories are treated with suspicion. Companies are failing to communicate effectively to individuals in the digital world. Individuals are not getting the information from brands they love when, where and how they want it. 
Kite Digital Publishing is a new generation of media. We provide companies with strategy, content and technology to generate simple solutions with strong results. To generate these strong results, Kite gives individuals control over how they interact with these companies online, onsite and offsite. To do this, we create stories using empowering words, engaging images and inspiring video, then bring them to life through easy-to-use technology, for the ultimate digital experience. 

Want to Change the World? Help Us Get to Las Vegas!

'Collision' conference in Las Vegas has been described as the event 'bringing the world's most promising start-ups together.' 

Kite has been recognised as having something important to say, so we'll be attending 'Collision'. The conference will not only give us the 

opportunity to share our message with world's most influential individuals and companies, but also to make it happen.

But first, Kite needs to get from Australia to Las Vegas for the conference. 

By contributing to this project you will help fund Kite's trip to US, assist us share our message, and be part of creating the world's first media company controlled by the people. 

If we are unable to reach our initial target of $15,000, the proceeds of this campaign will be invested into sharing Kite's message. 

How Kite Will Put You in Control.

Las Vegas, and Beyond!

By contributing to Kite, you will help make the media better for everybody. By meeting the funding goals and investing in the activities below, Kite will be able to support those who support us. 

$15,000 Airfares, accommodation, conference ticket, branding, all travel expenses, for Collision Conference in Las Vegas for one person

$20,000 Airfares, accommodation, conference ticket, all travel expenses for Collision Conference in Las Vegas for two people
$25,000 Developing and sharing Kite's message
$50,000 The establishment of 'Kite's House.' A place where our team, friends and supporters can meet, discuss ideas, and make them happen. 
$75,000 Fit out the 'Kite House' with equipment, furniture and items to help the team create awesome content and easy-to-use technology for everyone to enjoy. 
$150,000 Create a creative studio in the 'Kite House' with video, photography and editing production capabilities, and operating costs for three months
$200,000 The development of Kite's own cross platform publishing software 
$400,000  Construction of Kite's highly secure dedicated server to increase the efficiency and quality of your digital experience


Let Kite Say 'Thank You'

$10 Thank you! You have contributed to making the world's first people-powered media company! We want your friends to know how much you've helped us. Keep an eye out for your name on our social media posts to get your spot in the sun. 
$25 Congratulations! You have scored yourself a spot on 'Kite's Wall of Fame!' Your name, photo and our eternal love for you will be made public on our website (and hopefully a physical wall in the Kite House') for all to see. 
$50 Not only have you earned a top spot on 'Kite's Wall of Fame', but you have also qualified for Kite's BETA groups. You will be one of the first people to experience Kite's awesomeness before it goes public.
$100 10% discount on your first strategy or content purchase with Kite
$500 Free 1 hour consultation with one of Kite's media directors
$1000 A free personal portrait shoot with one of Kite's leading editorial portrait photographers*
$2500 A free project communications strategy with any Kite purchase
$5000 Sponsor of Kite for 12 months. Branding will be included across selected marketing initiatives, identified as Kite's minor sponsor on Kite's website, mentions of your company across social media and 'Kite's News'.
$10,000 Major sponsor of Kite for 12 months. Branding will be included across all major marketing initiatives, identified as Kite's major sponsor in a premier position on Kite's website, inclusion across Kite's marketing and social media material, monthly updates about your company in 'Kite's News'
$15,000 Principal sponsor of Kite for 12 months. This package will include naming rights across Kite's major marketing initiatives, identification as Kite's principal sponsor on Kite's home page and throughout the website, inclusion in Kite's marketing and social media material, regular updates about your company in 'Kite News'**
*Australia and London only.
** Subject to availability. Conditions apply. 

The Impact

Whoever controls the media controls the mind. 
The power is in your hands. 
Be part of the change. 
At Kite, we believe in freedom, and challenging expectations in all that we create. Through quality content, beautiful design and easy-to-use technology, we bring stories to life. We promise to unite companies and individuals at the crossroads of art and technology, in the ultimate digital experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a financial position to contribute, you can still help!

The best way of helping Kite is to help us spread our message. So be sure to put the word out, make some noise on social media, and be part of the change!

story:
Short Summary

We are providing a home, experienced care takers and love to children in Kenema, Sierra Leone who have lost a responsible parent due to Ebola.  Most recently we located M'Balu Kamara, affectionately nicknamed Sweetie by nurses on the ebola ward after she arrived there with her sick mother who was too ill to tell them her daughter's name. You can read the New York Times article about her here.  Since the writing of that article Sweetie and her older brother Abdul were taken in by a health care worker, but her livelihood was again threatened when he too became ill with the disease. This past Saturday, while Sierra Leone was under a three day lockdown in which people were not allowed to leave their homes, we delivered food, clothes and toys to Sweetie and her adoptive family. Tracing children who have become orphans and ensuring that they are safe and cared for is essential in an environment like Sierra Leone, where 1 in 5 children die before age 5 from preventable diseases and children without stable homes are at risk for being trafficked or becoming street children. Help us provide hope that these children won't succumb to these circumstances. (See photos of our visit with Sweetie on the updates tab).




What We Need & What You Get

  • In order to succeed, children need more than the basics of food, shelter and school fees, they need access to educational tools & experiences that will prepare them to excel in an environment with few opportunities.
  • The children that we are sponsoring live in one facility and we are in regular contact with their caretakers and are able to monitor their progress.
  • In addition to providing for basic needs such as food, shelter, school supplies and fees, we will work to connect the orphans with programs that enhance their educational prospects and encourage them to develop into productive global citizens.

The Impact

  • These children need support not just from within Sierra Leone, but from around the world. 
  • In order to develop into contributing members of society who will contribute to the country's development, they need top quality education, global exposure and stable, loving homes.
  • With your support, we can provide them with material support, school enrollment fees and supplies, tutors, technology and a network that will connect them with the world. 

Risks & Challenges

Providing humanitarian aid to Sierra Leone from abroad is challenging even without the threat of one of the world's deadliest diseases which has dramatically reduced critical imports as Sierra Leone is quarantined from other parts of the world.  But here is why we can overcome these obstacles: 
  • We KNOW Sierra Leone.  We've grappled with the tough task of scouring the country for scarce resources and delivering them to remote areas of the country and we've delivered.  See: www.sierraleonewater.org
  • We are well connected within Sierra Leone and have the ability to identify key people on the ground to support our mission.
  • Our campaign coordinators for this mission have over 10 years of international & charity experience and have been working in Sierra Leone for decades.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please share our campaign on social media and encourage your friends, colleagues and family to take part:

story:
Depuis quelques années, on reproche de plus en plus à l’industrie des cosmétiques conventionnels d’utiliser des produits nocifs pour la santé. Substances issues de la pétrochimie, parabens, colorants synthétiques et fragrances chimiques sont malheureusement les principaux composants de cette industrie continuant de rapporter plus d'un milliard de dollars au Canada chaque année.

Très jeune, mon intérêt pour l’univers de la femme, de la beauté et des tendances m’a mené à poser un regard critique sur l’industrie du maquillage. Animée par le désir d'offrir aux femmes des cosmétiques frais composés d'ingrédients de qualité, et outillée de ma formation académique en design de produits, j'ai démarré en août 2014 mon entreprise de produits de maquillage naturel: Égérie Cosmétiques. 









Égérie Cosmétiques est une entreprise québécoise offrant des produits de maquillage issus à 100% d’ingrédients naturels. Sa mission première est de proposer aux femmes des produits de maquillage soulignant leur beauté sans aucun ingrédient nocif pour la santé.


Dans le but d'une consommation avertie, Égérie Cosmétiques a également comme mission d'éduquer les femmes en les aidant à faire des liens entre les ingrédients et leurs propriétés. En sachant ce qu'elles consomment, les femmes seront ainsi en mesure d'établir leurs propres standards de qualité.

Finalement, de par son image très actuelle et sa recherche constante de tendances, Égérie Cosmétiques se distingue des autres marques de produits de maquillage naturel en offrant des produits reflétant réellement la femme d'aujourd'hui.






Ainsi donc, en contribuant à cette levée de fonds, c'est tout le processus de création de produit que vous encouragez, de l'achat des ingrédients à la présentation des produits en magasins.


Voyez les merveilleux cadeaux qui vous seront offerts en contreparties de votre soutien!


Je vous remercie pour votre soutien!
Eve Aghaby, designer conceptrice et propriétaire - Égérie Cosmétiques

story:
CCC's Compassionate Need Program 

Our compassionate need program provides patients struggling with financial hardship with access to medication. Its goal is to effectively make available to those who most desperately need, but cannot afford, the relief, clinical improvement and quality of life that CCC provides to all of its patients. 

Compassionate Need Program members receive partial or full assistance in paying for their medication - with the cost paid using the program's funding. 

The Compassionate Need program is made possible by the generosity of those who decide to participate in our fundraising with their contributions - none of which are too small.

CCC pledges to match all proceeds generated through outside contributions for program funding, ensuring the financial capacity to provide for these patients is reliably maintained.

Due to present funding restrictions, our program's roster is currently full. However, the program is now open for application. It is our hope that through both contributions and the growth of CCC, we will have the financial capacity to enroll a new group of twenty applicant patients beginning April 2015.

As CCC grows and we receive contributions from those sympathetic to this program's goal, we commit to adding more Compassionate Need patients, and will continue to accept applications for those spots for when they become available. 


How the Program Works:

Compassionate Need Program members receive partial or full assistance in paying for their medication, for most patients the entire charge is paid using the program's funding. 

This enrollment lasts for three months and qualifies patients for assistance of up to $500/month worth of medication, as their treatment plan requires. CCC maintains close relationships with those patients and physicians who are involved in our Compassionate Need Program. 


Enrollment:

 Compassionate Need applicants must be registered as CT MMP patients, have designated Compassionate Care Center of CT as their dispensary, provide proof of financial need, and provide a letter or e-mail to CCC from the physician who is currently treating their qualifying condition expressing that the patient would benefit from being enrolled in the program and that they are willing receive updates on the patient's treatment plan from our dispensary. 

Qualifying conditions include any of those which the Department of Consumer Protection has designated as eligible for treatment and can be found here 


MAIL TO:


Compassionate Care Center of CT
4 Garella Road
Bethel, CT 06801

EMAIL TO:

compassionateneed@ccc-ct.com

Compassionate Need Program members receive partial or full assistance in paying for their medication, for most patients the entire charge is paid using the program's funding. 
This enrollment lasts for three months and qualifies patients for assistance of up to $500/month worth of medication, as their treatment plan requires. CCC maintains close relationships with those patients and physicians who are involved in our Compassionate Need Program. 

Enrollment:
 Compassionate Need applicants must be registered as CT MMP patients, have designated Compassionate Care Center of CT as their dispensary, provide proof of financial need, and provide a letter or e-mail to CCC from the physician who is currently treating their qualifying condition expressing that the patient would benefit from being enrolled in the program and that they are willing receive updates on the patient's treatment plan from our dispensary. 
Qualifying conditions include any of those which the Department of Consumer Protection has designated as eligible for treatment and can be found here 
MAIL TO:


Compassionate Care Center of CT4 Garella RoadBethel, CT 06801


EMAIL TO:
compassionateneed@ccc-ct.com

story:
The indigenous and Afro-descendant peoples of Nicaragua’s Caribbean coast have a long history of struggle for territorial rights. After the resolution of armed conflict with the Nicaraguan state in the 1980s, they won regional autonomy and began to mobilize for territorial recognition.  The Inter-American Court of Human Rights recognized their rights to communal property in 2001.  The ruling is supported by Law 445, which provides the legal framework for territorial demarcation and governance in Nicaragua.  In accordance with the law, the state has titled 36,440 km2 of territory to these communities.  Now one of the largest infrastructure projects in history threatens their hard-won victory.

The 2013 Nicaraguan Law 840 grants the Chinese-owned Hong Kong Nicaragua Canal Development Company (HKND) exclusive rights to construct and operate a US$50 billion interoceanic waterway three times the length of the Panama Canal.  The canal will bisect the Rama-Kriol Territory, which received an inalienable and non-transferable title in 2009. It will also impact the territory claimed by the Black Creole Indigenous Community of Bluefields, which is in the midst of the demarcation and titling process.

In developing the project, the state has failed to follow laws that guarantee indigenous and Afro-descendant rights to participate in decisions that affect their territories, even though the canal will irrevocably alter the way of life for communities in its path.  For instance, the planned port at the Caribbean terminus will displace the indigenous Rama people of Bangkukuk Taik, the last community with more than five Rama language speakers.  Canal construction also will dramatically impact the environment, biological diversity, and local subsistence economies, even creating a massive artificial lake in the Cerro Silva Natural Reserve.

Indigenous and Afro-descendant communities are fighting back.  Thanks to generous supporters of an Indiegogo campaign (The Monkey Point Legal Defense Fund), communal leaders filed a complaint with the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights (IACHR) in June of 2014 to protest the state’s failure to consult with their communities. As the IACHR considers the complaint, the communities’ legal representative, Dr. Maria Luisa Acosta, filed an additional request for precautionary measures after the official groundbreaking of the canal project in December of 2014. This is an emergency mechanism meant to protect communities at risk of irreparable harm and is independent of the initial case.  To ensure that the request for precautionary measures and the broader case against the Nicaraguan state succeed, we must raise $4,000 to support her legal work and travel. Donations of all sizes are deeply appreciated.

The fund will be administered by Jennifer Goett and Josh Mayer and will be used only for expenses and fees directly associated with the case.  Jennifer Goett is an Assistant Professor of Comparative Cultures and Politics and Michigan State University. Josh Mayer is a current Fulbright Fellow and graduate of Amherst College working in Nicaragua’s Southern Caribbean Coast Autonomous Region.

story:
Hello World!


WE REACHED OUR GOAL!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Any More contributions will go towards supplies. Thank you so much for all your support!
Click Here for My Website!

I recently painted my car with chalkboard paint to cover up a paint job gone wrong. In less than 12 hrs, I discovered how this new paint job brought people together. I began to focus on the car as a piece of public art, encouraging free-drawing and cultivating communal experiences.

I choose a new theme each week, announce it on the car, leave a bucket of chalk and see how the public participates!

Professionally, I am a Behavior Interventionist working in the education sector, my car was an instant hit with the kids! After a month of  driving my chalked car to work, I was approached by a mother who wanted my car at her child's birthday party.  Expanding the accessibility to private functions allowed a revenue generating model.  Shortly after that event, the car made an appearance at a wedding! 

Now, I have an opportunity to expand the Chalkcarxb experience with the introduction of a mobile photo booth.  The photo booth would be my gem, the car my niche!

My idea to make #chalkcarxb into the business, Chalkbox Photos LLC, was established in October 2014. The timeline was to get the website up and running and start booking the photo booth for December 2015. However, due to a surge of social media popularity and inquiries into event rental, it's clear the people of SoCal want the booth NOW!!! 

My goal is to be the go to for all unique party needs. This purpose of this campaign is to add a photo booth, expanding the Chalkcarxb experience. Future guests can enjoy quality photos, unlimited photos, and have the ability to upload their photos immediately to all social media outlets. 

What chalkboxphotos needs:

Click Here for My Website to see more photos of the booth!

Up front capital costs to launch the photo booth business is $10,000, which I currently have some capital towards.  I need your help in purchasing the actual photo booth.

1 portable Photo Booth (1 box of paper and ink that will last 4 large events) price: $5000

1 Social Media Kiosk Package & Green Screen/Lights: $1000

How you can Help:

There is no donation too small or too large. I will take any kind of help be it monetary, emotional support, professional support or mentoring. 

Help comes in many forms and I am humbled that you are even reading this far.

Risks & Challenges

Like any business there are many risks and challenges, right now my biggest challenge is lack of investment capital.

I am blessed to work in various elementary schools, so finding clients who would be interested in a chalkcar & the photo booth is not hard! 

The chalkcarxb has a sizable fan base on Instagram and Twitter, however the challenge is to increase followers! With the photo booth by my side and portable power I'll be able to set the car up anywhere with the booth, leaving my artist with a photo to remind them of their time chalking the car, thus making it more likely for them to follow my page and see deals and updates on the photo booth.

I am determined to make this business successful and have the goal of expanding it to be a nationwide company. Failure is not an option, and with you by my side, how could I?

Other Ways You Can Help

Reading this was the first step! Please share my link with all your friends and add Chalkcarxb on Instagram, Twitter, Tumbler, and Facebook (Chalk CarXB).

Thank you so much for reading and for all of your support!

story:
Short Summary

Bride of Faith strives to change the generational cycle and status-quo that exist for girls who were victims of inadequate parenting and the results of the foster care experience. We provide a safe HOME, emotional support, and life-skills to girls who have aged out of foster care and women facing homelessness. Bridge of Faith makes a positive impact by helping women to become women of purpose within their communities. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Bridge of Faith operates entirely with a volunteer staff which allows all proceeds to be utilized directly for the women residing at our homes. We  are privately and publicly funded, and this year we have collaborated with the USC School of Social Work Student Organization to  help us raise 5,000 dollars for the purposes of raising funds for our annual fashion show in March. Your generous contribution will help ensure that:
                     - We continue to provide 5,000 or more safe nights per year.
                    - We help instill hope, love, and a sense of permanency in the women.
                    - To continue to provide housing, and wrap around services.

Impact

A BOF HOME is not just a transitional housing but a model for change. We
have been featured in numerous newspapers, publications, and television
programs, in 2003 the New York Times called BOF "a model for the
nation." Our HOMEs are places to heal and our programs promote health in
body, mind, and spirit. Allowing our clients the time they need to achieve
wellness and stability makes us successful and sets us apart. Unlike many residential facilities for the homeless, a stay at BOF is not limited by the calendar our residents are encouraged to stay until they are emotionally stable, have secure
employment, and are fully capable of living independently. BOF is not a
shelter, it is a home. Residents are provided with a private, nicely furnished
bedroom and have complete access to common areas of the home and its outdoor
gardens. They have housekeeping responsibilities and work together as a family
unit. Our HOMEs are not just a “quick fix” but the permanency that generates
trust and produces life-long results.

So we ask: If you could save a life, would you?

We understand not everyone may be able to contribute to our humble cause, however, if you are breathing we need you! We are always looking for volunteers or simply help us share our campaign with your friends or relatives. Please make sure to use the "share tools" from this page.

story:
Hello all!

Have you ever dreamt of having a captain you can call to take you onto the river you love?

Well...

As most of you know I have been sailing on the Hudson River for 7 seasons, working as the first mate and steward with Tivoli sailing.


Sailing has become a large part of my heart:  the calm, the beauty, and the intensity that Nature provides.

It is a powerful thing to experience being in the middle of the Hudson River, and is an experience that should be shared.

I have dreamt of becoming a captain for many years and the time has come!

Many people I speak with would like more of an opportunity to be on the water and I would love to facilitate this experience! I am registered to take the captain's course this March and need the support of my beloved community to make this happen.

Time is of the essence. March is the only month I am able to take this course and I need your help to bring this into reality. If you are unable to contribute money, please share this link with as many people as you can. It will be a huge help!


The vision

Once I have splashed my sailing vessel into the Hudson River waters I would like to take this coming season to really get to know the Hudson-Athens stretch of the river; for most of my sailing experience is in the Saugerties and Tivoli area. 

After the 2015 season of learning this particular stretch of the Hudson, I would like to open up my services to the community–whether it be in form of trade, money, or working with fellow sailors to help them fulfill their vision. 

What I really long for is to sail with others, and I feel this license will help facilitate this experience for myself and others.


Here is the breakdown.

This fundraiser would help pay for

  • $775 week long course in Connecticut for captain's license
  • $325 two-day class for Masters 100 ton license
  • $100 CPR recertification
  • $50 Drug test
  • $120 in gas
  • $630 for housing in Connecticut
  • $350 for food while in Connecticut
  • $300 time allowed for study
  • $350 unforeseen expenses


I am excited to share the gifts of my experience and knowledge and would love if you could help me make this happen so we can celebrate the Hudson Valley the way she deserves:  with some good tunes, a steady breeze, and you and me on the river. :)

story:
SHIFT.

A New Way to Thrift.

Mission Statement- Shift Thrift Store is a social enterprise existing to enhance the Colorado Springs community by creating employment opportunities, promoting community involvement, preserving the environment and generating revenue for charitable causes through recycling of household goods.

We're working to raise $25,000 in the next 40 days to fund  store operating expenses and moving into our permanent location.  The Shift Thrift Store model is  self-sustaining based on our non-profit member and sales goals. By donating to Shift, you will help us reach our goals of giving money back to the community even sooner!

We are hosting several Shift parties throughout Colorado Springs.  

9/26 Shift Grand Opening Party @ Shift Thrift Store 218 W. Colorado

10/10 MER Snow Season Party @ Mountain Equipment Recyclers 1024 S. Tejon

10/14 Shift Night @ McCabe's 520 S. Tejon

We'll have special perks for each event that will be announced on social media that day only.  Follow our Facebook, Instagram and Twitter for details. 

Share our campaign with your friends for additional entries!

Other ways you can help:

Tell your friends about Shift Thrift Store, share our campaign on Facebook, donate household goods, shop at Shift, volunteer!

We are actively looking for volunteers to help during store hours, join the Social Media team, and more.  Contact us at 719-635-0989 or info@shiftthriftstore.com

Shift your habits. Shift your focus. Shift your motivation. Shift your direction. Shift to preserve. Shift to sustainability. Shift to protect the earth. Shift to buy local. Shift for community.

Make the Shift.

About Us: Shift Thrift Store is a 501c3 non-profit social enterprise retail outlet that gives a significant percentage of profits to charitable organizations throughout the Pikes Peak region. Shift's goal is to raise money for qualified non-profits by allocating the donations based on a consignment-style system. Donors to the store will specify which partner organization to designate the items. The inventory will be managed by consignment software and offer individual accounts for each organization. Periodic disbursements will be sent to the qualified non-profits based on a percentage of sale prices.

Thrift is a booming business as seen by the success of large thrift organizations. Every day in the Pikes Peak region thrift stores are filled with shoppers and items donated. The Shift model will capitalize on this industry while offering significant income to qualified organizations that help others in the community. For local charities, grants and donations are increasingly scarce. However, citizens have homes and businesses filled with items that can be donated on behalf of great causes. Shift will produce income every day of the year for years to come.

Shift offers multiple benefits to the community:

- Create jobs. Shift creates jobs in the community. Shift will be comprised of a paid staff and volunteers. Paid staff will include community members with employment disadvantages who are seeking job skills.

- Promoting community involvement. Shift will be a community hub collaborating with charitable organizations in the Pikes Peak Region. Shift will be an advocate for participating members by promoting their causes through store events, advertising, and more.

- Preserving the environment. The recycling of household goods keeps unwanted items out of landfills as well as reducing the need to purchase new items.

- Generate revenue for charitable causes. Shift will be a conduit of revenue for participating non-profit organizations through the donation and sale of household goods.

Each non-profit organization will receive 30% of the sales price of the donations made on their behalf. The remaining income will be used for business expenses, payroll, capital improvements, etc. Income after expenses will be used for additional benefit to the community or expansion of the social enterprise.

Shift the way you shop. Shift the way you give. Make the shift!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Looking For A Chance To Change

All of Us or None - Riverside is the local arm of a national organizing initiative started by incarcerated people, their loved ones and allies that organize and take action to end the discrimination faced by formerly incarcerated people in areas of employment, housing, education and social services that are face as the result of past criminal convictions.

We fight against discrimination faced after release and to fight for the human rights of prisoners. We are determined to win full restoration of the civil and human rights after release from prison.

Our goal is to build political power in the communities most affected by mass incarceration and the growth of the Prison Industrial Complex.

The emergence of All of Us or None (AOUON) is a concrete manifestation of the people most affected by an issue building a movement to combat it. Because the membership of All of Us or None is predominantly people of color, the success of our members, the drop in recidivism rate, and our emergence as a leading organization in the criminal justice/anti-prison movement shows a concrete impact by this movement.

AOUON uses all funds raised to promote anti- recidivism programs, human rights issues, and to build safe communities.

The Riverside Chapter of All Of Us Or None operates under the umbrella of Starting Over, Inc, and is led by a core team of organizers, 75% of whom are formerly incarcerated. All of Us or NONE gathers at 6:30 pm on the second Friday of each month at the Universalist Unitarian Church of Riverside located at 3525 Mission Inn Ave. Riverside, CA 92501, cross street Mission Inn. All are welcome to attend.

For more info, or to get further involved please visit our website at www.AllOfUsOrNoneRiverside.org

Looking For A Chance To ChangeAll of Us or None - Riverside is the
local arm of a national organizing initiative started by incarcerated
people, their loved ones and allies that organize and take action to
end the discrimination faced by formerly incarcerated people in areas
of employment, housing, education and social services that are face
as the result of past criminal convictions. 


We fight against discrimination faced

story:
My Story

After returning home from China with our daughter in 2007, I realized my passion is to help adoptive families raise the money they need to complete their adoption. Utilizing my 25-years as a fund-raising professional, I created a system of web-based, innovative tools and resources that would assist adoptive families in reaching their financial goals. After testing the tools and coaching numerous families with great success, today our services are licensed to adoption agencies and professionals across the country. When an adoption agency or professional partners with Your Adoption Finance Coach, they are helping their families solve the money problem and create a comprehensive financial plan that aligns with their adoption plan -- bringing their family together forever! 


Help Us Grow

Currently, we are serving 17 adoption agencies and professionals and over 450 families. Through word of mouth, and a proven track record, we are experiencing tremendous growth everyday! Our business model is based on agencies paying a license fee to offer our service to their families. We provide unlimited coaching and access to our services to the family. We never charge our families to participate in our programs.  Our current coaching staff is very close to reaching their capacity and we want to be able to serve more families! The agencies are limited in the amount of money they can pay for our services because most are nonprofit entities. Therefore, we are seeking support to build our team and hire three more adoption finance coaches that will be able to serve over 300 more families. The success of this campaign will allow more families access to our services through their adoption service provider.

The Impact

1-in-3 American’s are touched by Adoption! The taboo and secrecy of adoption from years ago is finally disappearing as more and more choose to build their family in this extraordinary way! Yet, still so many do not pursue adoption as a path. 

According to the Dave Thomas Foundation, 2/3 of American’s consider adoption each year, yet only 2% actually complete an adoption. We recognize that while there are other barriers, the #1 barrier is the high cost!

Whether domestic or international adoption, the costs range from $25,000 - $60,000. A very small percentage of prospective adoptive parents show up to the path of adoption with this kind of money ready to complete the process. In fact, it’s the opposite. Most find themselves on the path after an expensive and emotional journey through infertility treatments or other costly options that they've attempted. 

The Path

The path of adoption is typically through a licensed agency or attorney and the problem of money further exasperates itself because many of these professionals lack the core competency to help their families create a financial plan. The adoption plan alone is extensive --homestudy, medical reports, background checks-- the adoption service provider has a full plate in just completing the adoption.

Yet, overlooked by the provider is the PAIN that the family is feeling about the MONEY! This slows down the process and many families get stuck not knowing what to do first or how to create a financial plan for their adoption.

We Solve the Money Problem

The Adoption Finance Coaching System is a web-based, innovative system, which includes live and online coaching, on-demand training videos, budgeting and planning templates, an online gift registry service and more. This system provides adoptive families with the tools they need to create a comprehensive financial plan to fund their adoption.  Each plan is customized to fit their needs. Your Adoption Finance Coach partners with adoption agencies, professionals and attorneys throughout the country to provide this unique service to their clients, differentiating themselves from their competition and allowing them to do what they do best; creating families!

The video below is an example of Kelly Ellison, explaining to new prospective families how to use the tools and resource and how the system works.  

    

This video is one example of over four hours of content that is provided to families, along with the assistance of a personalized coach customizing a financial plan that fits their needs.  Adoption is a complex road; our services aligned with the adoption service provider helps the adoptive family so they don't have to go through this alone!
Check out: www.youradoptionfinancecoach.com for more testimonials, stories, resources and agencies providing our services.

Risks & Challenges

Adoption is a niche market and gaining the trust of industry leaders has had its challenges, but we have overcome those challenges, established our credibility and added value to the market,  growing from only 3 agencies in 2013 to 17 today.
Currently, our challenge is to deliver high quality services while we continue to grow. Making sure that our families are successful with writing grants, getting loans and raising the money they need to complete their adoptions is key to our success. Our agency partners entrust in us their most precious resource, their clients, and we take that very seriously. 
Every person on our team has been touched by adoption.  It's necessary to have this as a company philosophy.  Our team has had the experience and walked in the adoptive parent's shoes so we can properly support these families on their journey. As we grow, we are eager to bring to our team more professionals who have adoption experience who want to help others build their families in this incredible way!

Our Perks

All of the 'perks' below are unique items or services that have been designed to support our Campaign.  We want to thank everyone who helped us put these extraordinary items together! To see more about our PERKS please visit our web site:  www.youradoptionfinancecoach.com
$10  #ONESTEPCLOSER WRIST BAND

$25  #ONESTEPCLOSER T-SHIRT  

$35 #ONESTEPCLOSER TOTE AND T-SHIRT

$50 STUCK DVD AND AUTOGRAPHED BOOK

$100   CUSTOM DESIGNED #ONESTEPCLOSER PEWTER DOG TAG WITH CHARM (SELECT KEYCHAIN OR CHAIN)

     

$150    CUSTOM DESIGNED #ONESTEPCLOSER STERLING SILVER MEDALLION WITH CHARM

$200  CUSTOM DESIGNED #ONESTEP CHARM WITH YOUR MESSAGE (SELECT LEATHER NECKLACE OR KEY CHAIN)


And there are more perks....see other levels available and to read more about each perk, check out our web site:  www.youradoptionfinancecoach.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share with others who might be interested in supporting our efforts! And share our story with families and adoption professionals who may not be providing such innovative services to their clients.  We can help them by offering solutions that solve their clients anxiety and stress about money!

story:
Le 4L trophy : Une aventure humaine, solidaire et sportive

Considéré comme le plus grand Raid étudiant d’Europe, c’est plus de 6000 kms à parcourir en 10 jours à travers les routes de France, d’Espagne et le Sahara. Et tout ça, à bord d’un véhicule qui est tout sauf adapté au terrain: La mythique Renault 4L.

Un raid humanitaire avant tout

Au-delà de la dimension aventurière et sportive, chaque équipe de deux étudiants s’engage à amener dans ses bagages un ensemble de fournitures scolaires et d’équipements sportifs. En effet, une partie du matériel sera acheminée à la Ligue Marocaine de Protection de l’Enfance, dans le cadre d’un partenariat entre le 4L Trophy et l’association « Enfants du désert ». L’autre partie des fournitures sera distribuée dans les écoles et villages tout au long du parcours.

Ce que le raid va nous apporter

Pour nous la participation à ce raid va avant tout nous permettre de contribuer à un projet humanitaire de grande ampleur au Maroc.

 De plus, la possibilité de participer à une telle aventure sportive, mécanique et humanitaire nous a évidemment beaucoup séduits. Nous attendons également du 4L Trophy l’opportunité d’échanger avec des étudiants venus de toute l’Europe. L’immersion culturelle sera totale et de toute évidence inoubliable.

  Enfin, d’un point de vue professionnel, il est pour nous important de pouvoir mener à terme un projet complet comme celui du 4L Trophy.

Pensez à partager cette demande de don ! 

"Les petits ruisseaux font les grandes rivières"

story:
Cory Hynd is a 22year old young man who is a friend to anyone, never nasty or malicious, and would help anyone in need. He represented his town for both rugby and football. A hard working young man, who was working two jobs to save and prepare for the arrival of his little girl.
This young man who should be at home providing for his family and watching them grow, has for no fault of his own, other than being In the wrong place at the wrong time when a pub brawl spilled out on to the street. Has been convicted of GBH with intent and is serving six and a half years in prision.
This young man has had to miss the birth of his firstborn child, to see her grow and change as they do in the first few months of life. His step daughter who is 6 is crying herself to sleep at night, missing 'Corr's as she likes to call him, reading her bedtime story. And his girlfriend who is struggling to hold everything together as she is missing him so much......This young family should never be going through this as Cory Hynd is an innocent man.
For a top London solicitor to look over the case it will cost between £5000 - £10000 to see if he can appeal.
This young lad is innocent and I ask for your help in raising the monies needed for him to appeal.
The impact this sentence has had on the small town in which this family live, has been one of shock and dismay at the justice system, as they all no him to be an honest, down to earth young man who would not harm anyone.
Please help to get this young man home to his family
