story:
We are …

A group of dedicated Rotarians in the Palo Alto University Rotary Club (PAUR). We are excited to launch our first crowd-funding campaign to fund a maternal health clinic in El Salvador, one of the Central American countries where the Mayan civilization thrived.

We are working towards …

Building a health clinic for at risk pregnant teens in an underserved community in El Salvador on land owned by the community. The clinic will provide prenatal and postnatal care as well as much needed health education for both mothers and fathers.

This clinic will benefit young women like Carolina and Eva and young children like Jorgito.



We believe strong and healthy families are a foundation for strong communities. 

Did you know …

El Salvador is one of the poorest countries in the Western Hemisphere. On average people in El Salvador live on less than $2 USD per day.According to FISDL (Investment Fund for Local Development in El Salvador) the average family in Caluco survives on only $30 USD per month ($1 USD per day). [3]

The risk of complications from pregnancy is highest for young adolescent girls (11-19). [4] Skilled care before, during and after childbirth can save the lives of women and newborn babies and reduce the incidence of disability.[5] These young women, properly cared for, can then contribute to their community. Additionally, educating expectant mothers and fathers will help strengthen families which will strengthen the community.

During our February 2015 trip to El Salvador, PAUR met with Alejandra, Zaira and Karla - three beautiful young girls from Caluco. The girls explained why their community needed a clinic for young mothers. Each of the girls had friends who were pregnant as teenagers but did not receive adequate care because of the lack of a facility where private and dignified healthcare services could be provided. They expressed their concerns for the future of the community if the young mothers do not get proper care during pregnancy.

Currently, the community of Caluco has 104 pregnant women, of which 24 are adolescents. In some cases a woman as young as 19 is on her third child.  [6]

We work with trusted local organizations …

For this project, we are partnering with ESNA Village Network (ESNA). ESNA is a non-profit which connects villages in rural El Salvador with communities in North America to develop sustainable and effective partnerships to build lasting social change.  PAUR has worked with ESNA Village Network for the past 6 years in the community of Caluco with great success.

Why work with us …

PAUR has worked with other Rotary Clubs and NGOs in El Salvador for 10 years. For the past 8 years, we have focused our attention in the rural community of Caluco, located in Sonsonate. When PAUR first began working with Caluco, the community was ranked as 246th poorest of 252 ranked communities in El Salvador. Over the past 8 years, working closely with the community, PAUR and its partners have helped raise the community’s ranking 40 spaces to 206th in the country. [7] The PAUR projects focus on health, education and economic development. 

More information about other projects that PAUR has participated in can be found on the PAUR International Committee YouTube channel.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Money raised will be applied towards the building of the health clinic. If we fall short of the  fundraising goal, we will hold the funds raised in reserve and continue raising money  until our goal is reached. Any additional funds raised will be used to purchase equipment and furnishings for the clinic (estimated at $15,000 USD) or to rehabilitate and expand a local primary school in the community (rehabilitation estimated at $50,000 USD; expansion to cover grades through high school estimated at $90,000 USD). Rotarians travel at their own expense to monitor the progress of the projects we fund. $100% of what we raise will go to the community.

How we will spend the money we raise …

Putting your donation into practical terms…

Every little bit helps!

Imagine, giving up one  latte could buy 8 building blocks; a week of lunches 5 bags of cement.

Other ways you can help …

If you can’t donate, please consider helping us anyway!

Share our campaign with family and friends. 

Sources …

[1] 99% of all maternal deaths occur in developing countries. See, World Health Organization, http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs348/en/ Dr. Antonio Hernandez of FUDECOM (El Salvador) reported to PAUR in August 2015 that in El Salvador there are 52.8 maternal deaths per 1000 births, 65% of maternal deaths occur in women from 15 to 29 years old, there are 20 infant deaths per 1000 births.

[2] 11% of births worldwide  are to adolescent girls – but these births represent 23% of the overall burden of disease and disability. See, UNICEF Report 2012 http://www.unicef.org/media/files/PFC2012_A_report_card_on_adolescents.pdf

[3] See, http://www.fisdl.gob.sv/

[4] The World Health Organization reports that complications during pregnancy and childbirth are the second cause of death for girls aged 15-19 globally http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs364/en/

[5] http://www.who.int/maternal_child_adolescent/topics/newborn/every-newborn-action-plan-draft.pdf

[6] Information provided to PAUR Rotarians by Caluco Health Director, Dra. Marta Diaz Hernandez, during February 2015 visit.

[7] Oral report provided by La Fundación Salvadoreña para el Desarrollo Económico y Social (FUSADES) to PAUR Rotarians during February 2015 visit. http://fusades.org/

Copyright Notice

Videos and photos used with permission courtesy of Katie Cooney, Patrick O'Regan and ESNA Village Network.

Music:  "Theme Z" by Steve Combs & Delta Is is licensed by CC BY 4.0/Cut at 1.0 minutes, goes into another 1.4 minute from beginning of song; "Love Wins" by Lee Rosevere is licensed by CC BY 4.0

are to adolescent girls – but these births represent 23% of the overall burden
of disease and disability. See, UNICEF Report 2012 http://www.unicef.org/media/files/PFC2012_A_report_card_on_adolescents.pdf

[3] See, http://www.fisdl.gob.sv/

[4] The World Health Organization reports that complications
during pregnancy and childbirth are the second cause of death for girls aged 15-19 globally http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs364/en/
[5] http://www.who.int/maternal_child_adolescent/topics/newborn/every-newborn-action-plan-draft.pdf
[6] Information provided to PAUR Rotarians by Caluco Health
Director, Dra. Marta Diaz Hernandez, during February 2015 visit. 

[7] Oral report provided by La Fundación Salvadoreña para el Desarrollo Económico y
Social (FUSADES)
to PAUR Rotarians during February 2015 visit. http://fusades.org/
Copyright NoticeVideos and photos used with permission courtesy of Katie Cooney, Patrick O'Regan and ESNA Village Network.Music:  "Theme Z" by Steve Combs & Delta Is is
licensed by CC BY 4.0/Cut at 1.0 minutes, goes into another
1.4 minute from beginning of song; "Love Wins" by Lee Rosevere is licensed by CC BY 4.0

story:
Help us to build a Vajrakilaya Mandala at the Garchen Buddhist Institute, Southwest Buddhafield.

Hello,

My name is Alexander Dogaev.

I’m from Moscow, Russia, and I'm student of great master Kyabje Garchen Rinpoche. Drikung Kagyu Order is one of the Kagyu lineages of Tibetan Buddhism.

Kyabje Garchen Rinpoche, the great master of Tibetan Buddhism

In 2013 for the very first time Vajrakilaya Sangdrub (Secret Accomplishing practice) was held in Russia under leading of Kyabje Garchen Rinpoche. This is an intensive retreat which  continues for 5-7 days, 24 hours a day! The goal of this retreat is to achieve results in very short time. Similar to all Buddhist meditations, the aim of Vajrakilaya deity practice is to remove mind obscurations and attain enlightenment for the benefit of all sentient beings. We had a great turn out this time — there were more than 300 participants.

By request of our guru, for this retreat I built a three-dimensional Vajrakilaya Mandala in Moscow. In Buddhist cosmology Mandala represents the palace where the meditation Buddha abides and is a support for the accomplishment practice. For the Sangdrub we have to keep a lot of special blessing objects inside, on the sides and near to the Mandala. The Mandala that I made is especially designed so that it can be folded up and easily stored.

Me and my work

In 2014 I was also invited by Drikung Garchen Institute in Munich, Germany, to make a similar folding Mandala for the Great Kalachakra Empowerment.

Great Kalachakra Mandala in Munich

Now, lamas from Garchen Institute in Chino Valley, Arizona (the main Center of Kyabje Garchen Rinpoche in USA) have invited me to build a folding Mandala for a Vajrakilaya Sangdrub to be held there. Garchen Institute is also known as the Southwest Buddhafield. 

My goal is to build the requested Mandala for this international event. This Mandala will stay in the center and will be used for similar events that are held every year.

I’m seeking to raise $1,000 to purchase airplane tickets for me from Moscow to Los Angeles and for transportation from Los Angeles to Chino Valley, Arizona.

I will pray for every kind donor and additionally will place your name inside the Vajrakilaya Mandala during Sangdrub which is an exceptionally auspicious blessing.

Here is photos of Mandala which I've made

To thank you for your generosity I will mail you a Vajrakilaya deity photo that will stay with inside of Mandala throughout the retreat and will be blessed by Garchen Rinpoche.

Deeply appreciate your help!

And how it works:

And how I'm making it:

story:
Please read thoughtfully:  I feel as though I have been forgotten, and that as years go by the VA will sweep me or us under the rug.  It hasn't gotten better, I feel as though It has become worse.

Not a fun topic, I know, and it's embarrassing for me, but whats more embarrassing is how my condition is not taken seriously by the VA.  I have been back from Iraq since 2009 and after my tour of duty I was happy to be home, but things were not as I remembered them, and the way I handle stress and work, and just my everyday life has been getting worse.  I don't feel that I have the ability to fix my situation long enough for the VA to help me and give me benefits or proper treatment.  I am sick of waiting and I am sick of feeling like I'm begging them for help.

Whats Happening to me?  Well I've made a list of what is affecting me.

  • Sleepless nights due to nightmares or just insomnia
  • Difficulty dealing with stress
  • Always worried that my door is unlocked, (why me?)  Seriously this is what I worry about, I didn't even realize it until my brother said something to me about rechecking the lock several times.
  • Easily irritable in emotional situations
  • Unable to focus at work
  • Difficulty having any kind of long meaningful relationships

 

What I would do with the money?

  • Pay down my bills, get my gas turned back on (cold showers are a joy, I really don't mind them, but winter is coming)
  • Get my car insured properly
  • Find a good therapist or therapy to help manage my life
  • Deal with this issue without HEAVY medication (preferably)
  • Find a job that I can survive in or that would be less stressful
  • Finish my Associates Degree, (I'm only a couple classes away)
  • Help someone else in my situation once I get on my feet and out of this mess.
  • Have a little cushion left over to keep the bills under control until i get a better source of income.

This isn't what I pictured my life to be like after I got out of the Army.  I was just lucky enough to come back alive from Iraq, unfortunately I came back with something that has affected my daily life.  PTSD.  I have lost relationships and friendships because of the way my brain decides to handle situations.  I procrastinate over stressful issues and I have to exercise patience and caution when I am dealing with interpersonal relationships and work.  Last time I went to the VA they had me watch 2 DVD informational videos, and boy were they helpful...  I have no doubt that they will eventually get to my case but when, and how long will it take to enact it.  I would rather take any action.  If not I worry it will be too little too late while my life falls apart in front of me.  

Everything is piling up on me and I am in risk of losing my home and my car.  I just want to pay up my bills and have enough money left to either pay for proper treatment, or survive long enough for the VA to process me the correct way.   The more things pile up on me the more difficult it is for me to focus on important life responsibilities that need to be  handled.

I don't do drugs, I don't smoke and I'm not an alcoholic.  I simply want to feel normal and be able to work like a normal person and live my life like a normal person without the constant worry that if It does fall apart, I will have very little recourse through programs or agencies like the VA.  Keep me from slipping through the cracks and god willing I will find a way to pay it forward and help someone else in need. 

To be honest If I could have one job, or one mission in life it would be to help soldiers or just anybody who is on the verge of slipping through the cracks of society.  And to keep them from hitting that bottom that is so hard to climb out of.  

I thank you for reading what I had to say and even If you don't help me out, I love you, because you are a human being and whether I know you or not, I would fight for you again if given the chance, no matter what your race or religion may be.

- A Lost Warrior

story:
Hello our backers! 

Thank you for supporting us. We haven't reached our goal but we are happy that you believed in us and our project. It means a world to us. 

We will very soon start sending to you perks you've chosen. In the meantime feel free to promote our business among your contacts. You can always find us at http://lookcroatia.com

We wish you all the happiness in the world, many interesting and pleasant travels and Look! Croatia! experience. Thank you!


Hello every1! 

It's been three weeks since we started our campaign and we have decided to show you some places we offer to our clients, hoping this might help you decide to support our campaign. In the short movie attached with this post  we present you a small hotel, like tailor made just for our groups of not more than 8 persons, family members, friends or couples who want to spend a quality time together. Hotel carries a name Stara škola (The Old School). Watch the video and find out why.

And don't forget to share our story with your families, friends and acquaintances. They are all welcome to contribute to our goal. It's only one more week, people! 

Thanks and Look! Croatia!



Hello backers and you who are going to become it!

We have a very important information for you!

Have you already decided where to meet the New Year? No?  Don’t you worry; we have it covered for you!

Best gift ever – enjoy Zagreb, enjoy Croatia! How? Simply choose a Look! Croatia! ZG 4U City break perk on  http://igg.me/at/lookcroatia/x/12518683 and let us entertain you!  Only on the Nov 28th and 29th we give you double perk for the highest donation published. That means you can bring another pair of people with you! Isn’t it marvellous?

Or, you can say Hello! to 2016 twice in one single day. Where? In Gorski kotar, mountainous part of Croatia, green even when covered with snow, with pines growing up to the skies and friendly people to greet you with home made rakija (ra-ki-ya) (brandy), blueberry pie and venison served on your plate. We organize two countdowns on the December 31st there!


Don’t hesitate, at least not too long, it’s pretty popular and will be sold our very soon. Make up your mind and ask for our best offer for the occasion.

The 2016 comes only once in a lifetime, don’t miss the opportunity!

Wish you a nice day, big heart for our project and good decision making for the upcoming holiday!

Look! Croatia!

******************



Like it? Don't know where it is? We know. And Demi Moore knows it. Difference between us and Demi? Huge!

She won't take you there. We will – whenever you want it.

And right know we need money to keep the  wheels turning.

We need your help. Contribute to our project. As much as you can. Thank you!


What is it about!?

Look! Croatia! is a motto of our company. It is an invitation to you to come and have an inside look at what this wonderful country hides from a superficial observer. Our aim is to help you have your vacation organized in the best possible manner while you are in our homeland. Most of the time people travel without thinking too much about with whom they will have to spend time while on a trip. I am positive you pay attention to the quality of your free time.

Since it matters to you how and with whom you spend your precious vacation time, come to us! We will not put you in the double-decker with a hundred other people and talk to you via microphone while driving around. We will ask you to choose what you want to do, see and feel during your vacation. Once you tell us your wishes, we will tailor your trip across Croatia. We will suggest to you some additional entertaining activities you might experience while on the road to your chosen destination(s).You will be accompanied by maximum 7 other people and these people are ones of your choice too. You may bring with you your partner, family member, friend, someone you like.  We will rent a smaller vehicle for you, give you a private driver and your own tour guide and send you on your tour. We will put you in proven good premises overnight, you will eat only in restaurants we would. You will have fun and pleasure all along the journey. We’ll take care nothing goes wrong. We are here to make your vacation a dream you wouldn’t want to wake up from.


We offer you to have the most careless and relaxed travel in your life. We are ready to take care of all possible things on the road, stop if you want to stop to take a break, to shoot some photos, have a snack. There is always possibility for you to stay at some place a day or two longer or shorter than planned, to see more or less than planned, to change a bit a route if you want. We are flexible. So are our partners. So are our drivers and tour guides. And everyone who will be a part of your journey will be at your service 24/7.

We can meet almost all your wishes (sorry, can't take you to the Moon…yet).


Please read the English version of our letter to our friends (we will later upload the same in several other languages) :

Dear friends!

Have you ever wanted to travel away and on the road feel like a King?

Imagine: you land at the airport, arrive by train or bus to the station, dock in the harbour and there you are welcomed by our tour leader who will at all times be with you and take care that all your previously agreed wishes are fulfilled to your greatest pleasure!

Imagine that you wanted to camp on the mountain, relax in exclusive 5 * spa resort on the Adriatic coast, (learn how to) ride, search for gold in the river, hunt birds with your camera, boat canoe on white waters, learn how to make Lepoglava lace, make Slavonian sausage “kulen”, pick mushrooms that have been grown by Mother Nature herself, eat wild strawberries or blueberries as small as head of a pin but more delicious than any other fruit.


Imagine that you wanted to splatter in some of the many spas, climb the mountain cliffs of the Balkans, breathe still unpolluted mountain air scented with pine trees and healing herbs, drinking water from the spring, collect salt with your own hands, adopt a baby-bear, count dolphins or griffon vultures and help their survival.

Imagine that you wanted to pick grapes in the fall and make wine from it in coastal, island or continental vineyards and at the same time enjoy wines from previous years, to find your very own truffle under the ground or visit the smallest town in the world, run along sandy or pebble beaches, jump from reef into the water, swim in the bluest sea in the world, dive somewhere between 1,252 islands, islets, rocks and reefs, sail the open sea driven by the wind towards the sunrise or sunset, taste the fish caught just for you, prepared according to the recipe of our ancestors, soaked in olive oil from the olive tree under which you dine it, served with wine from the vineyard through which you look out to the open sea ...


Imagine it all in one vacation! And all the time you need not worry about anything because there are our guides who will make sure that you only enjoy!

I can make it possible for you!

That is why I built up a company for your pleasure on vacation. You are required just to tell us what you want and we will arrange for you only the best.

We can arrange your vacation on the Croatian territory, and we intend to spread our wings to Bosnia and Herzegovina, Montenegro, Serbia and Macedonia too. We can accommodate you in hotels with many stars, private apartments, and high class villas in isolated or less isolated sites, camps, mountain huts, barns, under clear skies. We can arrange accommodation in the most beautiful places in the world where the Sun wakes you up, for lunch you listen to the orchestra of crickets and smell of pine and the sound of waterfalls puts you asleep.

We can show you places that are known only by those who live there and my team:)


We will feed your bodies with delicacies which you have never heard of and that you will enjoy immensely, and drinks as you will not find anywhere else, your soul we will water with beauty, peace and pleasure to which you will always want to return. After this holiday we will become your best friends about whom you will talk to your friends at home.

And we will be happy to welcome you again, and again, and again. And your friends, too.

In order to ensure all promised and carry out your dream vacation, we decided to organize holidays for individuals, couples and groups of friends with not more than 8 people. So we will be able to dedicate our time to each of you. And you will feel comfortable in a familiar company.

Our services will be tailored upon your wishes, we will only suggest what is interesting in which time of year, because of course, we live here and we know better than you.

We are open throughout the year since with us you can see and experience something nice in each and every season.

Please contact us with your request. 

We look forward to meeting you. See you soon,

Yours

Look! Croatia! Team

story:
Sofia's Garden is a family business with Greek roots.
We are importing Greek products and hand pick our suppliers which we personally select after they meet the requirements of Sofia's Garden.
We want to provide our customers with authentic Greek products of the highest quality. So we work with small-scale producers and family businesses that can convey an authentic Greek flavor and emotion.
All our products are directly imported from Greece.
We have chosen to start with a small selection of products, but we are always looking for new partners in order to introduce new exciting tastes to you.

We build our brand around these three meanings passion, tradition, proximity.

story:
The Queen Collective | Who Are We?

Formed in Jan. 2015 in Brooklyn, NY, The Queen Collective was joined by Jessica Edouard - QueenThings, Denequa Williams - StrippedbyHD, and Dazia Wallerson - sapoDILLA, all African/Caribbean-American women writers and community activists dedicated to the empowerment of disenfranchised and  disadvantaged communities in the Greater New York City Area. After returning from our undergraduate/graduate experiences, we noticed a change in the face of our communities. As local businesses began closing and the incarceration rate increased in Brooklyn, NY, The Queen Collective was birthed out of the necessity and urgency to address community grievances, youth challenges, and women’s empowerment. 

The Queen Series Extravaganza

The Queen Series Extravaganza taking place on August 1, 2015 at the YWCA of Brooklyn( 30 Third Avenue, Brooklyn NY 11217) was formed to initiate the conversation about Womanhood today, sparking consciousness, critical thought and analysis about systems of discrimination, oppression, trauma, and worth. We are dedicated to motivating and enhancing the climate of Women’s empowerment through social, political, educational, economic and spiritual programming and discussion.

Your Contribution

  • Your gracious contribution will directly support young women in sustaining a healthy and balanced emotional living. 
  • Endorsing future programming will provide safe spaces for young women to promote self, one another, and the community, in confidence! 
  • Your donation will boost an increase in worth, productivity and community involvement as members discuss to dismantle systems of oppression, in order to live an esteem-filled life. 
  • Provide free entry for conference attendee's to access information and event discussion
  • Provide conference attendee's with FREE Gift Bags filled with beauty, stationery, and health/wellness products to promote healthy and balanced living. 
  • Your endorsement will aid  The Queen Collective in becoming an established non- profit organization with a  501(c)(3) code to further programming and impacting local and disenfranchised communities. 

The Impact | Why Empower?

  • We understand that as current events increase in tragedy and trauma, the journey becomes more challenging. However, is it crucial for The Queen Collective and our attendees to embody resilience, in the face of adversity. We believe that in order to overcome these hurdles, a group built on the solid foundation of support and dialogue will encourage the extension of education and outreach on the issues at hand.

Additional Programming

  • The Queen Collective programming includes: TQC Healing Sister Circle which sought to provide a safe space for women to gather and support one another, through discussion and meditation as they fostered the tools for change to dismantle systems and cycles of oppression. 
  • The Queen Collective programming includes: TQC Open Mic Picnic + Lawn Yoga which sought to forge connections between musicians, poets and creatives to positively influence their personal and professional lives, which offering yoga classes to promote an increased awareness of mind, body and spirit.
  • In addition to QueenSeries programming, The Queen Collective has assembled local youth groups known as Kings On The Rise (K.O.T.R.) and Queens On The Rise (Q.O.T.R.). In collaboration with non-profit organization, St. Nick’s Alliance at the Williamsburg Community Center. The Queen Collective has designed an empowerment curriculum to construct character skill building, self-esteem, and confidence through strengths-based activities with youth enduring disenfranchised circumstances. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't donate monetarily but still want to help? Perfect! Please help us by sharing this fundraising page on Social Media Platforms to increase the awareness of this program in New York City.
Want to learn more about us? Visit our INSTAGRAM today!

We humbly thank you for supporting our vision, mission, and agenda to empower the members of the Greater New York City community.

story:
Join the fun and help us complete Livingston’s local wine bar, Gourmet Cellar Uncorked!

The Gourmet Cellar Uncorked story

Gourmet Cellar Uncorked is very close to being open daily. When completed, it will be a cozy place to meet your friends after work, a day on the river or cross country skiing in Yellowstone. It’s a place to experience wonderful wines (or beers) with cheeses and specialty meats procured both locally and from around the globe.

While under construction, Gourmet Cellar Uncorked is only open Fridays for wine tastings. With your support it will soon be a complete, comfortable, unpretentious wine bar for you and your friends to relax, catch up and enjoy life in Livingston!

Debbie has owned and operated The Gourmet Cellar Wine & Specialty Food store in the Depot for over eleven years. During that time she passed the Level 1 Sommelier course and became one of the 406 Certified Cheese Professionals in the US.

                     

Debbie's love of fly fishing first drew her to Livingston. She feels fortunate to have combined her life passions of fishing, cooking and food and wine in such an idyllic setting as Livingston, Montana. Now Debbie is working to further improve Downtown and the Depot by bringing you Gourmet Cellar Uncorked Wine & Cheese Bar.

Gourmet Cellar Uncorked Wine & Cheese Bar experience

Wines and beers by the glass

Wine flights

Small plates including cheese, charcuterie (cured meats and patés), bread, olives, nuts,chutneys and fresh fruits in season

Wine and beer by the bottle

               

Historic Space

Gourmet Cellar Uncorked is located in the historic baggage building at the Livingston Depot. During the summer outside seating will provide gorgeous views of the surrounding mountains and big sky sunsets. During the winter months we will offer various tastings and a variety of classes to challenge both the seasoned wine enthusiast and those who are just beginning to explore the world of wine. The space will also be available for wine-inspired events (business meetings, bridal showers, birthday parties, French clubs, etc).

                                                    

What you’re funding

We're asking for your support to help fund a variety of things that we need to complete and have the doors open Monday – Saturday from 2 – 10 pm. A local designer and contractor are working with us to create a hip and comfortable space. The local artist who creates the beautiful cheese boards that we currently sell in the retail store will modify them to be used in Uncorked for meat and cheese plates.You will find wine glasses at the bar that really show off the wine and provide you with a true wine tasting experience. Your funding will help us complete the build out, purchase the necessary parts and pieces for a wine bar and add a local business that will continue to enhance the energy in Livingston.

                                                     

Risks and Challenges

I feel fortunate to have expanded the store and added the wine bar in the same historic building I began my business in eleven years ago. In an old building there are challenges with plumbing and electrical that increase costs. It's great to be making the improvements the space requires using local contractors and to be adding a bar built by Woodworks West and designed by Synergigi.

                                       

Other ways you can help

I know that some of you won’t be able to contribute but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help. Please help us spread the word about this campaign. Use the Indiegogo tools, Facebook or Twitter to make some noise and let your friends in on the upcoming Gourmet Cellar Uncorked Wine & Cheese Bar.

I will keep you up to date on our progress. Hope to see you soon at Gourmet Cellar Uncorked!

Thanks in advance for your support!

 A very special thanks to Bill Payne for the use of his composition "Sunday's First Light" for our video!

story:
Being an entrepreneur is hard, kind of like running a marathon.  Not everyone is cut out to run a marathon, it takes endurance.  But it doesn’t matter if you’re a man or a woman, if you put in the work and have the ability, you have the same opportunity to cross the finish line.  Founding a company for women entrepreneurs, is like running that same marathon carrying 50 pounds of sand in a backpack.  For a woman of color it’s like carrying that same backpack and running in the snow. 

We all know that gender bias exists but as a women entrepreneur, we’re counseled to not talk about it.  That we won’t succeed unless we play the game.  After all bullies don’t like to be called bullies. 

But change will never happen if we stay silent. 

What One Woman Can Do

I'm also an entrepreneur.  I've been a successful commercial real estate professional for over ten years.  I was frustrated by the fragmented technology and the unreliable data within the industry.  After extensive research and validation, I decided to build the solution.  

For a year and a half, I’ve worked 14 hour days, used all my savings, learned to code, designed algorithms, built an MVP and a team and we built the solution to the major pain-points within the commercial real estate industry.  Our technology is patentable and we have a waiting list of customers but we need funding prior to launch to pay for things such as servers, data, and patents. 

Studies show that female-led startups, in general, bring in higher revenue and are profitable more quickly than their male-owned counterparts, yet male competitors with little to no domain expertise and no prototype received millions of dollars in funding and we were unable to secure any.  

It just never occurred to me when I started out that our ability to raise funds would depend on the anatomy of our CEO and not by the quality of the platform itself and market demand. 

To see just how awesome the platform is, you can go to the gallery section or go to:  https://youtu.be/diVkWlE4tA0 

Be the Change

As a society we talk about gender bias, we read about it, we know it exists, we even accept it to a certain extent, but what is really being done about it? 

The average startup founder who receives funding is white male in their 20’s

I obviously do not fit this mold and I for one think it’s past time to break that mold. 

The face of an entrepreneur is changing.  We are women, people of color, gay, transgender.  Our abilities, our achievements should not be depend on, be judged by or defined by our gender, color, sexuality, size, or age.  We are resilient, we are persistent, and we are survivors.

If we continue to remain silent, change cannot happen.  

How You Can Help

In addition to helping one women entrepreneur, launch one startup that will create jobs, your support will be a voice against gender discrimination.  A voice of change.  Empowering those who are trying to make better lives for themselves, for their families, and for others. 

So please, donate today.  Ask your friends and family to as well.  Let’s show the world that the face of startup founders is changing.  We want to be judged on our abilities and not by our anatomy. 

 

$ Any Amount – No amount is too small or too large.  Can you give up Starbucks for a day, for a week?  Are you financially secure and have the means to donate more to a really good cause?  Any amount will not only be unimaginably appreciated, but sends a message that you are a part of the solution. 



Men Bashing?

Absolutely not.  We are against discrimination in any form.  Emma Watson expressed it eloquently:

story:
About us and our goals

My wife Blanche was born with Cerebral Palsy (CP) and seizures. Her seizures faded out in her teens, but returned after having our second child. The doctors have since placed her on medication to control them again.

After 12 years in the pest control industry I realize I need to spend more time with her and my family, and not working 6 days a week to make someone else rich. Allowing them more time with their family. After talking things over with my wife and children we have decided we would like to start the restaurant that my wife has dreamed of doing for a long time, but the capital needed for a venture as large as that is beyond our reach at the moment. So we decided to start off with a vending cart business serving hotdogs at local events and businesses.

  • My wife Blanche has always wanted to open a restaurant, as she has been told by many how wonderful a cook she is. I wish to make that dream of hers come true. Starting small with a street vending cart business and working up to a restaurant.
  • We plan on starting simple with 2-3 carts, working set locations to build a name for our Business. Being able to have carts at set locations will give us a chance to build regular customers for our food without the over head of a full time brick and mortar building.
  • The contributions you provide will allow us to not only start on our dream of opening a restaurant, but also allow me to spend more time with my wife to help care for her. I wish to be able to spend as much time with her and our children as possible. So running this type of business seems the most logical approach to achieving that goal.

Thank you for taking the time and considerations.

What We Need

Some of the expenses of starting this business include but not limited to the following:

  • 2-3 vending carts. These carts must be DOT approved and pass state health inspector certifications. The carts generally run between $2000-$4500 each.
  • Business and health permits along with insurance.
  • Safety equipment
  • All pans,utensils, propane tanks etc.
  • Creating accounts with wholesale vendors to supply all the food items needed.
  • Most locations also require a small amount of rent to allow vendors to operate. (This rent is still a lot less then renting a location for an all out restaurant.)
  • Flyers, business cards and other forms of advertising.

The Impact

Your contributions will give us the chance to see my wife's dream come true. Plus allow me to be home with my family more, as right now I'm gone 10-13 hours a day Monday thru Friday and 6-7 Hours Saturday. Giving us very little time  together as a family, nor giving us the chance to allow our children to participate in church or school activities :

  • Our vending cart business will give us the chance to bring the nostalgia of Hotdog carts to the upstate. Its very rare to see one of these type business here.

Risks & Challenges

With any business venture there is always a chance of failure. Shear determination will see us through. The vending cart business is a very small market in the upstate. So building trust with the people of the upstate is key.

  • One of the best ways for us to build that trust is to run a very professional, clean, friendly business where people will want to come back time and again. Not only for the good food, but also the love and care we plan on putting into our food and business.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

               If you are unable to help at this time, we understand. We do ask that you share with everyone you know about us and our goal. Your help in spreading the word about us and our business is key for us in raising the funds needed to succeed!


Thank you so much for taking the time to consider us and our situation.

story:
New Diego Fuzz Demo


Stephen Douglas Design
 Where business IS personal 

The goal of Stephen Douglas Design is and always will be to provide great tone without compromising quality.

    • 2011: Stephen began building high end overdrive and fuzz pedals.
    • 2012: "Stephen Douglas Design" was created so we could bring out our own unique line of pedals.
    • August 2014: The official launch happened for the business and website of Stephen Douglas Design.
    • 2015 and beyond... It's time for the next step:  to generate more brand awareness through demos, reviews and advertisements, refinement of processes for greater efficiency, increased quality control and continued dreams for what Stephen Douglas Design can grow toward.
Currently, Stephen Douglas Design stands at the threshold of growth. With hard work, commitment to service and quality products, Stephen Douglas Design is gaining momentum and ready to get to the next level. 

The main goal of Stephen Douglas Design: to create great tone without compromising quality. We always want customers to expect service above and beyond the "norm" every time, with every pedal. All pedals carry a lifetime warranty, whether you’re the original owner or not. We firmly believe that standing behind our products and meeting customer needs creates long-term relationships which will ultimately grow our business. Our promise is to never forget how valuable customers are and to continually meet needs in any reasonable way possible. 

Any contributions during this campaign will show support for the dreams of Stephen Douglas Design and the future endeavors with this business. There is a well-laid business plan that has been followed to the current point the business is in and now a new plan is written to maintain and push Stephen Douglas Design forward in the coming years. 

As celebrities and everyday players, in addition to dealers and distributors, get their hands on the pedals, Stephen Douglas Design wants to maintain the momentum and continuously build inventory efficiently, as well as promote and professionally present the company.

To continue our success, financial goals are set along a timeline and at various levels. Our current Campaign Goal of $10,000 will get this big picture plan underway as we best see fit. Any gift will help Stephen Douglas Design get closer to the next step. We hope you enjoy the 'perk' options we are offering in response to your support, There is also the option to donate any amount without receiving the 'perks' and that will be much appreciated as well. 

What Will Help Us Grow 

Funding will allow for so many things to get to the next step in this journey!! Your contributions will: 

  • allow for the development of demo videos which are a huge promotional tool in this industry, 
  • assist in getting pedals in the right hands for magazine and other reviews.
  • enable us to purchase new tools and materials to better streamline processes and further improve already outstanding quality.
  • create freedom to revise current designs, develop new products and improve features of thoughts ready to come to life.
  • provide funds for promotional materials (such as manuals and packaging) to be amped up, allowing for greater professionalism and efficiency.
  • support building inventory to continuously have stock available.
  • help us attend guitar/trade shows.
  • further connect us with artists to promote the products further.

The Perks 

The 'perks' are unique and new items that will be first released ONLY through this campaign.  Stickers, guitar picks, t-shirts, Facebook shout-outs, a newly released pedal and a limited-edition pedal are our way of saying THANK YOU for your great support.

Dreams & Challenges

The "Big Picture" plan for Stephen Douglas Design has steps laid out over the course of many years. We hope many of the 12 month goals can be met sooner, followed by 12-24 month goals and ultimate-dreams above and beyond. We know there will be unexpected hurdles, expenses and circumstances. Forging positive mentoring relationships with other experienced business owners, as well as networking with others in and out of the industry will be important aspects in solving challenges and overcoming obstacles.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and make some noise on social media and other avenues to help spread info about the campaign.
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Pray for the days ahead and discernment about Stephen Douglas Design.

And that's it!

Stephen Douglas Design Where business IS personal

story:
**UPDATE: Everyone that contributes $50 or more will also receive a free crowler once the machine is installed in the tasting room (Must be 21+. Available for pick up at the brewery only).**


Our Story

The concept of Mast Landing Brewing Company started three years ago with the purchase of a simple stove top homebrew kit.  What we thought would be a fun "gag" gift ended up completely changing the course of all our lives.  It wasn't long before we found ourselves in the garage mashing, boiling, and fermenting beer after work and every single weekend.  From that point on, we dedicated all of our time to brewing beer and experimenting with different hop varieties and specialty malts. The pace never slowed and we continued to adjust our recipes to make our beers even better. Mast Landing Brewing Company was formed in the Summer of 2015 out of a strong dedication to, and love of the craft of brewing beer.  We have found a home in Westbrook, ME that we are extremely excited to grow into and we have felt a tremendous amount of support from the local residents and business owners.  We could not imagine embarking on this endeavor anywhere else.  Our Tasting Room is almost ready to welcome it's first customers to come in and enjoy a draught or two!    

The Details

While we have spent a great deal of effort building out our brewery and tasting room for people to come in and enjoy our beer, we don't have a reliable method of sharing our beer with people outside of our facility.  A tremendous amount of time and effort is spent crafting each one of our beers so that the consumer has a very specific and unique experience.  We originally thought about providing growlers in our tasting room for off-site consumption.  The problem with growlers is that they have too many variables that could potentially negatively impact our beers.  We eventually came across a machine called a Crowler Seamer that provided a reliable solution to our problem.  A Crowler is a 32 ounce can that is packaged right infront of the customer for off-site consumption.  It has all the benefits of a traditional growler, and even a few advantages, without any of the potential negatives.   

What we need:

  • A Crowler Seamer made by Dixie Canning Company
  • A pallet of empty cans to fill with our delicious beer
  • The design and purchase of Crowler Labels for our various beers 

The Impact

Enjoying great beer is something that is not just for the tap room.  Help us provide a method to enjoy our beers in your favorite places.  Everyone has their own perfect beer moment.  Whether its that first sip after a long day working in the yard, or whether it's enjoying a cold one next to the grill with friends, help us provide you with your moment!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't commit to a donation?  Already donated and want to do more??  No sweat, there's always another way to help.

Spread the word! This campaign is only 45 days long so we need to get as much attention as possible.  Put a link on Facebook, send your friends an email, mention it to a co-worker, call the news!  Anything and everything will help.

Send us a message or 'Like' us on Facebook.  Getting feedback from our future customers is great motivation.

Thank you for your support!  We truly could not do this without you.

Cheers!

-Ian, Neil, & Mike

story:
- Determination determines your destination and every accomplishment starts with the decision to try. 

We are Connie De Martino & Tina Merry

On the 8th/9th August 2015 we aim to climb: 
*Ben Nevis in Scotland,
*Scafell Pike in England, 
*Snowdon in Wales. 

Will it be easy? Nope, will it be worth it? Absolutely!

We are raising money for an inspiring young man called Jack- Jack has Quadriplegic Cerebral palsy and with the amazing support of his family and friends, Jack's determination and enthusiasm to be as independent as he can is extraordinary.
Jack is in need of a new wheelchair as he is outgrowing his current one and we really would like to help raise money which will go to Jack's Appeal to help towards getting Jack's New Chair. To find out more about Jack's story, click on the link below:
http://jacksappeal.org.uk/

story:
You're Invited to Help Give Provisions a Home

Hi, I'm Amie.

I am a Culinary Institute of America trained chef that was raised in Napa Valley, CA.  I have been in the food industry for over 20 years and I have a private chef and catering company called Provisions.

Provisions has been offering simple, delicious catered food to the Ridgway & Telluride areas for the past 8 years, but it's clear that the time has come for Provisions to have a home.

It will be a place where locals and visitors alike can provision themselves with food and drink for life's adventures. We've found a beautiful 19th century store-front in the heart of Ridgway to house this business.  It's a gem, as is my landlord, Antionio Marra who has put his heart and soul into restoring this historic building.


Here's a sampling of what you can expect at Provisions:

  • European-style cafe serving breakfast, lunch and small plate style dinners
  • Eat in or take out
  • A revolving selection of wines on tap (As a Napa Valley native, I have stayed in touch with what's worth trying year to year, and I'm excited to share these finds with you!) 
  • Specialty cocktails and beer
  • Charcuterie and cheese case
  • Baked goods from our kitchen
  • Revolving menus featuring the finest ingredients, emphasizing on purity, simplicity and seasonal flavors
  • Sandwiches, salads, and other wonders for your picnic basket

Here's What Your Contribution to Provisions

Will Create:

We're building out the old Barber Shop space from scratch! This is wonderful, because Provisions will have a customized community gathering space. It's also daunting, because a commercial kitchen is a big investment.

A Break-Down of Provisions' $50,000 Campaign

1. Build-Out the Barber Shop: $15,000

This includes plumbing, electrical, lighting, kitchen flooring, shelving, counter seating, prep counter, tables, chairs, etc. 

2. Large and Small Commercial Kitchen Appliances & Equipment: $30,000 (did you know that an entry level espresso machine costs over $10,000?  yep, no kidding)

This includes everything from the sinks and drains that the state requires, to our commercial range, refrigerator, and all the other appliances that go into the space.

3. Retail Components: $5,000

This  includes getting the shop stocked up with food!  The delicious espresso, charcuterie, cured meats, cheeses, gelatos, breads, pastries, breakfast, lunch, tapas fixings, wines, beers, prosecco, bourbon, plus so much more!

In addition to filling your picnic basket you can sit down in a comfy chair and have the best espresso this side of Italy, a charcuterie and cheese board paired with a glass of Prosecco or a brown butter sea salt chocolate chip cookie with a good ole beer.  

Seasonally you can enjoy our garden seating amongst our bountiful raised bed gardens.

The Impact

All contributions, no matter how big or small, will support this project. In fact, the work has already begun- you'll see the immediate impact of your support in pipes and wires, flooring and walls, and so much more.

 
You can pitch money toward the whole project, or contact me and let me know if you want your support to go toward something specific.

Whether or not we get all the way to our $50,000 goal (though I strongly believe we will!) your support will contribute to a solid business that will enliven the Ridgway community. And if we go over our goal, all funds will contribute to the development of Provisions as a cafe and a community gathering space and will also help cover the cost of running this campaign fund, which is not cheap.

I am fully committed to Provisions, and I hope that you will join me.

Ways You Can Help

Even if funding is not an option for you today, you can share this campaign with your friends, using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you for taking time to learn about Provisions. I can't wait to welcome you to my space.

Cheers,
Amie Minnick

story:
Washington Gorge Action Programs has been a part of helping families in the Gorge since 1966. Our programs, especially our Food Bank, have proven to be vitally important to residents of Klickitat and Skamania counties. We are currently in the midst of relocating many of our program offices scattered throughout the region and combining them under one roof in order to streamline management and save significant budgetary resources. 

Our Food Bank has been using an old tractor-trailer as a food freezer at our current location. Needless to say, while this system has worked for a number of years, it has been far from ideal. The stairs to get to the trailer are rickety and a safety hazard during the winter months, the forklift cannot get into it (meaning that everything has to be hand loaded and unloaded - a significant waste of manpower), and the freezer unit is poorly insulated and wastes tons of electricity compared to a walk-in freezer.

When we move, we won't be able to bring the tractor-trailer with us. This is both a blessing and a curse.  A blessing because we've been in dire need of an update, and a curse because the cost of a new (to us) freezer is much more than we imagined. 

This is where you come in.  Any donation: big, small, or somewhere in the middle, will be a great help to us as an agency as we continue to do the work that we've been doing since opening our doors. 

Your financial support will help us provide food security to families throughout Klickitiat and Skamania counties. Some families need help just once, while others require ongoing services to meet their food needs.  We provide special boxes for seniors who are often on a fixed income, and for children, who might need extra help during the summer when school lunches aren't an option. 

You can make an impact right here in your community and help address the needs of your friends and neighbors by donating to our campaign. 

Thank you for taking the time to watch our video, and thank you for your donation. 

You can make a donation through Indiegogo by clicking on the button to the right on your screen, you can mail a donation directly to WGAP, PO BOX 805, Bingen, Washington, 98605, or you can go to our website, www.wgap.ws, and donate through Paypal. Thank you for your support.

story:
There are roughly 6500 languages out there, but you only need 48 languages to reach 99% of the economic online GDP.


Our Vision - Building a Better way to Deliver Multilingual Content

Alphatrad Worldwide is creating a global collaborative platform, using the latest computer-assisted translation technology, to change the way multilingual content is created and delivered. With our innovative approach, we are set to empower both companies and individuals alike to share their global message with the widest audience ever!

Through our collaborative platform, they will have access to an extensive network of subject matter experts, which enables them to provide accurate, high quality multilingual content or transcreation services! 

Join us on our journey and take advantage of our one-time deals as we scale our business!

Who we are

Alphatrad Worldwide is a public limited company servicing small to mid-sized businesses and international organizations since 2003. 

We have been providing first-class translation services and solutions to both small and mid-sized companies all around the world for over ten years, and are recognized as an innovation leader in our field. 

Our key differentiator is our network of subject-matter experts. For every translation, we will hand-pick a translator who is a specialist in your subject, and who is a native to the region you are targeting!

Why we are here

We have taken on the challenge to expand our business even further, and want to empower even more companies and individuals. 

It is absolutely vital for any company to provide localized content and copywriting to be taken seriously online.  Having these services in-house usually isn’t an option as it is either too expensive, or there just aren’t any qualified translators available with the right subject matter expertise. 

We recognized this challenge, and have taken it upon ourselves to resolve this. With the funds raised, we will expand our network even further and empower an ever growing number of clients.

How we will use the funds

With the raised contributions, we will be able to scale our team, speed up and more accurately pick the best translator for each, specialist multilingual assignment asked to us. We have the network in place, we just need the right project managers to ensure we can keep up our quality to the highest possible level so as to provide the best multilingual content, without delay!

Your contributions will give us the space, the headcount and the customers to make our dream come true.



Risks and Challenges

At Alphatrad we have over ten years of experience, and we already have our network of translators ready to go. 

We already have the team ready to deliver your perks. We only need the project managers to assign them to the best available translators. 

Other ways to support us

Contribution can come in many forms, if you cannot join the campaign this time, that does not mean you cannot participate in the campaign. Please work with us to get the word out! Post our Indiegogo link on your Facebook and Twitter, share via e-mail and use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank You!

story:
Hi, I'm known as @whitekatana (www.instagram.com/whitekatana) on Instagram. Btw, I'm not the dog, but the human who's sometimes in the photos too.

I've been using Instagram for about 13 months now and observed something. It has to do with "shoutouts", which is Instagram-speak for "ads".

I noticed advertisers only choose users with lots of followers, a.k.a influencers, to work with. It seems logical, on the surface, that these popular users get advertising offers. But, in reality, less will get you much more. 

Here's what I mean: I discovered that the more followers an influencer has, the less engaged their followers are, i.e. a lower percentage leave "comments" and "likes". 

Since any user can comment many times, but only like a post once, I focused on "likes" as the better metric, and researched the engagement level (likes per post/number of followers) of 1,000 random accounts.

What I found was fascinating. 

A user with 1,000 followers or less  – that's 9 out of 10 Instagram users – routinely gets 10% engagement for each post. While an influencer with 100,000 followers or more usually gets 3%, or 3.3X less likes than the former. And that percentage drops further the more followers they have.

Here are five influencers, with an average engagement of 2.5%. Notice how the more followers, generally the less engagement?

Even top celebrities aren't spared the problem, and they've an even lower average engagement of just 2.2%.

Randomly, here are five users I follow, each with 1,000+ followers. Their average engagement is 10.6%. That's more than 4X the influencers' engagement and nearly 5X that of celebrities!

Why do users with fewer followers, like you and I, actually get higher engagement for posts? 

The reason is simple. 

Our accounts are mainly made up of our actual social circle, i.e. our family, friends, co-workers and schoolmates. While accounts with lots of followers tend to be made up of more other people like total strangers and virtual friends. "Like" it or not, people just don't engage as much with those they don't know as well.



Our social circle pays more attention to what we say, values our opinion more, and believes us more than other people ever will. Meaning we're probably the ones with more influence!

Consider this: An advertiser who hires 1 influencer with 100,000 followers engages just 1 social circle. However, that same advertiser who works with 100 of us (each with 1,000 followers) will reach the same total of 100,000 followers, yet engage 100 different social circles! That's a lot more people who're paying attention!


So despite both shoutouts reaching the same number of people, which shoutout would you say has a better chance of hitting the all-important *Tipping Point? 

  • The shoutout that is spread by 1 or 100 different users?
  • The shoutout that influences 1 or 100 social circles?
  • The shoutout that engages 2.2%, 2.5%, or 10.6% of all followers?

*Tipping point, also known as "the moment of critical mass", or the point at which growth becomes easier, stronger and faster


With access to academic studies and social research just a Google away today, advertisers must know what the numbers say? My guess is they do, but find it impossible to coordinate with that many of us at the same time given their limited resources. Up till now, it's just been much easier to work with one influencer instead of 100 or 1,000 users – so that's what they do.


THE MISSION

And that led to the mission I chose to accept – To create an app for advertisers to hire hundreds or thousands of us at the same time so they get better engagement for their money, while all of us can also be 'influencers' and make money from it!



Users only need to sign in with their existing Instagram account and they're ready to be influencers.

Advertisers choose their target users (age, gender, country, etc), post shoutouts the same way anyone would post a photo on Instagram, and these shoutouts are then automatically offered to the target users to accept.

After the accepted shoutout is posted and gets the required *minimum likes, users make money! It's really that easy.

*Minimum likes are customized for each influencer using a proprietary algorithm that calculates against various 'live' and fixed factors. As an example, a user with 1,300 followers may need about 85 likes per shoutout (this will differ from user to user) to make an estimated $150 a month.


THE PLAN

A FREE Android app will be launched on Google Play in the next few days, with the iOS version to come next. Even though I've spent quite a bit of money and a lot of time on the concept and creation, I chose to keep the app completely FREE to make it available to everyone. Now I could use some help to keep it going... (I could also use a good shower, a better meal and a great night's sleep too!) 

So if you like what my app offers, for both users and advertisers, please support my Indiegogo campaign, even with just a small contribution, because every little bit helps – but bigger bits help more of course! 

Funds raised will go towards launching the full version, then to completing the next crucial updates on both platforms. Further and important improvements need to be made as well, and I'm exploring a Windows app too, as together that will cover 99% of the mobile market (79.4% Android, 16.4% iOS and 3.2% Windows).

Also, I've a long list of user-centric functions I've always wished Instagram offered – follow #hashtags (instead of just users), view #trends (by country), and simple corrections, such as being able to copy-and-paste text, click on URL links, etc. With more funds, I'll add these and more – and still keep the app FREE!

It would be helpful for advertisers to have a simple-yet-comprehensive analytics page too, so they can understand why some shoutouts do better than others, and that's on the drawing board as well.

Right now, in FULL alphabetical order, I am ALL of the following:

• Architect • Barista (coffee for sleepless nights) • Creator (please see Architect) • Designer (please see Creator) • Editor • Founder • General Laborer • HR Manager (managing…myself) • Intern (I do do A-Z you know) • Japanese (really) • Korean (no, really) • Lawyer (someone needs to craft the Terms!) • Marketer • Networker (please see Marketer) • Operations Manager • Photographer (we all are on Instagram!) • Quality Controller • Researcher • System Administrator • There's-no-I-in-TEAM-but-there's-M-and-E (actually, there's no TEAM. Period.) • Unpaid Worker • Videographer (youtube.com/watch?v=eVrP8OLabUU) • Writer • Xtensive Tester (only other thing I can come up with is "Xylophone Player") • Yikes... (I know you're thinking of "Yoga Instructor" but I'm just not that flexible), and • Zookeeper (I've quite a few animals at home)

So, it would be nice to start hiring some help too #prayhard.

Funds will mainly be used for cloud hosting, as despite its name (cloud), the cost isn't fluffy at all. Simultaneously hosting millions of users, accessing-accepting shoutouts at virtually the same time, verifying that advertisers' shoutouts aren't altered at all, ensuring influencers are paid automatically and on-time via Paypal, and storing cloud-loads of data, are estimated to cost tens of thousands of dollars a year! #cloudyeyes.

I'll also need to spend on marketing, as the more advertisers know about the power of everyday users, the more users earn! In the meantime, I'll gather all useful feedback to launch the next version on other platforms, starting with Twitter, and users will have more avenues to earn more money!

So… if you believe in the power of everyday users, and if you'd like to earn money by simply accepting shoutouts, please support my Indiegogo campaign and help spread the word to everyone you know! Every bit of help, well, helps!

Thank you so much for helping!

LOUDHOLLER could change the world by granting power to everyone to make money easily from our Instagram accounts! Also, I've a marketing plan to make it the fastest downloaded app, ever. So, if you wish to work with me, whoever you are, wherever you are, in whatever role, please email shout@loudholler.com whenever you can. 
Whyever (everkill, I mean overkill already right)? I could so use the help, and will be forever (can't resist that last one) grateful. However, #heh, you'd need to be darn good for the role you're offering to fill k, because I'll just never compromise on user experience...
Together let's make history :)
story_txt:
Hi, I'm known as @whitekatana (www.instagram.com/whitekatana) on Instagram. Btw, I'm not the dog, but the human who's sometimes in the photos too.





I've been using Instagram for about 13 months now and observed something. It has to do with "shoutouts", which is Instagram-speak for "ads".
I noticed advertisers only choose users with lots of followers, a.k.a influencers, to work with. It seems logical, on the surface, that these popular users get advertising offers. But, in reality, less will get you much more. 
Here's what I mean: I discovered that the more followers an influencer has, the less engaged their followers are, i.e. a lower percentage leave "comments" and "likes". 



Since any user can comment many times, but only like a post once, I focused on "likes" as the better metric, and researched the engagement level (likes per post/number of followers) of 1,000 random accounts.
What I found was fascinating. 
A user with 1,000 followers or less  – that's 9 out of 10 Instagram users – routinely gets 10% engagement for each post. While an influencer with 100,000 followers or more usually gets 3%, or 3.3X less likes than the former. And that percentage drops further the more followers they have.
Here are five influencers, with an average engagement of 2.5%. Notice how the more followers, generally the less engagement?





Even top celebrities aren't spared the problem, and they've an even lower average engagement of just 2.2%.


Randomly, here are five users I follow, each with 1,000+ followers. Their average engagement is 10.6%. That's more than 4X the influencers' engagement and nearly 5X that of celebrities!





Why do users with fewer followers, like you and I, actually get higher engagement for posts? The reason is simple. Our accounts are mainly made up of our actual social circle, i.e. our family, friends, co-workers and schoolmates. While accounts with lots of followers tend to be made up of more other people like total strangers and virtual friends. As an example, a user with 1,300 followers may need about 85 likes per shoutout (this will differ from user to user) to make an estimated $150 a month.

story:
Yodel | Modern Arcade


Our mission begins in Lafayette, LA with the first Arcade opening inside the city limits.  Our mission certainly does not end there however; We hope to extend our reach outside of Louisiana in only two months with our charitable events, and opening our second and third Arcade just four years after our first launch.  

The classic arcade has long been replaced by personal computers, hand held gaming systems and consoles.  "Yodel - Modern Arcade" will hold a place for your personal and social needs in an entertainment environment while you make the world a better place with gaming.

Yodel, the home of the gamer.  As the gaming community grows we find ourselves feeling little at peace when we decide for a night on the town.  Very often we find ourselves isolated even when visiting a restaurant, bar or social gathering.  I ask though, where is a place for me?  

Our views differ from popular opinion on how a business should be run and even how a business is defined.  We believe that our customers are not the only ones that should benefit from our business.  Being a non-profit we differ in the way that we are not doing this for us, we are doing it for YOU.  Our business model is not the standard one of packing pockets, instead we choose to give back to the community where it currently lacks.


Yodel | The Cause



Show the world that healing can be fun and charity is what you make it!

Every person has the potential to better the world and Yodel offers that opportunity every time by providing 100% of net income to our child trauma and abuse awareness charity.

The world changes every single day, and in such dramatic ways.  Too often in this change individuals are forgotten, causes are dropped, and people stop caring.  The human condition is nothing to be embarrassed about, but the power of choice is nothing to be underplayed.  Our choice to help others is given up time and time again since we are overwhelmed by the amount of people that could use a helping hand.   We here at Yodel intend to provide a lasting solution.  

Progressing as a business and contributor, we hope to show that our model is a sound one that makes the world a better place to live in.  Not only are we dedicated to helping our fellow man but we hope to show that charitable work, or even extending a helping hand, does not have to consume your life. 


Yodel | Updates & Schedules


New update! ( Oct. 4 )

YodelGamer.com | Come check us out!

Make sure to give our site @ yodelgamer.com  a look or two and let us know what you think.  As we work on the site we hope to get insight from all of you so that we can make the best user experience possible.  Shoot us an email and be heard!


Local Schedule - Yodel | Modern Arcade will consist of a 6-day local schedule of events, regular occurrences and a basic go-to guide on your first few days inside the Modern Arcades.   Location hours to become Monday-Saturday (detailed: Monday-Friday 10AM-11PM & Saturday 10AM-1AM.)  Monday, Wednesday, and Friday will be known as "Tournament Style," and will consist of same-day signups for Tournaments between gamers with grand prizes on win.   Tuesday will feature "techless" game night including popular card and board games to be enjoyed or competed over in a friendly environment.  Thursday will be our day for weekly charitable (local) events exampled by making our streets and parks beautiful or donating our time another local charity to name a couple.  Saturday is our "anything goes" day where the barriers are broken down and we unite for games in a loose schedule and play as a group.  Like any schedule, this one is limiting in the way that not every day is alike and not every day can be experienced.  We provide a solution to this problem by creating a schedule, BUT shh... not really following it.   So your not a fan of COD: Ghosts and you arrived to the Modern Arcade with your MTG cards ready to whoop some Eldrazi butt on a Friday, No Problem!  Though we have a schedule and the games on our schedule, the Arcade is setup for each type of day everyday so you don't have to choose between Pokemon or Fallout!

Yodel | Financial Goals & Projection

Being a non-profit company, Yodel can grow and expand while giving back to the community.  Instead of handing your hard earned living over to greedy individuals, we can see to it that your dollar touches as many hearts as possible.

This section will detail startup costs including events, inventory and location costs.

Inventory will consist of three categories including: Electronics ($12,000), Furniture ($8000), and Merchandise ($6000) totaling to Inventory Costs ($26,000).

Events will be given an initial budget of ($12,000) which includes costs of temporary location, inventory and transportation.

Location costs will not be fully determined at this moment, instead given a goal of ($9000) and will be updated no later than 10 days after launch. 

Being the first of our kind we hope to show the image of transparency with our charitable promise.  This will be done by continuing our updates to you through our network.  Our network will continue to update our members, contributors, and fellow gamers monthly with our past and future contributions, events and schedules.


Yodel | Teaming Up

The Yodel team goes far beyond its founders, so far in fact, that we stopped counting.  This is because Yodel can not say that we did it on our own.  Every step of the way we have had the generous support of individuals willing to help a good cause from designers to financial gurus.  Hoping for the continued support of kind individuals we continue our cause of doing what needs to be done for the world to heal.  
How can I help though?  Becoming a part of the Yodel team is as easy as wanting to further the cause of helping your fellow man.  Not everyone is in the position to contribute a dollar, and you do not have to be to help.  Sharing the word is just as influential and can help others find the cause they are looking for.

story:
Help us create a unique all-inclusive adventure tour Company at our deluxe Caribbean villa. Accommodations, Kayaking, Stand-up Paddle Boarding, Electric Mountain Biking, and Off-Road Motorcycling included!



Campaign Intro & Overview

The Island of Montserrat has been referred to as "the way the Caribbean used to be". It is also widely-referred to as "the Emerald Isle of the Caribbean". A place so cool that famed producer of The Beatles, Sir George Martin, built a state-of-the-art recording complex there in 1976 where the likes of Sir Paul McCartney, The Police, and Sir Elton John recorded multi-platinum albums.

Fast-forward to present-day, post-volcano Montserrat. ...Imagine a place so quiet that you can actually hear yourself breathe. With virtually no large hotels or resorts, Montserrat is off the beaten path and you will feel like a sixteenth century explorer discovering a new land. Witness first-hand the utter devastation of the Volcano on Montserrat's capital of Plymouth, now a modern-day Pompeii. 

The Island is an enchanting place, its charm endearing. The people of Montserrat are genuinely warm; it's the kind of place where people wave at each other on the roads and are never in too much of a hurry to get anywhere. A British-Crown Colony, the Island is a safe travel destination and a haven for retirees from North America & the U.K. Montserrat boasts sublime spring water from the tap, a balmy year-round climate, and stunning natural beauty.

Carrll & Gary Robilotta are brothers who moved to the Caribbean Island of Montserrat in 1980 where they pioneered the sport of surfing. After going through two natural disasters on the Island (Hurricane Hugo in 1989 and then the eruption of the Soufriere Hills Volcano in 1995), the brothers are now in the process of restoring/transforming their long-time family home into an adventure tour destination/accommodation company.

The Montserrat Island Adventure Villa will be a one-of-a-kind accommodation in Montserrat. With your help, we will create a fully-outfitted villa which will provide crowd-weary adventurers with a great opportunity to explore this beautiful island, meet and interact with its wonderful people, and unplug from the frantic pace of life most of the world lives in. As a contributor, you will enjoy some great discounts when you book your one, two, or three week adventures with us!

Catering to single families, couples, and small groups, our all-inclusive offering will include deluxe villa accommodations, guided kayak, stand-up paddleboarding, electric mountain bike excursions, and off-road motorcycling. Avid watermen and outdoorsmen, the Brothers Robilotta will be your hosts & guides during your time on magical Montserrat. Best of all, pricing for our all-inclusive adventure packages will be affordable--costing less what most hotels charge for accommodations alone.

Carrll & Gary will be alternating as host & guides for their Montserrat Adventure Tours, meeting their guests on the Island and personally overseeing every aspect of each week-long adventure, ensuring an unforgettable experience!


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal with this IndieGoGo campaign is to raise $80,000.00 which is the amount we project which will be needed to completely refurbish, refurnish, and outfit our villa. The funds will go towards re-roofing & re-flooring, installing new cabinets, counter tops, and vanities. The house will also be refurnished; nothing extravagant, but just so that it is comfortable. In order to transform it into the type of adventure destination we envision.

We're offering some pretty cool perks for our contributors. It should be noted that while we have a 'delivery date' of October 2017 for our perks, the CD and art will be shipped out to contributors right away. The discount vouchers we are offering for our Montserrat Adventures will be delivered and valid once we achieve our funding goal and the house is refurbished. Alternatively, discount vouchers can also be used for our Adventure packages as outlined on our website: www.MontserratIslandAdventures.com. [Through a special arrangement with a select group of Montserrat villa owners, we are able to launch our Montserrat Adventure tours while we raise the necessary funding to refurbish our home. Our Adventure tours are launching in July of 2017].


The Impact

All funds received through this campaign will go towards refurbishing our house and attaining our goal of giving it a new chapter: The Montserrat Island Adventure Villa! ...Much like the proverbial phoenix rising from the ashes, our vision is to see our former family home transformed into a unique adventure destination villa! [All contribution funds will be deposited into an account specifically-designated to refurbish/transform the Montserrat house].

Our campaign is important to us because it is the only house we own as a family and it was dad's dying wish that we never part with it. ...We have a wealth of sentimental value invested in Montserrat and the house is in dire need of refurbishing. Achieving our goal would enable us to share the allure of Montserrat like never before, with like-minded adventure travelers.

The magnitude of your contribution, large or small, is something we are sincerely grateful for! Please be sure to read about the great perks we are offering contributors!

We'd like to sincerely thank you for taking the time to read about our campaign. Even if you're not in a position to contribute at this time, please share our campaign with friends or acquaintances of yours who may be interested in exploring a wonderful Island known for its friendly people, warm smiles, and unique character.

Please feel free to email us with your questions or comments at the email address below.


Thanks again!

Carrll & Gary Robilotta

knpmaui@yahoo.com
