Use SPOT STUFF to remove that salad dressing, gravy, pizza grease or other oil, grease or fat based stain from your clothing, car, boat, furniture or carpet to name a few!  SPOT STUFF can help to remove it in minutes without washing!!! There are some great benefits to being a SPOT STUFF supporter....... So get in on the deals.......check out our PERKS and help us get started!       The Impact


SPOT STUFF’s
innovative patent pending technology was developed and tested in the United
States, and unlike traditional washing or other instant removers SPOT STUFF.....



Consumes no energy to clean
Removes even old, washed & dried oil or grease stains 
Doesn’t leave a big wet ring like the other sticks and wipes on the market
Is environmentally friendly 
Non-toxic
Easy on your wallet                  
               =    


Use SPOT STUFF to take it out instead of throwing it out....... Keep from contributing to the 13 million tons of textiles that end up in landfills annually!___________________________________________________________________
ONLY for our SPOT STUFF Supporters....


SPOT STUFF
will only be available first to our supporters on Indiegogo!  Supporters of Our Indiegogo campaign who contribute to
fund the infrastructure necessary to bring SPOT STUFF
to the market will receive the first shipments of SPOT STUFF
prior to release to the general public through any other retail or web outlets






  SPOT STUFF Challenges!
We have spent years on research and testing of SPOT STUFF and we are so close to getting this amazing product out to everyone's home office, car, boat, backpack, purse and suitcase......WE JUST NEED YOUR HELP!!!  
So please take a peek at our PERKS.....find one that's a perfect match for you and contribute! Then please take the time to help us by letting all your friends know about our Indiegogo campaign and SPOT STUFF! visit 

Other Ways You Can Help We understand not everyone can help SPOT STUFF get started with a $$ contribution...........But you can still help us in a big way!!!!  Please TELL ALL YOUR FRIENDS ABOUT OUR CAMPAIGN!!It's easy just use the Indiegogo share tools to quickly tell them.......  and maybe they will return the favor by including you in the SPOT STUFF Family and Friends Perk so you can try it after all!  Thank you so much for taking the time to help us get going!!
The SPOT STUFF Team
The
innovative SPOT STUFF Team is comprised of professionals experienced in
Technology, Chemistry, Branding, Design, Manufacturing, Marketing and Sales and we’re so
excited to bring our first product to the market!  
                  Contact us at:  www.SpotStuff.com

story:
Kurzbeschreibung

This is a socially conscious brand, made for all dreamers, free spirits, bohemian hearts and gypsy souls. It directly connects you to impact the community positively.

I've always been kind of a hippie at heart. I love being barefoot in dresses, wearing frayed jeans with holes, fringe bags and friendship bracelets and having long wavy hair. I adore incense, burning oils, dreamcatchers, a lot of plants in my room, lying in hammocks, going on road trips and festivals and I've always been wondering about people who worry too much about their lives. I love the way of thinking that you can achieve anything you want in your life, if you just want it enough and if you already feel how you will feel, when you've achieved it...

Sometimes you need a little help by others and that's why I am here.
As a fashion, jewelry and decoration enthusiast I've always had the dream to own a store and thus offer beautiful things to other people. Over the last year, I've had a hard pathway as a self-taught entrepreneur, jewelry manufacturer and on finding the right suppliers for my project. I've had to teach myself every inch of this business, get my hands dirty, work tiressly without days off, study, apply, fail and succeed! I am now equipped to handle any risk or challenge, because problem solving has become a facility for me.

As you could read in the short description of this project, you will help creating jobs by supporting this. Of course I will not be able to have 10 employees right from the start, but who knows.. Everybody always tells "Think big!", so maybe someday there will be more 'Boho Child' stores and thus more jobs you've created!

Why will the store have another name than the online store?
For the online store I was searching for a name, which is short and easy to remember. 'Redamo' is latin and means "I love (you) again". I still like this name a lot but for the local store I was searching for a name, which directly lets you know, that the products offered there are all about the boho look.

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst Kurzbeschreibung

If the project gets funded 4-9% go to Indiegogo and additionally 3-5% for the transactions.
Almost half of the amount, which is left then, will be spend on the rewards and for shipment.

The rents for shops in the city I live are very high. I will also have to pay rent deposit (2,26 x monthly rent) plus broker's commission. Then the store needs interior like shelves, security system and mannequins. The money, which is left then, would be spend on purchasing the proudcts, which would be offered in the shop.

I have put together a list of very exciting perks for my contributors. There are numerous discount code options for anyone who might like to do a bit of shopping in the online store. Some perks are also products from the online store, but you will get them way cheaper here. Don't forget, all perks have free shipment, too.

Any funds we raise via this campaign will go towards this store project, so even if we do not reach our goal of 25.000 €, I won't give up on my dream and I will find any other way to open this store.


Die Folgen

The second thing I really want to do is supporting charity organizations.

Why?

I've made some mistakes and bad experiences in my life just like everybody else. I've had bad jobs with weird, selfish bosses, have worked for them on some days for 11 hours while not having a break during this time and I've had financial straits after some decisions, too. But I don't regret any of those decisions and mistakes and I am not sad about those experiences.
You want to know why? Once I've read somewhere a really mind changing thing, I want to share with you:
1. Think of the 5 worst experiences in your life...
2. Then reflect if they've also had any positive impacts, that maybe changed your life completely.
- You will find them!

So I guess, everything that happened in my past, should have happened, so that I now can be here at this point in my life with all of my positive thoughts and energy to start something and to be my own boss. Yes, maybe from now on I will work on many days for 11 hours without a break. But then it's my decision and I will do it with a pleasure to reach my goal to help others, too.

The moment, when I got a positive reinforcement for my plan:

For sure you know those people, mostly seen in city centers, who want to get your aid for known charity organizations. Once a young guy talked to me about one organization and asked me to join it but unfortunately this happened at a point in my life I really couldn't, because I was at the absolutely top of my financial straits. And this was the moment I promised myself to do it as soon as I am able to! So I will donate a part of my future sales for helping other people, who are in those situations and don't have the possibility to get out of it.

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Every project faces potential setbacks. However, due to my longtime experiences in retail, my pathway to a self-taught entrepreneur and my extensive research for the best suppliers, my positive mind and strength of purpose, I feel very confident about my ability to built up an amazing store. I will continue to work directly with my suppliers to ensure quality.

If we manage to easily exceed the goal, it could be a small challenge to make all of the parcels ready and built up a store almost at the same time, but this would also be a great 'problem' to tackle ;) . I promise everyone will get their rewards on time and it would be a pleasure for me to send you some love of 'Boho Child' with it.

I will make sure to stay in contact to you guys during the whole project. If you have any questions, I would be happy to talk to you.
Thank you so much for your support.

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

I totally understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help! If you wish to help me reach my dream, if you want to help to impact the community positively with this project or if you just want to buy those items in a store someday, please consider the following:

  • Tell your friends and family about this campaign.
  • Share this campaign with the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The Whiteaker Block Party is an entirely volunteer run event that partners with local businesses in order to celebrate the unique, artistic character of our neighborhood.  This is our ninth year running, but over the years the costs of putting on this event has grown beyond the scope of what we can manage purely out-of-pocket, even when supplemented by donations from businesses.  In order to keep the Whiteaker Block Party completely community driven, for our community, rather than turning over aspects of it to various businesses we are reaching out to our neighbors to help fund it this year.  

This is your chance to to help keep this neighbor-organized event completely free, run by your neighbors, and to contribute on a material level.  If you love this neighborhood, or have enjoyed the WBP over the previous years, we encourage you to contribute now.  Feel free to send us your suggestions for making this event even better, or just questions to whiteakerblockparty@gmail.com.  Any amount helps immensely, thank you.


Cheers,

The Whiteaker Block Party Steering Committee

story:
Short Summary

Hi. I am Ian Blake and I am a teacher, a scientist and I am passionate about food and what it means to our bodies and our environment. Some might even call me a nerd. Ok, they do call me a nerd. More specifically the “Garden Geek”.

Which is why I am embracing my inner gardening geek and starting a sustainable farm: Eudaimonia Farms. Why Eudaimonia? It is a Greek word translated as happiness or “human flourishing”, and that is exactly what I aim to create. Food that helps humans to flourish.

But this is not just another farm. Oh no, this is a farm of the future. Why? We will be setting up stands at local Farmer’s Markets to offer communities healthier, less expensive greens on a consistent basis. As we grow, so will our outreach and ability to feed the future.

Right now, people are connected to everything, but their food; we have no idea from where that food comes. Let’s change that.

I want people to eat good, affordable, local food. You probably already know (or it makes sense that) local food tastes better…it doesn’t have to travel very far to get on your table, therefore it’s usually fresher. That means your food is healthier and, bonus, it costs less

However, that is just the beginning of why buying locally is better.

There are 3 major reasons why local is better…

·  Economic Health -

    o Keeps money in the community

    o Helps the local economy

    o Increases the "money multiplier effect”

·  Environmental Health -

    o Reducing the supply chain (reduces energy costs)

    o Reducing the carbon footprint on the food that you eat

    o Growing organically will not release pesticides into the environment or drinking           water (nor does it have fertilizer runoff)

·  Personal Health -

    o Healthy food is good

    o Tasty food is better

    o Come on, this is health food that you will actually eat

What We Need & What You Get

·  At the $15,000 mark I can break ground and begin construction for Eudaimonia Farms. More allows for greater autonomy and more time to perfect the systems.

·  Every dollar, even if we don't reach our goal, will go towards building the farm. I've dealt with life's hurtles before and can jump and sprint with the best of them.

Risks & Challenges

·  Land assets are procured, zoning is established, technology is available, expertise has been acquired. All we need now are the funds.

·  I've done the majority of the heavy lifting, your part is easy and you get to feel good about it, too. Not only that – you’ll get some tasty food you helped grow in the process!

Other Ways You Can Help

·  Spread the word! Even if you can’t donate, or you've reserved your greens basket but still want to help – you can help “grow” our cause!

Please share my story on Facebook, Twitter, or with the checkout clerk. Sharing is fun :)

Incentives:

$5: Thanks: Your donation means the world to us. We will send a handwritten thank you note from the Garden Geek himself.

$25 Basket of Greens: First pickin’s from the farm! Receive a basket of fresh greens (a min. value of $40 worth) delivered to your doorstep, with a thank you note from the Garden Geek.  *Continental 48 only

$50 Enhanced Basket of Greens: I think we’re going to need a bigger basket! Double the goodness and receive a basket of fresh greens (a min value of $100) delivered to your doorstep, with a thank you note from the Garden Geek.

$100 3 Baskets of Healthy Farm Fresh Food: Imagine all the kale smoothies you can make! Every other week an overflowing basket of garden greens and seasonal treats (a min value of $50 per haul) will be delivered to your doorstep, with notes and suggested healthy recipes from the Garden Geek.

$250 4 Months of Healthy Farm Fresh Food and access to the Eudaimonia Farms DIY Sustainable Garden e-Book and seed kit. You will not only receive an overflowing basket of garden greens and seasonal treats (a min of $50 per haul) delivered to your doorstep, along with notes and suggested healthy recipes from the Garden Geek and seeds each month to start your own garden at home!

$500 Name a Stand. Maybe you don’t like vegetables, but you like branding! Whether it is your personal name, your family’s name or your company name – for only $500 we will name one of our Farmer’s Market stands after you. Not only that, but you will receive a basket of greens (a min $25 value) every time you visit (*restrictions apply), free of charge. You helped grow them after all!

$800 Name a Fish Tank. Love vegetables? Love fish? Did you know that fish help plants grow? I could geek out all day about how cool this is, but bottom line – we need the fish to keep the greens reaching for the sky. Adopt a tank and you can name the fish. We will even put a little plaque on the tank and send you updates on your little swimmer.

$1,250 Name a Row. Captain of Industry know that you have to be organized. Naming a row secures, in perpetuity, the knowledge that no one will be lost on the farm. Look at that – now you are keeping people healthy AND safe. What a difference a little donation makes. ;)

$2,500 Name the Nursery. Eudaimonia Farms will have a plant nursery, and your name will be on the front and center of it. That kind of makes you like the Plant Father. Mother Earth. Whatever you’d like to be called – we will put the name front and center at the nursery, on-site on signs and throughout all Eudaimonia Farms promotions.

$5,000 Be the Foundation. You can’t build a house without a foundation, and you can’t have a farm without land. Name the plot of land upon which all of this garden-y goodness will take place. Help humans flourish, bring healthier, less expensive food to locals and help Eudaimonia Farms grow. It all begins with you.

story:
Help Hunger Action Los Angeles (HALA) expand Farmers Markets' Market Match Program in LA County

Who We Are and How Market Match Works

Hi I'm Frank Tamborello and I'm one of a team of people in Los Angeles who believe that eating healthy should not just be for the wealthy! Hunger isn't just about having enough food, it’s about having access to enough healthy food.

After looking into programs in other parts of the country that doubled the money of people using CalFresh (what we used to call Food Stamps) at farmers markets, we began raising money for a program that farmers coming to Los Angeles could benefit from while offering more food to those who needed it. 

Many low-income families can't afford the basic fruits and vegetables needed to be healthy, that’s why diabetes and obesity are two of the worst diseases facing our country today. It's not the amount, but the poor quality of food that leads to poor health.


Today our Market Match Program allows low-income families using food stamps to get up to $10 in vouchers extra per week to spend on fresh fruits and vegetables at farmers markets–amounting up to $50 a month! We expanded to other low-income populations as well, especially seniors getting Supplemental Security Income pensions. 

When a customer comes to the market with only $5 dollars in cash or EBT, we can match that amount to $10 dollars using Market Match vouchers. They can then use the vouchers to buy twice as many fruits and vegetables. This creates a higher demand for healthy foods to be sold at farmers markets, keeps low-income families and seniors healthy while helping small farmers sell more produce.

Without the use of pesticides or chemical fertilizers, thousands of small farmers are growing nutritious food and keeping our environment healthy as well. They sell their bounty weekly at farmers markets all over Southern California—120 markets in LA County alone!

But when you say “farmers market” people think of overpriced items that are nutritious but could not fit into the budget of a mom working part-time to raise three kids, a person with disabilities living on a monthly benefit or a senior struggling to pay their rent. 

California should not have this problem. We're growing over half of the nation’s fruits and vegetables! 

Here in Southern California we've grown from one market in LA to a total of 16 with our colleagues doing the program at 5 others in LA, and a total of 230 markets around the state!

The Recession and the Affordable Healthy Food movement: Market Match.

Several years ago a group of concerned residents formed Hunger Action LA to address issues of both hunger and healthy eating. The 2008 recession resulted in Food Stamp use being doubled all over the USA. Los Angeles' large population of struggling working families, the unemployed and seniors trying to make it on small pensions needed access to healthier, more affordable food. We knew there must be a way to help farmers grow more healthy foods low-income families could afford.

Farmers markets in California originally begun (after a campaign to establish them as legal)  in the 1970s, as a way to help small farmers sell goods in low-income areas that needed more organic fruits and vegetables. Unfortunately, over the years they had a reputation of being places where only people who could afford luxurious food items could shop. But kale, collard greens, white radishes, tomatoes, and avocados aren't just for the wealthy! Every person should have access to healthy foods regardless of their income, and Market Match levels the playing field.

But We Still Need Your Help.

This is a critical time. We need to spread Market Match to all corners of Los Angeles county and attract the support needed to make it a permanent and sustainable program.

People are flocking to the markets for healthy food that won't break their budget, but we still don't have enough resources to meet the rising demand at the markets—as a result we're forced to limit the number of vouchers we distribute.

We need to raise more funds to meet the needs of the senior and disabled population. We also have new funding sources, but unfortunately we can't access them until we advance money to the markets. Finally, we want to increase the amount we distribute at existing markets and especially to add markets in Los Angeles. 

$15,000 will Launch Market Match Programs in

  • Compton
  • Downtown L.A. (The lively and hip 5th & Spring location, also home to many seniors and people with disabilities)
  • Eagle Rock
  • Pasadena
  • Santa Fe Springs

By making a donation you'll be helping our small California farmers, many having to cut production due to the drought. Unless they get more income on a regular basis, they won't be able to afford to keep driving to L.A. to sell at the markets. We could see a loss of environmentally sustainable farming and a loss of affordable farmers markets in our urban areas. Help thousands of families, seniors and people with disabilities get a dignified healthy diet that will help the farmers now struggling with the drought who are bringing this great food into Los Angeles.


You can be part of this program and get the recognition you deserve for making L.A. healthy and hunger-free while giving California’s farmers the boost they need!

Come out to a Market Match site and see for yourself! Take a glance at the LA Times article from the Saturday, July 25 print edition. With your help, we can make EVERY farmers market look like Adams/Vermont!

LA Times article: Market Match helps get fresh produce to low-income farmers market shoppers

The Perks of Being a Contributor

We have a lot of great perks for you if you can contribute!

—If you or your group can raise $1,000 we will acknowledge you at the market of your choice with a full-length banner on one particular market day. We want everyone to know that YOU made it happen.

—If you or your group can raise $250 or more you have the option of free rental for any occasion you wish of our custom built Smoothie Bike, pedaled by hundreds of kids (and many a parent too) in nutrition education presentations we've done at the markets

—If you are interested in learning more about the fight against hunger, for a $20 contribution you'll receive Joel Berg's book "All You Can Eat: How Hungry Is America?", which will give you some of the real reasons we have hunger in such a wealthy country. Joel is director of the New York City Coalition Against Hunger and former Clinton administration official who pulls no punches in this excellent book.

—For a $40 contribution you will receive: The intersection between art and hunger, a DVD of author/playwright Dan Froot's innovative tabletop theater piece "Who's Hungry?". Dan translates the true stories of people who have experienced hunger in modern America into miniature dramas using small puppetlike figures. A truly unique art form. Plus a copy of Joel Berg's book "All You Can Eat: How Hungry is America? Described above.

—Oh yes, show people what your support with pride! We have T-shirts, tote bags, water bottles and flash drives. All items sport the Hunger Action Los Angeles Logo–make it memorable! Help us spread the word!

If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will go to one of the four potential sites listed above. 

A contribution with results you can see

This program will inspire people in our market areas because those who have to watch where every penny goes will be getting twice as much for their money at their local farmers market. And remember, every dollar does two things: it helps a low-income family eat better AND helps a farmer bring more of the good stuff.

Hunger Action LA has successfully begun Market Match at 16 farmers markets in LA County since 2010. We've done it methodically and responsibly on a limited basis when finances made that necessary. Making sure that we had capacity and volunteers to make the program run well, dealing with problems as we went along and building a strong coalition among the market operators who run the farmers markets.

We've partnered with numerous organizations and have attracted funding from First 5 LA and from the US Department of Agriculture through the Ecology Center, an organization working to build Market Match across the state. But we cannot and should not rely on large funders alone. We want a sustainable program that belongs to the people of LA County.

This program is built from the ground up by ordinary people pioneering a new and exciting approach to four things:  fighting poverty, improving public health, supporting California’s great asset of small acre farms and in so doing, promoting environmentally sustainable farming methods. That’s why we call Market Match a Four-Way Win-Win-Win-Win!

The Challenge—And The Vision

Raising money for this program isn't easy–a lot is needed for us to meet the demand here in LA., but many people share our dream and it’s not impossible! Michigan has implemented a program just like this statewide. If Michigan can do it why can't California? You can be an important part of making the dream really come true!

Hey, money's tight—we know

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you can't contribute, you can still help! Get the word out and MAKE SOME NOISE about our campaign. Share the LA Times article and spread the email out to your friends & social networks. And let us know if you'd like to volunteer distributing Market Match at one of the participating markets!

Every contribution is appreciated. If you can only give $10 you have helped one person, one struggling mom, or one hungry senior get Market Match for a day. 

Contributions give farmers more hope to keep raising great produce through the devastating drought. Even ten dollars can go a long way at a market like Adams/Vermont or like the new target markets on our list. 

Contributions can make a healthy soup or provide vitamin filled snacks for kids to munch on! Plums instead of corn chips! An avocado instead of a cream filled cake! and that's all there is to it. 

Thank You for visiting our campaign at indiegogo.com
Questions? Please call:213-388-8228
or email:indiegogocampaign@hungeractionla.org
story_txt:
Help Hunger Action Los Angeles (HALA) expand Farmers Markets' Market Match Program in LA County



Who We Are and How Market Match Works
Hi I'm Frank Tamborello and I'm one of a team of people in Los Angeles who believe that eating healthy should not just be for the wealthy! Hunger isn't just about having enough food, it’s about having access to enough healthy food.

After looking into programs in other parts of the country that doubled the money of people using CalFresh (what we used to call Food Stamps) at farmers markets, we began raising money for a program that farmers coming to Los Angeles could benefit from while offering more food to those who needed it. 
Many low-income families can't afford the basic fruits and vegetables needed to be healthy, that’s why diabetes and obesity are two of the worst diseases facing our country today. It's not the amount, but the poor quality of food that leads to poor health.

Today our Market Match Program allows low-income families using food stamps to get up to $10 in vouchers extra per week to spend on fresh fruits and vegetables at farmers markets–amounting up to $50 a month! We expanded to other low-income populations as well, especially seniors getting Supplemental Security Income pensions. 


When a customer comes to the market with only $5 dollars in cash or EBT, we can match that amount to $10 dollars using Market Match vouchers. They can then use the vouchers to buy twice as many fruits and vegetables. This creates a higher demand for healthy foods to be sold at farmers markets, keeps low-income families and seniors healthy while helping small farmers sell more produce.
Without the use of pesticides or chemical fertilizers, thousands of small farmers are growing nutritious food and keeping our environment healthy as well. They sell their bounty weekly at farmers markets all over Southern California—120 markets in LA County alone!

But when you say “farmers market” people think of overpriced items that are nutritious but could not fit into the budget of a mom working part-time to raise three kids, a person with disabilities living on a monthly benefit or a senior struggling to pay their rent. 
California should not have this problem. We're growing over half of the nation’s fruits and vegetables! 
Here in Southern California we've grown from one market in LA to a total of 16 with our colleagues doing the program at 5 others in LA, and a total of 230 markets around the state!
The Recession and the Affordable Healthy Food movement: Market Match.

Several years ago a group of concerned residents formed Hunger Action LA to address issues of both hunger and healthy eating. The 2008 recession resulted in Food Stamp use being doubled all over the USA. Los Angeles' large population of struggling working families, the unemployed and seniors trying to make it on small pensions needed access to healthier, more affordable food. We knew there must be a way to help farmers grow more healthy foods low-income families could afford.

Unfortunately, over the years they had a reputation of being places where only people who could afford luxurious food items could shop. But kale, collard greens, white radishes, tomatoes, and avocados aren't just for the wealthy! Every person should have access to healthy foods regardless of their income, and Market Match levels the playing field.
But We Still Need Your Help.
This is a critical time. We need to spread Market Match to all corners of Los Angeles county and attract the support needed to make it a permanent and sustainable program.
People are flocking to the markets for healthy food that won't break their budget, but we still don't have enough resources to meet the rising demand at the markets—as a result we're forced to limit the number of vouchers we distribute.
We need to raise more funds to meet the needs of the senior and disabled population. We also have new funding sources, but unfortunately we can't access them until we advance money to the markets. Finally, we want to increase the amount we distribute at existing markets and especially to add markets in Los Angeles. 

$15,000 will Launch Market Match Programs in

Compton

Downtown L.A. (The lively and hip 5th & Spring location, also home to many seniors and people with disabilities)
Eagle Rock
Pasadena
Santa Fe Springs
 By making a donation you'll be helping our small California farmers, many having to cut production due to the drought. Unless they get more income on a regular basis, they won't be able to afford to keep driving to L.A. to sell at the markets. We could see a loss of environmentally sustainable farming and a loss of affordable farmers markets in our urban areas. Help thousands of families, seniors and people with disabilities get a dignified healthy diet that will help the farmers now struggling with the drought who are bringing this great food into Los Angeles.



You can be part of this program and get the recognition you deserve for making L.A. healthy and hunger-free while giving California’s farmers the boost they need!

Joel is director of the New York City Coalition Against Hunger and former Clinton administration official who pulls no punches in this excellent book.
—For a $40 contribution you will receive: The intersection between art and hunger, a DVD of author/playwright Dan Froot's innovative tabletop theater piece "Who's Hungry?". Dan translates the true stories of people who have experienced hunger in modern America into miniature dramas using small puppetlike figures. A truly unique art form. Plus a copy of Joel Berg's book "All You Can Eat: How Hungry is America? Described above.
—Oh yes, show people what your support with pride! We have T-shirts, tote bags, water bottles and flash drives. All items sport the Hunger Action Los Angeles Logo–make it memorable! Help us spread the word!

story:
About Urban Co-Lab: Our Vision

(pictured above, current progress in the facility)
The goal of Urban Co-Lab is to build a center for entrepreneurial activity and innovation that serves as a catalyst for the revitalization of a historic yet rapidly evolving corridor in Austin: the E 12th Street Business District.   We endeavor to transform what used to be a drug and crime invested cross-street into a beacon for urban entrepreneurs and innovators. 

Using our own neighborhood as inspiration, Urban Co-Lab aspires to incubate companies creating sustainable, scalable solutions to education, housing, transportation and other areas of importance to urban corridors developing disruptive advancements for global communities and the local economy. 

The Impact: Economic/Entrepreneur Development 

Urban Co-Lab Austin is particularly unique in that this forth-coming social entrepreneurship venture is guided by a deep commitment to the cultivation and inclusion of the local community. 

Urban Co-Lab will:

  • Provide entrepreneurial work-space for urban innovators within a corridor that is void of professional spaces to support entrepreneurs. 
  • Provides supports and access to networks for socially minded entrepreneurs looking to innovate urban communities.
  • Provide area beautification and janitorial jobs for low-income, high potential residents.  This allows area residents to be a part of the positive changes happening in their community. 
  • Develop a partnership with Huston-Tillotson University that includes providing up to four opportunities for college internships for honors students to work alongside start-up founders.

Why We Are Raising Funds:

We are raising funding to support the build-out and furnishing of the facility and to assist with underwriting marketing and promotional needs including our grand-opening. 

  • If we don't reach our whole goal, we will use whatever we receive toward the aforementioned areas: build-out, furnishing and marketing and promotion

Additional History of 12th Street Business District & The Urban Co-Lab Space

East Austin has a rich legacy in the history of Austin, Texas, one of the fast growing cities in the country.  At its peak, the East 12th street business district was a culturally rich area of Austin that served as home to the city's African American and Hispanic communities and many businesses and entrepreneurs who served the community.  

As with many urban cores, when the drug epidemic of the 80's hit, E. 12th Street was hit very hard and what once was a thriving business district, turned into the prime location for drugs, prostitution and crime.  During this time, our space served as a brothel and a gas station. 

The building was purchased by a local community nonprofit organization and revitalized and was once used as a coffee shop for the homeless.  

Today we endeavor to add another chapter to this story of The Station on E. 12th Street by converting the facility into a beacon of entrepreneurship and economic revitalization for the entire city.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Know an Urban Innovator in Austin looking for co-working space?  Tell them to check out Urban Co-Lab, www.urbanco-lab.com

story:
Short Summary

Flashbax is a little over a year old now in the location and as we grow, we look to your, our customers and our friends for help as we grow. We are entering the second phase of our plan for the shop. This includes upgrades to how the store looks, our inventory we carry, and even adding logos to our shop van!

We are mostly a self funded business with a large majority of the stores profits going right back into the store for improvements. This fundraiser is to help speed up the process of improving the store and making it a better place for our customers and a stand out in our field.

What We Need

This is the breakdown of the funds we are seeking and where they will go. We are asking for $6,000 overall.

$4,000 of this is going towards a massive renovation to make room for 10,000+ comic books. This will include new custom shelving to hold the comics, display stands, and wall shelving to hold comic books, manga, and graphic novels. This will make Flashbax one of the largest comic book dealers in the region.

$1,500 will go towards a side fund to get a full Diamond account for Flashbax. This will bring in new comic books, collectibles, and more into our inventory and allow customers a closer place to buy comic books and related goods. This fund will go towards 3 months worth of orders.

$350 or so will go towards adding official shop logos onto the side and tailgate of the shop van. This van (named Kiora by the shop fans) will become a regular sight at the conventions and with the shop logos it will stand out in a crowd.

$500 (tentative goal) If we raise more than expected we will allocate roughly $500 in putting a full decal of the MTG Kiora, The Crashing Wave artwork on the hood of the van. This will make the van stand out even more and draw attention to the store and should help advertisement a lot as it will be sitting outside wherever we are vending.

The Impact

This will further the success we have seen for our small shop. As word spreads, Flashbax is slowly becoming a name people recognize and trust. Our goal at Flashbax is for everyone to have a great experience in our store, find something they love, and introduce people to a new hobby.

We are a safe location for people of all backgrounds, races, religions, and hobbies to come, have fun, and meet like minded people. We have seen new friendships forged, games played, and people finding that one items they miss from their childhood.

These upgrades to Flashbax will make it a stronger addition to the Aberdeen community and also a stronger business overall. We area member of the Downtown Association here in Aberdeen and as we grow, we can be a voice for smaller businesses in our area as well as a voice for our customer base.

Risks & Challenges

The risks are low but the challenges are high. If we do not meet the main goal of $6,000, we will have to assess the money we do get. The first and major goal will be the purchase of the comic book collection. This is a key piece missing in our store and will solidify our footing as a true comic book shop (for back issues).

The logos on the van are also a high end priority as we will use this van day in and day out 365 days a year. People seeing this van, with the logo, will peak their interest and draw them to the store.

Without a Diamond account we can not order newer comics. I myself (Erik Braley) have experience with working with Diamond and more so know my customers. I will bring a fun array of comics to our shelves and I hope to create a good repeat customer base with this account. Without it, each month I have to redirect people to other sources. Your help will keep the money local and create a new crowd of comic fans and collectors in our community.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not every one can donate. Time are still rough all around. You can still help! Spread the word about Flashbax, share this campaign to friends or family that might want to help. Know someone with an interest in helping a small business? Point them our way!

Everything helps in the end and we love you guys for a great year so far!

We area member of the Downtown Association here in Aberdeen and as we grow, we can be a voice for smaller businesses in our area as well as a voice for our customer base.
  Risks & ChallengesThe risks are low but the challenges are high. If we do not meet the main goal of $6,000, we will have to assess the money we do get. The first and major goal will be the purchase of the comic book collection. This is a key piece missing in our store and will solidify our footing as a true comic book shop (for back issues). The logos on the van are also a high end priority as we will use this van day in and day out 365 days a year. People seeing this van, with the logo, will peak their interest and draw them to the store. Without a Diamond account we can not order newer comics. I myself (Erik Braley) have experience with working with Diamond and more so know my customers. I will bring a fun array of comics to our shelves and I hope to create a good repeat customer base with this account. Without it, each month I have to redirect people to other sources. Your help will keep the money local and create a new crowd of comic fans and collectors in our community.
  Other Ways You Can HelpI know not every one can donate. Time are still rough all around. You can still help! Spread the word about Flashbax, share this campaign to friends or family that might want to help. Know someone with an interest in helping a small business? Point them our way!Everything helps in the end and we love you guys for a great year so far!

story:
Optimal health should be for everyone!

With more information available than ever regarding health, fitness and wellbeing, it is easy to be confused about what is "right", and what is right for you. My aim is to develop a health approach that is simplified, personalised, and easily digested. :)

  • My name is Bek Smith - I am a well-established physiotherapist and fitness instructor with a background in research
  • One of my professional strengths is helping people understand the science behind what makes them feel wonderful (or not-so-wonderful, so they can improve it!)
  • My new direction in life is to revamp health care in Australia, and maybe even the rest of the world! Through the use of recently-available technology and years of clinical knowledge and experience, I have a new system of consultation that will make health easier than ever for consumers AND professionals.
  • As an employee of the Back In Motion Health Group in Australia and an agent of Challenge Coaching in Adelaide, I also have the clinical expertise and technical know-how of my teams supporting me to bring better health to our communities.

What We Need & What You Get

We need help funding our equipment, and in return you get first access to our technology and/or expertise!

  • I need $10,000 to fund the purchase of a hair follicle analysis system, which gives an overview of your last 90 days of nutrition and toxin exposure, as well as a portable real-time ultrasound machine so I can accurately assess people's muscle function on-the-go.
  • While this technology has previously been expensive and/or difficult to access, my aim is to now make better health care more personalised as well as more accessible.
  • This money will also fund my next phase of study in functional nutrition, which will allow me to assess clients' health on a cellular and molecular level, and train other professionals to view the bigger picture in wellbeing.
  • If we don't reach the goal of $10,000 in the next 30 days, the money we DO receive will still go towards funding this important venture, eventually.
  • In return for your contribution, you could be one of the first people in the world to receive my Wholistic Wellness Guide, undergo a comprehensive wellness analysis, or be an early adopter of this new system and build your own small business around it! We can even arm you with the skills you need to be a successful entrepreneur!

The Impact

We know that stress and worry are two major contributing factors to dis-ease in our society - and what are the two biggest things we worry about? HEALTH and MONEY! So what if I could provide you with a system that uses new technology to focus on scientifically-proven health care, in a way that saves money for the consumer while also increasing profitability for the practitioner? 

How? 

By cutting out the pseudo-science and false information that is so common these days, consumers can make well-informed choices about how to look after themselves more effectively, and genuine practitioners can flourish with new tools that will accurately inform their clients and guide their care.

This campaign is just Stage 1 of a whole new enterprise. Check out how you can help me with my long-term plans:

  • Stage 1: SET UP.  Purchase essential equipment.
  • Stage 2: CLIENT FOCUS.  Assess individuals and arm them with information about improving their health, through an easy-to-follow wellness plan.
  • Stage 3: PRACTITIONER FOCUS.  Train other professionals to provide the same outstanding service to others!
  • Stage 6: COMMUNITY FOCUS:  Develop a "pay it forward" arm to channel a percentage of profits back into the community, and provide health care services to the less fortunate.
In summary, we're aiming to benefit consumers, professionals, small business owners AND the wider community, by providing TRUTHFUL and SCIENTIFICALLY VALIDATED information about wellbeing to wherever it is needed.

Risks and Challenges

I have left one of my jobs to focus on this new endeavour, and my partner is also considering leaving his employment to work full-time on our business. That's how much we believe in this concept! My colleagues at Challenge Coaching are also dedicating a great deal of their time to support me in this venture, and to help other professionals who want to take a new direction with me. Of course the risk is that others don't believe in it as much as we do - which is where we are also asking the support of the Indiegogo community to give us feedback on how important various aspects of health are to you. No point providing a service to the consumer if the consumers aren't interested, right?


    Other Ways You Can Help

    You may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

    • Get the word out and share my campaign with your friends, family, colleagues - let them know via email, Facebook, or shout it from the rooftops!
    • Use the convenient Indiegogo share tools to spread my message further!
    • Give us your feedback about what concerns YOU about health and wellness that we can address.


    Be part of the ultimate win-win solution for health care. Let's make wellness and wealth more attainable so we can (finally) make the world a healthier and more enjoyable place!

story:
The Grateful Green Food Truck

The Grateful Green Food truck will be the first entirely vegetarian/vegan and gluten-free food truck in South Bend, Indiana.  There has been a call for more vegetarian and vegan food options in the South Bend area, and The Grateful Green wants to answer that call with delicious, fast, and affordable plant-based meals.  We have the funding to get this truck on the road, but we need help with the last $10,000.  This will allow us to design the truck to make it look like someplace you'd want to eat.  This will also let us purchase the needed equipment for the truck in order to make you tasty juices, smoothies, coffee, soups, sandwiches, and more.

Jessie Miles, the owner of The Grateful Green Food Truck and an enthusiastic vegan, has over 17 years experience in vegetarian and vegan cuisine.  Jessie is dedicated to provide a healthy alternative to fast food that will help slim waistlines but not wallets.  Healthy food shouldn't have to cost you a fortune.  Food trucks are able to provide quality and gourmet foods at discounted prices.  The Grateful Green Food Truck will offer customers healthy, tasty, and affordable juices, smoothies, and meals.

South Bend, Indiana is a great location for The Grateful Green Food Truck.  The city is becoming more and more exciting by the day.  We have a great art and music scene, wonderful breweries and restaurants,  and fun events such as SB150 and ArtBeat.  But, surprisingly, South Bend does not yet have a big food truck scene.  This is soon changing - the trucks are coming - and The Grateful Green Food Truck wants to help show other food truck entrepreneurs and restaurateurs that South Bend is an ideal city with great people.  With your help, you can not only help one food truck get started, but also help pave the way for other food trucks.  More food trucks = more affordable and interesting food options = more happy bellies!


Where We're At

The recipes are tested and finished.  We're ready.  The community is ready.  You're ready, right?  You know you are!  We're already invested and ready to make this happen!  All we need is some additional funding.  This is your opportunity to participate in this exciting new food venture in South Bend!  You will be helping to pay it forward - help fund us now and we'll help feed you soon!  


What's in it for You

Aside from our undying love and gratitude for your generosity, you also will have the opportunity to get some great perks when you help fund The Grateful Green Food Truck.   

  • For $10,000 your name will be painted on The Grateful Green Food Truck as part of the design!
  • For $5,000 we'll name a menu item after you!
  • For $50 you'll get a Grateful Green tote bag filled with goodies!
  • For $25 you can own your own Grateful Green Food Truck shirt!
  • For $10 your name will be displayed on our website!

Risks & Challenges

We're prepared to take on any challenges that we will face on the road to making this dream come true.  We have secured funding for the main expenses - the truck and some equipment.  This additional funding will help us design the truck the way we want and help secure the final equipment needed on the truck.  This funding will also be used in case we need pay for repairs or maintenance in the first few months of operation.  We are confident this venture will be successful (or else we wouldn't be doing this!) and with your help, we can make The Grateful Green Food Truck happen!


Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can help fund us or not, you can help us get the word out and make some noise about this Indiegogo campaign!  

Here are some ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, or email!  Look for the share tools on the top left side of this campaign.
  • Tell your friends and family about our campaign and ask them to share our campaign to the world.
  • Visit our website.
  • Like our Facebook page.
  • Follow us on Twitter.
  • Follow us on Instagram.
  • Or if all else fails, shout about our campaign from the rooftops... well, actually you shouldn't do that.  But thanks for thinking of us.
THANK YOU!   THANK YOU!   THANK YOU!   Together we are The Grateful Green!

story:
Introducing Portfoliobox 3

Portfoliobox 3 is a web tool you can use to create your own unique website.

This brand new version of Portfoliobox utilizes the power of modern web technology to make your website incredibly fast. You will have full control and you will never be restricted by an overall theme that limits your design.

If you are a creative, we have made Portfoliobox for you.

Be in control - without restricting theme

With most other website builders you are forced to select a theme for your website before you begin creating it. Usually it is easy to find a nice looking theme, but themes are not unique and very hard to modify.

We believe creatives need liberty. Your personal website must be truly unique. A digital portfolio reflecting who you are. Therefor, with Portfoliobox you are never restricted by an overall theme that limits your design. You are free to use any template on any page and you can combine pages as you wish, the number of combinations are infinite.

Super fast - thanks to the latest technologies

The website that you build with Portfoliobox 3 will look like a normal website, but it will be quick as an app. Portfoliobox is built with the latest web technologies and that will make your website incredible fast.

Never wait - All updates are instant
As a creative you are used to have have full control of your tools. With the Portfoliobox Admin panel you will have full control of your website. All changes are updated instantly and you will never have to wait for something to be saved. You see what you do and that makes it easy for you to create your website.

Modern web technology enables instant browsing
Normally when clicking a link in the menu of a website the entire page will reload. You will have to download all the files again and wait for the server. With Portfoliobox 3 you will never have to wait like that again. When a user clicks a link in your menu the page will load immediately.

Meet the team

Portfoliobox is a Swedish company which started in 2012. Our first website tool is already used by 250.000 photographers, designers, architects and other creatives from across the world, but we are not finished. During the last year we have worked hard to build a new and improved version. We have gathered thousands of request, collected the best ideas and utilized the latest web technologies to create something extraordinary. We hope that Portfoliobox 3 will be the best website builder in the world for creatives.

Contact
For press inquiries please contact info@portfolibox.net. For other questions please contact support@portfoliobox.net.

Where the funds go

Portfoliobox 3 is nearly finished. With your help we will be able to complete the tool and launch it in time. With your support we will also be able to translate Portfoliobox to other language and launch it in new markets. Our goal is to create a tool that can be used by creative people all over the world and to do that we need to invest in development, design, hosting and service.

Help us spread the word

Your support would be invaluable to us, but if you don’t need a website you can support us in other ways. If you have any friend who has a passion for photography, design, art, modeling, make-up, architecture or any other creative niche, please tell her/him about this campaign. It would mean a lot to us!

Share the link: http://igg.me/at/portfoliobox

Pre-order now and Timeline

Portfoliobox 3 will soon be ready for launch. Your risk is low. If you pre-order Portfoliobox now you will not only get an incredible discount, you will also be sure to get your account before June!

story:
Hey There!

Faire Joli is a new venue in the Main Street District of Grandview, MO that offers creative classes, mobile office suites, an event space for small business collaborations, and entrepreneurial forums.   



Overview

Season Scott (Bitsy Blossom) and Chrystal Simmons (The Tulle Box) are not new to the creative lifestyle.  Each has a handmade Etsy shop that ships out hundreds of orders each month.  After outgrowing their respective home studios earlier this year, they decided to partner up and create a venue that brings together homespun creative passion and local entrepreneurial gumption.

Help Us Out

We are launching our venue this month and we couldn't be happier!  But we could really use your assistance before our doors are open to the public. You see, our mobile offices still need furnishing and a coffee machine wouldn't hurt either.  We also have our hearts set on some multi-functional tables that will be easy to move from room to room depending on what concept we're hosting that day.  And thanks to the previous tenants, there is a huge blank sign with amazing visibility just begging to have our logo plastered across it!  In short, it takes some cash to set up a new space and we think you are just the person to help us do this!
If you're still not sure that you want to be a benefactor, won't you take a moment to peruse the rewards to the right and see if we can sway you with our stellar offerings.  There are incentives for both local folks as well as out of towners, so no excuses, OK?



What It All Means

We are residents of South KC, specifically Grandview, and we love our little corner of Kansas City.  This part of town needs spunky entrepreneurs to throw some creative elbow grease around and we would be privileged to be the gals that make that happen!  With that in mind, we have curated a complimentary set of services that, we believe, will both enrich and delight our community.
Our Mobile Office Suites will cater to the need for conveniently located meeting spaces with flexible usage options.  This service is perfect for on the go professionals, home based business owners, and more.  
The Creative Classes will appeal to the abundant DIY demographic as well as those just looking for a unique outing outside the norm on a weekend.  Both hobbyists and seasoned makers will certainly enjoy the intimate party setting of these events.
Entrepreneurial Forums will be developed as we learn more about how we can assist our target market.  We consider it a necessity, in life as well as in business, to surround ourselves with people that are smarter than we are.  And we think that it a large piece of what has gotten us this far.
Our Pop Up Shops will bring together a taste of the astounding local talent that Kansas City has to offer.  This monthly event will draw people over to our little corner of KC and will act as an introduction between you and Grandview's up and coming awesomeness.


The Hard Part

Some things come easily and other things take some serious work.  In this case, our ideas and preliminary connections came simply and swiftly.  Now the hard part is building out this vision that we have in our forward thinking minds.  And most of that building out could use some cash thrown at it.


Before We Say Goodbye

As  final note, we would love for you to jump on this boat with us as we move forward.  Obviously, we would love your money (no shame here, right?).  But your support doesn't have to look just like monetary contributions.  If our plan resonates with what you are about, please take the time to share the campaign.  Then, feel free to share some more too.  


With Creativity & Appreciation,
Season & Chrystal

Some things come easily and other things take some serious work.  In this case, our ideas and preliminary connections came simply and swiftly.  Now the hard part is building out this vision that we have in our forward thinking minds.  And most of that building out could use some cash thrown at it.




    Before We Say Goodbye
As  final note, we would love for you to jump on this boat with us as we move forward.  Obviously, we would love your money (no shame here, right?).  But your support doesn't have to look just like monetary contributions.  If our plan resonates with what you are about, please take the time to share the campaign.  Then, feel free to share some more too.  

With Creativity & Appreciation,
Season & Chrystal

story:
Short Summary

We've all seen the Hoarding shows on television--people living in filth and squalor due to the little understood mental illness that keeps them trapped in their things.

But have you ever thought about what happens to their CHILDREN?  

Millions of American children are growing up in stifling chaos, with nowhere to turn.  Due to the shame and secrecy of their plight, only a very small percentage are rescued by Child Protective Services.  Once they turn 18, they no longer qualify for services and yet frequently cannot see a way out:

  • They do not have the basic, daily living skills that many of us take for granted.
  • They have no place to relax, take a shower, or do laundry.
  • They have nowhere to stay when they come home for Christmas or summer vacation, and no place to go while they save money for a place of their own.

Until now.

We are building a Refuge--a retreat and education center specifically designed to provide adult children of hoarders with a place to go.  It will be a clean, open space where they can take classes in simple cooking, cleaning, and personal finance; come visit just to get cleaned up or get away for a few hours; or come live for awhile until they can get out on their own.

My husband and I have already invested the majority of the funds to make this happen, but we are running out of money, and we need your help to finish it.

What We Need 

We need a minimum of $50,000 to complete our vision:

  1. During construction, our washing machine broke and flooded two of the rooms.  We now need to purchase new appliances, repair the damage, and refurbish the laundry room.  Having a clean space to do laundry is a huge part of the services we plan to provide!  $10,000
  2. Earlier this year, one of the trees on our property fell on our neighbors house!  We have additional trees that are precariously close as well, and they need to be removed before winter.  $5000
  3. Due to unforeseen expenses on the inside projects, we have no money left over for the grounds.  This is the primary location where people will come, relax, hang out, and get away for awhile!  $35,000

Those are our immediate needs, but they are just the tip of the iceberg.  We will also need funds for ongoing maintenance, to cover fees for professional counselors we may bring in, to pay for marketing efforts to let people know that we are here, to buy books for our onsite library, etc.

With enough funds, we could add additional temporary stay units, or even buy another house to serve another community!

The Impact

Imagine growing up in a home where strewn everywhere in every room are piles of dirty clothing, infused with putrid body odor, rotten stains from out-of-date meals and pets that have never seen a bath. The cascading, towering piles encase your life, and the only spaces are the narrow, garbage-strewn pathways to the bathroom and the kitchen.The kitchen and dining room are unusable. Cartons and containers cover every counter space available. Your food is always rotten, so you live on cereal and canned soup. But the cereal has meal moths in it, and the milk is curdled.  The bread is moldy, and the fruit flies are overwhelming. The plumbing is broken, so you can't wash yourself or brush your teeth. Or you have to carry pans of boiling water upstairs, then dry yourself off with a smelly damp towel.

Obviously, this lack of functional living space makes it impossible for children to ever know cleanliness, stability and routine. Instead, they live in total chaos.

At school, you are so envious of the other children from their normal tidy homes with their clothes washed and ironed by their mothers. You keep your home life a secret so that no one will ever realize the way you live. Your friendships are limited. Children are often too embarrassed to have friends come over, or are not allowed to, due to their parent's embarrassment.

But for millions of American children this is an everyday reality with no escape. They are victims of their hoarding parents, who suffer from a little understood form of mental illness. Worst of all, they have nowhere to go.
There are between 6 and 15 million hoarders living in the US and some 75 cities are starting task forces specifically toward working with hoarders from their community. However, there is not one refuge for the children of hoarders.
 Until now.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help:

  1. Send this campaign to everyone you know.
  2. Ask the people you know to send it to everyone they know.
  3. Reach out to people who have immediate contact with hoarders and have a vested interest in helping the children:  psychotherapists, professional organizers, clean up specialists, school counselors, social workers, etc.
  4. Post information about The Refuge at colleges and universities--this is often the first place of escape.
  5. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your support!

NOTE:  The Refuge is a sponsored project of SocialGood, a public 501c(3) charity.   SocialGood works to create and establish positive influences for individuals, communities, and the environment. Their goal is to sponsor and develop projects that will help positively impact and develop local communities into healthier and happier places to live, work, and be.
