story:
What's the big idea?!
Fly! Boise is a center for aerial arts instruction and performance, opening Summer 2015. Center stage at Fly! Boise will house the flying trapeze rig. Participants of nearly all ages and abilities will safely climb the ladder to the pedestal and be guided by 3 flying trapeze professionals to accomplish a trick which matches the flyer's ability level, culminating in transfer to a catcher on a separate trapeze and a gentle landing in the safety net. Beginning classes require no special skills; serious flyers may accept the challenge of ever-increasing levels of difficulty.

Paula (our founder) has spent the past 2 years traveling to fly in many different schools.  While she loves to fly, she also loves watching beginners in their very first flying trapeze experience.  She has seen people from all backgrounds confront this unique challenge, and is excited to provide this growth opportunity to people in Idaho.  As a relatively new trapeze enthusiast, she remains ever-mindful of the transformative power of such an experience and is committed to ensuring a magical adventure to new and returning students!


Why we need your help:

The flying trapeze apparatus (called a rig) is an engineering feat!  While we have done our best to conserve expense, our priority lies in creating an exceptional experience for students.  As such, we have decided to make significant upgrades to our rig to enhance safety and comfort.  The upgrades add to the cost of the rig, and we need help with the added costs.

Originally, we believed our entire rig would cost $15,000 and we budgeted appropriately.  Additional expenses include a brand new safety net ($5,,205), new platform and net poles ($2,800), and transportation (Paula and a U-Haul! $2,245; $245 over previous budget).  That's a grand total of $8,250 over our original budget.  Certainly, more unexpected expenses will arise.  Meeting this goal will go a long way toward handling the unexpected!

Expenses beyond our goal are many, including (most importantly) bringing the finest teachers and trapeze professionals from across the country to Boise for our season.  Apparently, the nation has not yet realized that Boise is an amazing place to live, so finding these fabulous people has been more challenging than expected, and the relocation more costly.  Additional funds raised will be used to ensure we have the highest quality staff throughout our season.

Whose big idea was this?

Paula J. Murphy, D.C.: Boise chiropractor, flying trapeze enthusiast and amateur aerialist. Paula's fantasy of opening a flying trapeze school began in 2013 and has led her to connect with some of the best trapeze rig builders and teachers in the country. She is committed to building a school that is accessible, affordable, challenging and FUN! Additionally, Paula has worked for 17 years with Dr. Patch Adams (yes, about whom the Robin Williams movie was created) in the arenas of Health Care system design reform and therapeutic clowning. With Patch, she has taken chiropractic care and clowning on humanitarian missions to Cuba, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Peru, and El Salvador. 

Other ways you can help:

Talk about us!  Help us make sure everyone in the Treasure Valley knows that we're here. 

Come and take a class!  You can register on our website (www.flyboise.org).  Then, tell your friends how amazing it was!

Help us connect with groups who seek adventure, team-building, confidence-boosting, or personal growth.  We offer discounts to non-profit organizations, and would love to help!

story:
Meet The Team-

The Kayaker

My name is Aaron Hines and I am a meta-entrepreneur at Texas State University studying Economics. Some of my personal goals are to travel all 50 U.S. states, start at least one business, help as many people as I possibly can, and live a life serving God. KCCO. My passion is to start an outdoor recreation business after college that will specialize in unique, local, and alternative outdoor trips and rentals. Everything from kayaking, camping, and backpacking to national and international travel. This journey is not only for personal reasons of mine, but also as market research. I want to accomplish a couple goals. First, I would like to learn how to live, travel, and explore alternatively. Second, I am using this opportunity to apply my knowledge of business and economics to fund this expedition by creating incentives and other creative advertising and bartering through ecommerce. Lastly, I will be documenting everything about the trip in an effort to compile information, so that people who want to travel but do not have the money nor connections can learn how to do so.Off the beaten path we go. 
Facebook: Backyard Adventures
Instagram: @smkayaktrips
Snapchat: backyardadv

The Storyteller

My name is Sebastian Santos. I’m a sophomore at Texas State University, pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Education. For this summer, I’m seeking the opportunity to travel with a close friend of mine from college, to take the time to reflect and take a break from school. Due to a circumstance that has placed my family and myself under tremendous financial burdens, I am giving this program a shot to make the best out of what I have and what can be utilized this summer of 2015. I have travelled to many parts of the U.S. But on the other hand, I have not left the country in 14 years. This dates back to the year 2000, when I moved to the U.S. as a five-year-old, first generation Filipino-American. I’d like to travel back to the Philippines again in the future, but for this summer, I just need the time to take a break for myself and find some balance. In exchange for the funding I receive, I would like to offer my stories throughout my travel in Colorado, through: postcards, pictures, vlogs, and other items that record my encounters. Overall, I would like to use this opportunity to educate myself about the masses or demographics I may encounter on my trip. As an Education major with a focus on English, I will not take this trip as just another ordinary vacation; but an opportunity to equip myself with general knowledge on life.

The Campaign

This campaign is to support my travels from San Marcos, Texas to Vancouver, British Columbia and back. I am embarking on this trip with my passport, two booked flights (Denver to San Francisco, and Seattle to Denver) and around $500 in my bank account.
Time Frame: (3-5 weeks)
Gear: Everything that can fit in my Kelty backpack and my Go Pro Hero 3+.
Transportation: Any and all (Plane, Train, Bus, Car, Uber, Ferry, Bicycle, etc.)
Shelter: Alternative (Hostels, Friends, Churches, Camping, people met via social media, apartments, dormitories, couch, futon, sleeping bag, hammock, van)
Team: So Far....Entire Trek-Aaron Hines, Half Trek- Luke, open to anyone who wants to meet me in any city along the way for as long as they can.
Purpose- To prove that anything is possible with Faith in God and the kindness of other people. To create a movement of uncanny acts of kindness to help people achieve their goals. To travel for travel's sake. To create memories captured in photography, journalism, and social media. To explore the unknown. To push our horizons. To meet people. To experience. To kill the opposition society has for people who refuse to submit to predetermined standards. Carpe Diem.

What We Need & What You Get

Support- For every follower on Instagram will follow back. Instagram @smkayaktrips. For posts of encouragement on social media our team will respond with gratitude and current location, activity, or updates.
Monetary Donations- compensation depending on level of financial contribution
Item Donations- Recognition of the donor as well as feature of item in picture/post
Hosts (People who can provide- transportation, food, shelter, shower, medicine, laundry, and/or information for the Team)- Receive our gratitude and will be featured in our team's travel video!
Team Members- the experience is self rewarding if you are brave enough to leave everything and come along for the journey! If you decide to join you are ultimately responsible and liable for yourself.
Risks & Challenges

Honestly, there is a 100% risk of this trip not being completed. Any number of things could happen to me or anyone on my team. We could fall prey to harm, disease, or being without food and shelter. We could certainly run out of finances if our efforts fail. We could lose our passports and become stuck in Canada. We could doubt ourselves and give up. We could fall into uncertainty and not even attempt the trip. 

Fortunately, I believe we will be successful no matter what happens as long as we make the attempt. We will be successful whether we got as far as 3 miles or 3,000 miles from where we began. I truly am afraid of all the risks and challenges, but my faith in God and other people will help me overcome this fear and follow this dream. I think a lot of people talk about their dreams, but I am taking a stand and asking for people I may or may not know to help me achieve one of mine.

story:
Hi everyone!

Next month I will be spending two weeks in Romania for charity work. I will be part of a team that builds houses for orphaned children. The team will be split, there’ll be those doing the construction work and others will be relieving the Romanian guardians that look after these orphans 24/7, giving them a bit of a break for a few days. In a nut shell that is some of what we will be doing, but there is so much more and I am happy to go into detail.

My plea to you is to help sponsor my trip with some donations. My target is £600.

Most people get sponsorship by marathons, but that won’t really benefit YOU and is guaranteed to give ME aches and pains.

Some people do cake sales, but lets face it, people nowadays are a healthy bunch on their 10th diet and so forth. I don’t want to be your excuse for breaking your cycle.

So the ultimate solution, I thought, would be to do some small jobs of your choice for you guys in return for a donation. I thought maybe £5 minimum but you can give as much as you can afford and depending on how you find worthy of the services given you. So the type of thing I can maybe do for you is clean your car, “office” or kitchen, do your groceries, walk your dog, some laundry etc etc….the list can go on and on. Although this is a global campaign, the small jobs offer can only apply to local people for obvious reasons, unless there is something I can do for you digitally.

If you don’t really have any particular jobs that need doing, or it cannot be done due to your location, but are feeling generous still, by all means your donation is more than welcome.

Your help will be much appreciated both by myself and more so by the Romanian team :)

For more info on the charity and the kind of thing I will be doing please check out the attached video.

You can also contact me via Facebook message: https://www.facebook.com/nicola.matiwone
story_txt: Hi everyone!Next month I will be spending two weeks in Romania for charity work. I will be part of a team that builds houses for orphaned children. The team will be split, there’ll be those doing the construction work and others will be relieving the Romanian guardians that look after these orphans 24/7, giving them a bit of a break for a few days. In a nut shell that is some of what we will be doing, but there is so much more and I am happy to go into detail.My plea to you is to help sponsor my trip with some donations. My target is £600.Most people get sponsorship by marathons, but that won’t really benefit YOU and is guaranteed to give ME aches and pains.Some people do cake sales, but lets face it, people nowadays are a healthy bunch on their 10th diet and so forth. I don’t want to be your excuse for breaking your cycle.So the ultimate solution, I thought, would be to do some small jobs of your choice for you guys in return for a donation. story:
The Peyote Guardians bring their message of life and ancestry to Europe!

The purpose of this Indiegogo campaign is to collect money for the continuation of the Europe tour, and to support sustainable development in the Wixárica communities depicted in the film. The money collected here will be transferred in its totality to the Huicholes project. 

We also invite you to come and see the documentary in Sweden, Denmark, Spain and France. For detailed information in each country, click here.

Huicholes: The Last Peyote Guardians is a story about the Wixárika People, one of the last living Pre-Hispanic cultures in Latin America. The film chronicles their struggle against the Mexican government and transnational mining companies to preserve Wirikuta, their most sacred territory and the land where the peyote grows, the traditional medicine that keeps alive the knowledge of this iconic people of Mexico.

You can watch the movie´s trailer and rent it online here. 

We are passionate people who have given the past 3-4 years of our lives to this cause:

I'm Hernan Vilchez, and I want to share what has been the most important work of my life: The task I was charged with by the elders of an ancient people who are fighting for their cultural survival. They withstood the Spanish conquest; they ignored industrialization; but now comes the challenge that may be their undoing.

I've invested my life savings and three years of my time to create a film that has drawn nearly 20,000 viewers to screenings in Mexico, has had online viewers in more than 40 countries, and more than 130,000 followers on Facebook. Now it's time to take it to the world.

I'm Paola Stefani, anthropologist and communicologist. Authorities of the Wixárika people invited me in 2010 to collaborate in the defense of their sacred territory, Wirikuta, in the north central Mexico state of San Luis Potosí from exploitation by a Canadian silver mining company. I have worked since then in the diffusion of their spiritual struggle to preserve Wirikuta.

Fortunately, Hernán Vilchez contacted me and together we were able to produce "Huicholes: The Last Peyote Guardians", one of the most relevant projects of my career. I am convinced that this movie contains a powerful message for all humanity and particularly for the respect of the indigenous rights of Mexico and Latin America. 

The implications of this film go far beyond an indigenous group in Mexico. What's happening in Wirikuta is happening everywhere as the sacred is sacrificed on the altar of the marketplace, and fragile, unique ecosystems, our last truly wild places, are obliterated. Our hope is that this movie will shift peoples' perspective and move them into action. 

Together with two of the film protagonists, a father-son team of marakames, traditional village shamans and healers, Hernan presented this film in at least 20 cities in the U.S. and Canada in November and December 2014, and they are now touring around Europe until June 7th, already filling up the cinemas in the main cities of Germany, Switzerland and Austria. It's time for the Wixarika voice - which is the voice of the Earth itself - to be heard in Scandinavia!

We are working with volunteers in local communities to help us do this in on a shoestring, and to show the connections between this story and what is happening in communities all over the world, at the same time trying to raise money to support sustainable development -- an alternative to mining -- in the communities depicted in the film. And in a decision that is probably unprecedented in the film industry, we have agreed to publicly report all proceeds and decide, together with Wixarika leaders, how the money will be spent. 

What We Need & What You Get

Supporting this film is a very concrete and high-impact way to put your money to work doing several important things at once. You'll be:

  • Helping to save an ancient people and a rare ecosystem 
  • Drawing attention to pressing local environmental issues in Europe
  • Raising money for sustainable development projects as an alternative to mining, and
  • Supporting a transparent model for independent filmmaking that can truly make a difference in the world.

The Impact

Very few high-quality, high-impact films depicting the assault on indigenous communities and lifeways around the world exist. We firmly believe that if the world knows what we are about to lose -- with the cultural integrity of the Wixarika people, but also with that of hundreds, perhaps thousands of unique indigenous peoples and non-indigenous communities around the world, along with their endangered, resource-rich  territories  -- people will act to change the course of history. 

This film is a powerful tool to facilitate that shift in consciousness and move people to action.

La Jornada (Mexico City Newspaper) talks about our campaign.

Risks & Challenges

We realize we've set an extremely high bar for ourselves; we have signed a historical agreement with Wixarika authorities agreeing to publicly report our proceeds and work together with them to use the film to promote a sustainable alternative to mining and industrial development in the communities depicted in the film. There are a lot of hopes and expectations placed on this film tour, and we feel an enormous responsibility to follow through.

We began this project with no institutional or corporate support of any kind, something that has also been a tremendous challenge, but we have been enormously gratified to witness the way that support has come to us -- monetary and otherwise -- exactly when and in the ways we've needed it. Clearly this is a project that is supported by forces greater than ours.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, there are lots of other ways you can help:

  • Help us spread the word with social media: Add us/follow us/repost. Facebook:@HuicholesTheLastPeyoteGuardians; Twitter: @PeyoteGuardians. Please use the Indiegogo share tools, join our Facebook events and invite people you know, forward our Action Alerts to your friends. 
  • Organize another independent screening in your university/community center with the honorarium/speakers fee to go to support this work
  • Watch the film on your own. It's available now on Vimeo on Demand for only $3.99 and worth every penny, and every minute of your time.
  • See www.huicholesfilm.com or contact us at huicholes@kaboprofilms.com for more information.
  • Buy the original sound track of the film with traditional music by the Ramirez shamanic family and contemporary compositions by Argentine multi-instrumentalist and composer Gastón Salazar.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
Thanks so much for sharing. We'll be looking for you!

story:
Date: Wednesday, March 30th 2016, 6:30pm-ish

Location: The Brubeck Room, Wilton (CT) Library

Thanks to everyone who has reached out in support of the Women's Seder: we now have been able to secure a date and location for this event!

Following the outline of a traditional Jewish Seder--including readings, songs and rituals--we will reenact one of the great stories of faith and freedom: the Exodus.

With art, music, dancing and food there'll be many ways for us to celebrate! 

We're also interested in hearing different voices: stories of women from faiths, races and cultures other than our own. Are you or do you know someone with a story to tell? Please contact us! 

Please note: All perks will be distributed  at or before the Seder!


November 6, 2015

Please join us for a modern Passover experience

in which we'll share stories and songs of oppression 

and liberation, as understood and told by women of 

diverse heritages. 

You can be a co-creator of this interfaith event! Be part of the planning team, tell your story, invite others. 

The Seder will be held one evening during the last week of March 2016 (a few weeks before Passover) in or near Wilton, CT.  There'll be music and dancing and of course a celebratory meal. We'll compile a hagadah--a book of readings--for you to keep. 

Who Are We? Wilton Jewish is a collaborative project borne of the lifetimes of Susan Cutler and Batya Diamond, educators and friends who have known each other since 1996. We currently work with b'nai mitzvah students and officiate at private and community prayer services, and at all types of life-cycle events. Susan teaches many weekly children's groups in her home. Along with Nora Baskin--friend, teacher, and resident storyteller--we are in our 11th year running a dynamic Friday afternoon children's Shabbat program called "SASS", the Super Awesome Shabbat School.

New Programs The Women’s Community Seder 2016 is being launched among several new projects by Wilton Jewish . Please visit our facebook page for more info: https://www.facebook.com/wiltonjewish?fref=ts

Why Crowdfund? In order to make this a special event, we will need at the very least to rent a lovely space (plus audio), provide a catered lunch, and produce hagadot.  Before incurring costs, we'd like to know whether you're as excited about this idea as we are. Take a look at some of the perks we're offering to entice you to donate. And in addition to financial support, we invite you to help plan and put on the Seder--our first planning meeting is scheduled for Tuesday, January 12th at 7:30pm.

What If We Exceed Our Goal?  Funds raised beyond the costs of the Seder will be shared between charitable donations (to outside organizations) and in support of other Wilton Jewish projects.

We hope that you will be a part of this exciting and meaningful event!

story:
Mozambique Live Long Project

This project is based on trying to bring some solid real change for local communities in one of the ten poorest countries in the world. This project is currently focused on the Ponta Mamoli area of Southern Mozambique where our projects efforts have already begun. Because we have managed to build a relationship with the local chief, we find ourselves in a position to drastically improve the lives and reality of an entire village of people if we can get enough support. By keeping it on a small local scale, it is reassuring to know that all the money is going directly towards the people in Ponta Mamoli where a dollar goes a very long way.

The birth of this project came after the wedding of Tanya and Lee Rabideau.  Tanya, a South African native, and Lee, originally from Colorado, brought people from around the globe to celebrate their commitment to each other.   While it was such a beautiful setting, some of the attendees were more interested in the local community and the people that inhabited the lands.  In witnessing the difficult conditions that the people of Ponta Malomi lived in, the Mozambique Live Long Project was born. 

The first campaign funded by Mozambique Live Long was the Wedding Wells Water Project.  This was privately funded by friends and family of the Rabideaus.   This project focused on the installation of ten borehole wells to provide potable water sources that are spread throughout the area of Ponta Mamoli.  Instead of traveling miles daily to poor river water sources, they now have a self sustaining source that can prevent the detrimental health issues that exist with dehydration.   This is a major important step in bringing basic needs to a population that has the average life expectancy of 43 years (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=erh8_-u-NYQ).

While the boreholes have made a huge difference in the lives of the people in Ponta Mamoli, the amount of malnourished children is still something we feel compelled to address. The next campaign that we are focusing on will build on the previous work.  The Free Food Foundation Project looks to build micro-ecosystems around the recently installed boreholes.  Focused on reforestation and sustainability, the project aims to leverage the local water source to build a micro-ecosystem that can provide food and medicinal plants. With the cooperation and buy-in of the local community, this project could bring a food source that will continue to provide for years to come (please see the following short video for a better idea: http://www.dw.com/en/living-with-hiv-in-mozambique/av-18650525).

What will it take to build a Free Food Foundation
The first phase was to install the clean water wells throughout Ponta Mamoli. The monies raised in this next phase will include bringing experts in botany and horticulture to the area and focus on the forestation of one of the borehole wells.  These experts specialize in intelligent sustainability through reforestation as opposed to agriculture. Planting a mixture of perennial plants with food sources can help restore soil and provide vegetables and herbs with health benefits such as moringa, goji, yucca, and others nutritious and medicinal crops. The construction of a wind turbine irrigation system and local support will help with the success of this project. The current campaign focuses on Phase II of the project. Once we have established this phase and gained the support and engagement of the local residents, we hope to add Phases III and IV, next year if possible. Phase III would involve constructing a growing house and installing an aeroponic growing system. In Phase IV we plan to add a solar pump. It would be wonderful if we could achieve Phases III & IV as soon as possible. The target on this current campaign is to ensure that we get Phase II up and running, so surpassing our goal brings us closer to our final vision of complete sustainability in Ponta Mamoli. Plus any donations over the target go towards the next garden of Eden (Phase V). These will cost much less as there will be no need to construct a grow house, plant supply lines will be in place, and community collaboration will already have been established. The combined target for Phases II, III, IV & V is $26000. 

Risks & Challenges

The buy in from the local population is very important piece to this project.  It will not be a success without their help.  Bringing horticulture education to the locals will help increase their ability to take care of themselves.  In a country that has rampant hunger and lack of food sources, this will hopefully help them rise to the challenge of providing for themselves.  If this project is successful, then next steps would be to build more micro-ecosystems across the area and then to focus on bringing better medicinal services as well.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

In 2014 the NHS spent an eyewatering £5.5bn of taxpayers money on Temp Nurses and allied health care professionals.  The private sector spent a similar insane amount.   

Most of the hourly rate charged by these agencies are fees.  Some reports show that Nurses who were paid just £19 ph are being charged out at £45 ph.  The worst highligthed case being £155 ph. This is not unique to the UK, it happens everywhere including the USA, AUS, EU and it is time this travesty ended.

My name is Stephen Soos, I am the founder and CEO of Diamond Cutter Ltd which owns Staffer Healthcare.  I am developing a managed peer to peer app that connects the buyer of temp services directly to the temp Nurse.  Called Staffer and similar in paradigm to Uber.com, Staffer instantly saves the buyer and taxpayer vast sums the second it is downloaded and deployed on any smart device or PC.

Staffer decentralises the provision of temp staff and puts control directly in the hands of the Buyer and the Nurse.  All direct and hidden costs are instantly eliminated the instant Staffer is downloaded and used.

We aim to release Staffer in London in Dec 2015, quickly followed by the rest of the UK, EU and other regions in 2016/17

Staffer will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Diamond Cutter ltd in August and will make it's money by adding just £/$1 per shift hour worked to the standard pay rate of the temp worker.

Staffer Healthcare (Ltd) is a social business.  That's the same as a normal business because it will make money, pay it's taxes and a fair working wage, but ALL net profits go to saving lives of patients in the developing world via our partner www.watsi.org, and to educating Dr's, Nurses, Dentists etc via our partner www.watchmego.org.

Unlike donating to charity, your money will be used to create a sustainable and profitable business that acts as a conduit of continuous funds for the above life changing crowdfunding sites.  Staffer massively reduces the burden on the tax payer and remove the carbon dumped annually into the atmosphere by 1000's of temp agencies around the world. 

In summary your donation will:-
  • Save the tax payer £/$bn's pa.
  • Save lives in developing countries by paying directly for medical care. 
  • Dramatically reduce the cost of health care service provision.
  • Help educate 1,000's of Dr's, Nurses, Dentist etc.
  • Removes the hidden admin costs of hiring temps.
  • Gives the Nurse and buyer instant control and removes the middle man.

Staffer is a highly disruptive technology that makes agencies obsolete and has an instant dramatic and far reaching impact on our wallets, lives, planet.  

What We Need & What You Get

I have funded the initial planning and development and need a further £100,000 to finish the app, hire a small team and deploy Staffer inside the M25 in Dec 2015.  Here is where funds will be used.

  • £30,000 to finish the Staffer
  • £12,000 to hire outbound call centre for 3 months
  • £6,000 for exhibition stand
  • £40,000 for initial marketing 
  • £8,000 to set up small office
  • £4,000 contingency
If we don't reach our goal we will use whatever is raised to fund the above in order of importance and go to traditional funding sources for more, which is our plan once Staffer is deployed and making money.
You get my word that I will never take a basic wage or dividend payment from this project and will find a board of self made philanthropists who will do the same.  We will pay Managers and staff a fair wage to make Staffer a success.
For every single donation of £100 we will give you a gift card of £5 to use on waste.org so that you can experience the joy of reaching out in fellowship and saving someones life.  For every cumulative £100 donated we will choose a patient on Watsi.org and donate £5.

The Impact Of Your Donation

If you give £1 to a charity, that money has gone, it is used up.  if you donate to make Staffer a reality that £1 is multiplied many times by the money making activities of the company.  It makes that £1 reach out into the future again and again.

Take time to look at wasti.org and watchmego.org and experience how the people behind these organisations are positively impacting the lives of so many of our brothers and sisters in the places where it is needed.  I invite you to be part of this for a one time donation.

Staffer Healthcare takes the waste of outrageous agency fees and gives it back to  you, the tax payer.  Staffer makes a fair usage charge that is used exclusively to positively impact as many lives as possible on a continuing basis.

I have the experience and network to make Staffer the huge success that it deserves and is destined to be.

I am building Staffer on the principles of oneness and fairness.  I am following the examples given to the world by Mohammad Yunus by creating a sustainable business that exists for the benefit of all of us instead of its own interests.  

Staffer will play its part in fuelling the shift from the old industrial business model to the conscious value creating business model that is emerging and connecting us in new exciting ways.  Staffer is your opportunity to contribute and impact the future in a pervasive and powerful way.

You can see just how powerful watsi.org is by taking a look at the contribution page of my other business interests.

When a patient is funded on watsi.org the donator receives an email once the treatment has been delivered, it looks like this and is a joy to receive in your inbox at the end of a hard day.



Marchelie's treatment was a success!

Marchelie, the baby girl from Haiti whose healthcare you funded on Watsi, received surgery to repair the defect in her heart. “During surgery,… Read More »


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is to get to market before anyone else does, and I am sure I am not the only one thinking  along the lines of Staffer.  However, I believe that this risk is mitigated by the social nature of Staffer and all that will use it and be part of the value chain.

This kind of technology is more or less "off the shelf" these days.  The success of this project lies in the deployment.  We will adopt a similar city by city approach that Uber.com used in it's early days.  We will focus initially on the small care home operator who is being squeezed by regulation and high costs, who will instantly experience the benefit to their business and clients.

Our initial market research has indicated a 100% adoption rate which is unusual for any service or app, but the reasons are clear an undeniable.

My background in healthcare and technology will be of benefit to this project as I have both the skills and experience to get Staffer out there quickly.  Once we have Staffer in 10 sites we will very vocally, confidently and quickly make our way around the care home community via a series of talks and exhibitions.  We will visit prospects and show them real time metrics and date illustrating the instant and huge savings they can make right there by downloading  and using the app.

Just so that you understand, Staffer is a managed service that protects both the buyer and Nurse by completing compliance checks on all Nurses which includes PIN validation and criminal records checks.  No non compliant Nurse will ever be allowed to use Staffer.

To make sure we get rapid and deep market penetration we will use an outsourced call centre service to market the App directly to buyers in the private sector.

Nurses and other health care professionals will be encouraged by the buyers to register in order to continue working.  We will recruit more Nurses via social media activities, word of mouth, Youtube adverts and PR/news stories in relative media titles.

Other Ways You Can Help

Staffer ia not just about saving the buyer cash, it directly impacts you in many unseen ways.  Health services and care home costs are spiralling daily due to the cost of temp agencies.  This takes money away from wards, treatments, essential services and depletes local funds.

It is up to you, me and anyone who is involved in Staffer in the future to turn this round and put and end to it.

Here are other ways you can help.

  • Shout about Staffer everywhere, make sure you are heard.
  • Use the power of social media to spread the word.
  • If you are a journalist or writer, create some compelling articles.
  • If you know a Nurse, get them to pre-register at staffer.healthcare.
  • If you own a care home,  pre-register at staffer.healthcare.
  • If you are a designer and want to help, get in touch.
  • If you are a web designer with a tendency toward philanthropy, help.
  • If you have any experience that would help, get in touch.
  • Get everyone you know to donate £1
  • Can you give us 10 hours of telephone canvassing to buyers ?
  • Are you an FD who will work on this with me for nothing ?
  • Are you a marketing guru with some time to commit FOC ?
  • Are you a celeb who wants to get behind this powerful project ?

Come with me right now and let's save a million lives, reduce our tax burdens, future our planet and be part of the Shift.


www.staffer.healthcare
story_txt:
Short Summary In 2014 the NHS spent an eyewatering £5.5bn of taxpayers money on Temp Nurses and allied health care professionals.  The private sector spent a similar insane amount.   
Most of the hourly rate charged by these agencies are fees.  Some reports show that Nurses who were paid just £19 ph are being charged out at £45 ph.  The worst highligthed case being £155 ph. This is not unique to the UK, it happens everywhere including the USA, AUS, EU and it is time this travesty ended.
My name is Stephen Soos, I am the founder and CEO of Diamond Cutter Ltd which owns Staffer Healthcare.  I am developing a managed peer to peer app that connects the buyer of temp services directly to the temp Nurse.  Called Staffer and similar in paradigm to Uber.com, Staffer instantly saves the buyer and taxpayer vast sums the second it is downloaded and deployed on any smart device or PC.


Staffer decentralises the provision of temp staff and puts control directly in the hands of the Buyer and the Nurse.  All direct and hidden costs are instantly eliminated the instant Staffer is downloaded and used.
We aim to release Staffer in London in Dec 2015, quickly followed by the rest of the UK, EU and other regions in 2016/17
Staffer will become a wholly owned subsidiary of Diamond Cutter ltd in August and will make it's money by adding just £/$1 per shift hour worked to the standard pay rate of the temp worker.
Staffer Healthcare (Ltd) is a social business.  That's the same as a normal business because it will make money, pay it's taxes and a fair working wage, but ALL net profits go to saving lives of patients in the developing world via our partner www.watsi.org, and to educating Dr's, Nurses, Dentists etc via our partner www.watchmego.org.
Unlike donating to charity, your money will be used to create a sustainable and profitable business that acts as a conduit of continuous funds for the above life changing crowdfunding sites.  Staffer massively reduces the burden on the tax payer and remove the carbon dumped annually into the atmosphere by 1000's of temp agencies around the world. 
In summary your donation will:-
 Save the tax payer £/$bn's pa.
Save lives in developing countries by paying directly for medical care. 
Dramatically reduce the cost of health care service provision.
Help educate 1,000's of Dr's, Nurses, Dentist etc. Removes the hidden admin costs of hiring temps.
Gives the Nurse and buyer instant control and removes the middle man.  Staffer is a highly disruptive technology that makes agencies obsolete and has an instant dramatic and far reaching impact on our wallets, lives, planet.     What We Need & What You Get I have funded the initial planning and development and need a further £100,000 to finish the app, hire a small team and deploy Staffer inside the M25 in Dec 2015.  Here is where funds will be used.  £30,000 to finish the Staffer

story:
Us

Couve Cycle was created by Michael and Maureen Palensky, a husband/wife team who grew up in Washington.  Both bring many years of service and entertainment experience to the business.  Michael has been in the Vancouver area since 1976 and has watched the area grow and change over the years.  He earned his Master's Degree in Audiology and successfully owned and operated a mobile disc jockey business for over 20 years. Maureen worked in the service industry, in many downtown locations, while earning her Degree in Nursing. She is currently working as an ER nurse in Vancouver.  Michael and Maureen are excited about being part of the growth and change in Vancouver. 


The bike

Couve Cycle is a multi-passenger, pedal powered bicycle that is designed to tour people around downtown Vancouver in an exciting and new way, while showcasing many of the local establishments. The bike has electronic assist that will kick in when needed. This type of bike is unique, in that the passengers are facing each other while they are pedaling. Our goal is to provide a fun, new form of entertainment and add to the growth of Vancouver. Keep it local!! We love our town and we want to show it off!

We are passionate about bringing this bike and MORE to downtown Vancouver.  We have seen the city and the culture change drastically over the past few years and with the influx of new establishments and events, we feel our bike will compliment and enhance the whole Vancouver experience.
The bike has been purchased and construction is underway (www.thepartybike.com)!!  We now need your help to get the wheels rolling and turn our vision into reality! Every donation, big or small, will contribute to the economy and growth of downtown Vancouver.



What We Need & What You Get

Even if we don't reach our goal, your contribution will make a huge impact! Every dollar makes a difference! Although the most important piece of the business has been purchased, there's a little more we need to get this bike rollin'.  The more funds we receive, the more fantastic COUVE CYCLE will be!!

What exactly will your money be used for??

  • Shipment of bike from Arizona to Vancouver
  • Storage container for housing bike
  • Optional helmets
  • Rental space
  • Bike maintenance and parts
  • Inclement weather cover
  • Ipad for booking and waiver signing
  • Signage/advertising
  • Insurance- YOWZA
  • Down payment for second bike

Again, any kind of donation or "shout out" helps.  We have lots of swag that we would like to offer out, as well as opportunities to book the bike before my website calendar goes live.  This will make sure you can lock in that special day before anybody else gets a chance! 


The Impact

We have watched this city change and we have witnessed what people are enjoying and what brings the crowds to downtown Vancouver.  We want to see this area and the local businesses thrive.  We feel that our business will compliment all of the change and it will encourage more downtown commerce as well as connect many of the businesses and districts.  We plan to be that "new bridge" that everybody is wanting.  (there is some humor in there somewhere)  Our plan is to bridge the gap between Uptown Village, Downtown, Officer's Row and the Fort, and eventually the new waterfront project!  We are excited to see that materialize.  

There is a lot of buzz out there in the streets.  We have heard your voice.  We love the concept of the "party bike" and it sounds like you do too!  Everywhere we go, our dreams and ideas are excepted with a great deal of enthusiasm.  Vancouver is ready for this!  


Risks & Challenges

As with any new business, there is risk.  We took on a huge risk with purchasing the bike, however we are confident that this business will be a success.  We have listened to what people want and we have seen this type of business thrive all over the U.S.  We expect to have a great first year.  There will be a learning curve for us as we iron out all of the details of the business.  It is hard to plan the business, without having something tangible in your hands....like maybe a bike!  Construction will be done in early March.  At that point, we can get the bike up here and start testing it out, to seeing how far it will travel and what hills we can conquer.  Trial and error!   We will also be meeting with local venues to work out the details and discuss expectations and concerns from parties.  It will be fun to watch this business morph and expand.  


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!!!  MAKE SOME NOISE!!!  We understand that a lot of people can't donate at this time, or might be skeptical of this new business idea, but that shouldn't stop you from spreading the news.  We love all of the support we have received already by our Facebook and Twitter followers.  Keep up the good work! Please use the Indiegogo share tools also.  Anything helps!

Thank you so much!

                                            See you on COUVE CYCLE!!!!!


                               *Lyla, Maureen ("Mo"), Lucy, and Michael Palensky*

Please use the Indiegogo share tools also.  Anything helps!
Thank you so much!

story:
Salma is born by our own experiencie facing natural disasters in Chile. In recent years our country and much of the planet has been plagued by a great quantity of earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, landslides, forest fires, and other situations that have threaten the lives of millions of people.

The consequences during and after these events are:

·  Thousands of people missing or dead, found days, weeks or even months after the disaster, creating suffering and concern of families, friends, and a whole country.

·  High monetary costs and reaction times to be assumed by governments.

·  Authorities and rescue agencies do not have reliable and precise information, facing twice the difficulties to search for missing persons.

·  Thousands of volunteers working on debris removal and search of missing persons.

Therefore, we are developing our technology platform called Salma, whereby we wish to give a simple and efficient tool to provide users with prevention and aid in a disaster case.

How we will make it possible?

Technology Platform:

·  Our platform will generate a database on Web servers, powered by a mobile application installed on each user device.

·  When the app is installed, each user generates its matrix of priority contacts; family, friends or others, to which the application notifies massively when the user needs help.

Operation:

·  With just shaking your Smartphone , each user can access the "panic button" Salma , from which they can send a signal "early warning" massively and automaticly , enabling open communication with your family or friends to a possible catastrophe .

·  Each user belonging to the matrix of contacts from which the alarm has been activated has then received a preventive message stating name and geographical location of the person who sent the alarm.

·  Users who send alert, are integrated and categorized in our database as "possible victims" and if this condition persists over time, the system switches to alert conditions to generate search and rescue actions by the relevant agencies.

Characteristics:

·  Salma delivers early information on the areas that are being affected by a disaster, with individual data for each user, your geo-location and status. Being able to provide timely information to rescuers.

·  Salma can contribute to peace and calm in the population, to have information and direct channels with those who are affected, if the communications conditions permit.

Salma always acts in two ways:

·  Prevention: indicates the geographic location of the person sending the message early warning, which is not associated with a requirement necessary relief and rescue, but if timely notification to avoid a tragedy. "Salma function is not to provide advance notice of any natural event. Salma function is to keep connecting and locatable people during a natural event".

·  Assistance: to indicate that the person requires rescue help. The person can be with or without communication ( disappeared).

What we need and what you get:

We need to raise US $ 80,000 to pay what we need develop of our mobile application, cover the maintenance of the Web server where is hosted our database and pay for the maintenance and operation of the system for at least two years since its launch.

By our tradition and humanitarian values​​, the development of this system has a strong social character, however funding is needed to allow the system to operate or work with technological resources to ensure its operation worldwide, for that reason we need charge a price of only US $ 0.50 to each user to download Salma the first year, and from the second year of using the system, that the user pays an annuity of US $ 0.75.

The money raised will allow us to continue developing new features.

The success generated by our project , is something we want to share it with the community who provided donations in this way, and we believe that it is possible to distribute 30 % of the profits from product sales among donor people , so as not to deviate from our main objective is humanitarian aid. The amount collected by the way of 30 % will be distributed in the amount donated equivalence. Also, when we complete our development, we send each contributor, our system Salma absolutely free, to be the first privileged users who can use our system worldwide.

If you can not contribute money , don´t worry:

·  We will be equally happy if you help us to spread our project.

·  We receive happy all your feedback to improve our technological development.

We look forward to the full support of the Indiegogo community to fulfill our goal.

If we can not possibly collect all the funds, which we achieve also raise will allow us to advance in the first version of our limited project but running at low levels.

Be part of the Salma community and help us to help:

By participating with your donation or spreading our project, you will be part of a community that will allow us to prevent the loss of life in the world to natural disasters, who daily continue to spread to different latitudes of the planet.

The Salma project is integrated  by a team of social entrepreneurs. In our beginings we develop programs to help poor students , providing them with support and integration into the workplace. We were supported by the incubator Socialab social projects , they helped us to lead a proposal that marked positive changes in the lives of many young people with dreams of improvement, but with limited economic resources.

We hope that the great community Indiegogo support us with their donations and those who can not contribute money , can support our project spreading the word, only this way will raise the funds we need. As a team Salma send them a big hug.

We need
to raise US $ 80,000 to pay what we need develop of our mobile application,
cover the maintenance of the Web server where is hosted our database and pay
for the maintenance and operation of the system for at least two years since
its launch.
By our
tradition and humanitarian values​​, the development of this system has a
strong social character, however funding is needed to allow the system to
operate or work with technological resources to ensure its operation worldwide,
for that reason we need charge a price of only US $ 0.50 to each user to
download Salma the first year, and from the second year of using the system,
that the user pays an annuity of US $ 0.75.
The money
raised will allow us to continue developing new features.
The
success generated by our project , is something we want to share it with the
community who provided donations in this way, and we believe that it is
possible to distribute 30 % of the profits from product sales among donor
people , so as not to deviate from our main objective is humanitarian aid. The
amount collected by the way of 30 % will be distributed in the amount donated
equivalence. Also, when we complete our development, we send each contributor,
our system Salma absolutely free, to be the first privileged users who can use
our system worldwide.
If you can not contribute money ,
don´t worry:
· 
We will
be equally happy if you help us to spread our project.
· 
We
receive happy all your feedback to improve our technological development.
We look
forward to the full support of the Indiegogo community to fulfill our goal.
If we can
not possibly collect all the funds, which we achieve also raise will allow us
to advance in the first version of our limited project but running at low
levels.Be part of the Salma community and help us to help:

By
participating with your donation or spreading our project, you will be part of
a community that will allow us to prevent the loss of life in the world to
natural disasters, who daily continue to spread to different latitudes of the
planet.
The Salma
project is integrated  by a team of
social entrepreneurs. In our beginings we develop programs to help poor
students , providing them with support and integration into the workplace. We
were supported by the incubator Socialab social projects , they helped us to
lead a proposal that marked positive changes in the lives of many young people
with dreams of improvement, but with limited economic resources.
We hope
that the great community Indiegogo support us with their donations and those
who can not contribute money , can support our project spreading the word, only
this way will raise the funds we need. As a team Salma send them a big hug.

story:
What kind of Guerrilla is this?

Our answer to you is simple. It's a funky one.
Funky Guerrilla is the brand of one of the first clothing social enterprises in Bosnia and Herzegovina. The company is completely owned by Udruženje Most, a non-profit association based in the Municipality of Gradiška which works in the local community following the principles of tolerance, solidarity and sustainable development.


The Funky Guerrilla clothing is more than a brand, it is a way to generate employment opportunities and income and to invest that money where it is needed the most - in different community projects implemented by Association Most. 

Funky Guerrilla is the way to dress you have always been waiting for: hand tailored items with a unique design developed by the creative Guerrilla team.  Hoodies, T-shirts and dresses that put together local competencies and high quality materials!


Guerrilla Mission

Since 2009, all of the projects implemented by "Most" were oriented towards local youth and children and have been shaped by one clear mission: providing opportunities and making new generations of active citizens. Together with many volunteers, we have developed numerous local and international youth and environmental projects. Recently, we have started to provide social service in terms of preventive work with children coming from families with different social problems. We help them integrate, regardless of their background, and become aware of their rights and that they are equal, while at the same time we teach them to learn and to respect other people as well as the environment they live in.

In 2013 the team started the initiative to work on youth employment - a burning issue in Bosnia and Herzegovina. In 2014 the idea to make a social enterprise and create jobs through establishing a local production facilities and creating a totally new clothing brand came true. Now Funky Guerrilla employs 6 people and has the capacity to grow even more with your support.


How the Guerrilla works

In being a social enterprise we are putting our focus on two main pillars of our work: the first being to keep on maintaining a sustainable and profitable business and  the second to use the profits we gain not for our personal good, but to invest in community work and social services that we find extremely important.

When we created Funky Guerrilla, we decided to reinvest the 50% of the profit in the production, which can enable the job opportunities for more people and improve our facility and products, and other 50% in the activities we are carrying on in Most, developing new project or enhancing the ones we already have. In other words, we are trying to face the high level of unemployment that affects BiH and we invest what we get from the business for the good of the community.



What do you do with my money and what do I get?!

#SupportGuerrilla is a campaign with a clear mission: with your support we want to raise 21.000$ to invest in our social enterprise in order to create 3 new permanent job opportunities in Funky Guerrilla production facilities for women coming from the rural area, and with spreading Funky Guerrilla to a wider market in Bosnia and Herzegovina and potentially even beyond. 
Consequently, this investment will help us gain a higher income which will again invest in creating even more job opportunities and a stable financial support for our community activities.


The Perks



 

We have developed a clear road-map of where we want to go with Funky Guerrilla and the investment we get. We want to provide more job opportunities, we want Funky Guerrilla to spread across Bosnia and Herzegovina, and we go over the top of our goal we will also directly invest in social services we provide. 



Yeah, nice. But why should I care?

What comes to your mind when you think about Bosnia? War, ethnic hatreds, poverty? Well, twenty years after the end of the conflict, the idea you have in mind might not be that right. Even though several problems are still affecting our country - primarily unemployment - the Guerrilla decided ages ago to move forward and to invest in the future generations, trying to make things better.  

Our Guerrilla doesn’t care about your background, ethnicity or religion. Everybody is welcome. We believe that diversity is the base for any good social change. The connections we have been able to build between people here are based on solidarity, respect and cooperation, and not on religion, ethnicity or some other reasons politicians like to claim. Regardless of the level of involvement and knowledge you have of the Bosnian context, we can tell you that the most important challenge we’re facing here, right now, is unemployment - and that is why we need your help!

That is also the reason why, two years ago, we decide to set up our own clothing production, Funky Guerrilla. Becoming a social enterprise gave us the opportunity to employ young people from the area and to improve our contribution in local community regarding job creation and to build a completely new brand that would be the carrier of positive rebellion in the community. We employ young women coming from rural areas and, in other words, while we produce our Guerrilla clothes, we work on creating new forms of sociability in our local community.


What the Guerrilla exactly does for the community? 

As already stated, we contribute to our community in several ways:

Dnevni centar "Gnijezdo" - the Nest Center

Our nest Center. Here we provide daily assistance and preventive work with children coming from families with different social problems. Since last year we are carrying out a set of well planned activities aimed at strengthening their integrity and awareness, helping them to reach the formal education goals that they deserve and developing their social skills. You can follow the activities of the Nest Center by clicking here. 


Local Voluntary Service

Since its establishment "Most" is running the Local Voluntary Service, a network of young people who actively cooperate with other non-governmental organizations and public institutions and are willing to help in making good things happen. All of our volunteers - more than 300 - are enrolled in a database where they are ready to respond to the needs of the local community. So far they have provided voluntary services that reached over 10.000 beneficiaries in the local community. 

Budi Muško Klub - Be a Man Club

Be a Man Club is the free space where high school students can freely use their creativity and skills, as well as they are capable to share their thoughts and concerns. It is a regular activity which gives members the opportunity to confront and talk to each other, but more importantly, it is the place where they activate themselves as citizens,  working to spread awareness of real life values and learning that violence and destructiveness is a virtue of the weak. More info available here.

Mobility projects 

The relation our association has with the world of mobility project goes back to the beginning of our NGO experience. We believe that having an international experience and meeting people from different countries can also change young people for the better. That is the reason why we participated in more than 30 mobility projects sending more than 100 people abroad to share knowledge, experiences, skills and friendship with their peers from all around Europe. We have used the European mobility opportunities to do this and now we are the organization in charge of the ERASMUS+ “Social Entrepreneurship for Social Changes” (2016-2017) project developed together with different organizations from 12 European countries. 


A space for non-formal learning

We have created a space where non-formal learning happens on an everyday basis. From guitar and music lessons, language courses, environmental workshops end festivals, to film screenings, exchange of goods, various creative workshops on how to produce and recycle things, etc. You name we had it.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
A Family-Owned, Small-Batch, Craft Distillery In Napa, CA

We are preparing to open a New Distillery & Grand Tasting Salon.
Our second location will offer behind the scenes distillery tours, specialty craft spirits tastings, a cocktail bar, and cocktail crafting classes.

Napa Valley Distillery stands for community, craft spirits, education, friendship, and fun.

We believe that great spirits and cocktails create community and you, our customers, are why have stuck with it! Our goal is to create new experiences where people feel as connected to us, and to our products, as they do to one another.

Our Origin Story

We Are The First, And Only, Distillery In Napa Since Prohibition

After working as a limo driver, a Vegas stick man, and life insurance salesman, Napa Valley Distillery founder and front man Arthur Hartunian began Napa Valley Limoncello Company over a Poker bet!

Long story short, NV Limoncello Company grew into Napa Valley Distillery and in 2014 we launched the first legal craft spirits tasting salon in California.

Arthur is also one of the founding members of the California Artisanal Distillers Guild which protects and enhances the rights of all CA craft distilleries.

A Bit More About Us...We Are Full Of SPIRIT!

Together we are: Arthur & Lulu Hartunian (Founders/CEO), Ian Winget (Marketing), and Paul Martin (Brand Ambassador), Shel Strickland (Girl Friday), Zach Lafaille & Tim Espinoza (Distillers), Amanda Mizirawi & Beth Martin (Bar Club Support), Theodore Alexander & Tim Johnston (Bar Shop Staff), and Carlos Sac (Production).

From a family of five to a staff of 12; Arthur and Lulu Hartunian have spent the last eight years of their lives building Napa Valley Distillery into a premier destination distillery for both tourists and Napa residents alike.

We are now in the final stages of our first major expansion as we build out our New Distillery and Grand Tasting Salon, and we need your contributions to finish the job.

What Have Accomplished So Far?

In Less Than A Year, We Have Gone From This:

To This:

Pretty Impressive, Isn't It?

?

So Why Aren't We Open Yet?

We Are Over Budget & Out Of Time

Due to many unexpected Napa City & County building requirements, we were forced to cancel our Grand Opening in January 2016 in order to begin completing those requirements.

This meant making major changes to the structure and interior of our New Distillery and Grand Tasting Salon. These unfortunate setbacks have cost us dearly in both lost time and money and threaten to permanently inhibit our ability to complete our full expansion...
and we are SO close and have SO dang much to offer you! 

This Is Where You Come In

What Do We Need?

We Need Pennies From Heaven

Your contributions, passion, and excitement are indispensable to the completion and launch of our new Distillery. We are thrilled for you to join the Napa Valley Distillery Family!

We are seeking $35,000 to complete several vital building requirements including:

 

Fire Sprinklers: $10K – Fire Department Mandated

Trash Shed: $5K - City Mandated

Tanks: $5K - For increased production and efficiency

Private Tasting Lounge: $5K - For our Indiegogo Contributors & Club Members

Final Touches: $10K - On several existing construction projects

Any extra funds we raise will go towards job creation.
This will allow us to create new products and customer experiences for YOU!

What Do You Get In Addition To Our Gratitude?

Awe Inspiring Perks Of Course!

We are so excited about the Perks* that we are offering to our contributors. From a private tour and tasting with our founder Arthur Hartunian, bottles of spirits, a sample box from our Bar Club, Membership to our Bar Club to a full barrel of spirits for your enjoyment! There’s really no better way to become part of our revolutionary Distillery than by getting one of these Perks* through your Indiegogo contribution. The time is nigh and the clock is ticking.

Oh boy, if we don’t reach our goal of $35,000, all the monies we do receive will go towards completing these projects. Without your contribution, it will take us much, much longer to complete them; if we can complete them at all.

The Impact Of Our Campaign

We are excited to share all that the New Distillery & Grand Tasting Salon have to offer with you and other guests.

The success of this project is of paramount importance for Arthur, Lulu, and the entire NVD Family,  as we have struggled, toiled, and given our blood, sweat, and tears for the past year, trying to finish our expansion.

Napa Valley Distillery is our life, but this project has a greater impact.
Here is how we contribute to our community:

Job Creation: As a small business on the verge of a huge growth spurt, Napa Valley Distillery plans on doubling the number of employees in 2017 and possibly again in 2018.

Supporting Local Economy: NVD supports the local economy by spending tens of thousands of dollars each year in Napa, and throughout California.

Supporting Small Businesses: NVD’s retail operation supports hundreds of small business that produce the products that we sell. We are the largest bricks-and-mortar retailer of hand-crafted cocktail bitters, syrups, mixers, and shrubs in the US.

Risks & Challenges

The main risk for our company if we do not achieve our Indiegogo Project Goal is that it could take so long to complete each of our individual projects that the current rent of our new Distillery will cause our company to drastically slow down.

We have achieved so much since our humble beginnings, and our new distillery is the culmination of years of planning and hard work.

We Need You! Yes, YOU!

Here Are Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some serious noise about our campaign.

Post us on Twitter, Facebook, and Gryzzl

Remind your friends, family, loved ones, and even enemies, to use the Indiegogo share tools below!

The Only Rule Is:

Post Early & Post Often!

That's all there is to it. Easy Peasy.

Join Our Spirited Revolution TODAY!

Cheers!

*A Word About Our Perks

You must be 21+ to contribute to our Indiegogo campaign AND to receive your Perks.

All tours and tastings must be booked in advance with approval confirmation. NVD will send surveys regarding Perks to collect spirits / bottled cocktails choices if appropriate. Some restrictions apply and not all spirits will be available through our Indiegogo Campaign Perk Program. For pickup options or other questions please email us at cs@napadistillery.com.

story:
Grannys Attic Treasures is a small mom and pop retro shop on Ottawa Street in Hamilton. We are now in our 8th  year and still loving every minute of it. We hunt out and find the most unique retro items, whether it's a 50's kitchen set, tree trunk coffee tables, funky lights, gorgeous vintage crystal and even suitcase end tables. If it's different, we will sell it. We LOVE retro. The 1950's to the 80's are our favourite time period and we have discovered over the years, you all love and loved those years as well. 

Sadly our 15 year old truck   desperately   needs either major work or to be replaced. In the past 6 months we have had her in for numerous repairs that have required towing, including our last breakdown as we were getting onto the highway and the Upper ball joint and tire rod broke. Very scary.  With the long rough winter, we simply cannot afford the full cost of major repairs on our 15 year old truck nor the full cost to replace it. So we are humbly asking for your help.

     So that we can continue to safely travel to our destinations for our stock we come to you, our wonderful customers and friends for help. Gil has his eyes on a full size cargo van but in order for us to get it, we really do need your help. The new to us truck will still be used, after all, a store selling treasures such as ours couldn't drive a new vehicle. lol  But it will be newer, safer and much more reliable. 
We are hoping to raise $3500.00 towards it with your help. 


Your donation will NOT go unrewarded. Each and all donations will receive a Grannys Attic Treasures gift certificate for the exact same amount of your donation. Pretty cool right? 

 Your gift certificate can be used at any time on any item and any balance will be recorded for future purchases. Also for our out of town donations  we will gladly mail you a gift certificate .

We know we have the best customers and we are hoping you can all help us out  during this time so we can continue our awesome hunts to bring you, our wonderful customers, the cool retro and unique pieces of furniture, glassware, lighting , art  and just about anything different that  we can hunt out.  We also would like to thank you all for your constant support  and please know that this was and is a very difficult thing for us to have to do.  We know times are tough for so many of you so any donation amount will be appreciated.  Please share this and help us reach our goal.  

                                                        Thanks everyone
                                                              Gil and Kathy
